text: And he gave him none inheritance in it , no , not so much as to set his foot on : yet he promised that he would give it to him for a possession , and to his seed after him , when as yet he had no child .
text2: Ke Mawu metsɔ anyigba sia ƒe akpa aɖeke tete na Abraham be wo ̀ anye etɔ o . “ Boŋ la Mawu do ŋugbe nɛ be le ɣeyiɣi aɖewo megbe la , anyigba blibo la azu eya kple eƒe dzidzimeviwo tɔ , togbɔ be vi aɖeke menɔ Abrahan si haɖe o ha ̃ .

text: And God spake on this wise , That his seed should sojourn in a strange land ; and that they should bring them into bondage , and entreat them evil four hundred years .
text2: Mawu gagblɔ na Abraham be , eƒe dzidzimeviwo adzo le anyigba la dzi ayi aɖanɔ dzronyigba aɖe dzi ƒe alafa ene sɔŋ abe kluviwo ene .

text: And the nation to whom they shall be in bondage will I judge , said God : and after that shall they come forth , and serve me in this place .
text2: Ke ha ̃ Mawu do ŋugbe na Abraham be yeahe to na dukɔ si aɖe aboyo Israelviwo , eye emegbe la Israelviwo agatrɔ va woƒe anyigba la dzi ava subɔ ye le afii . ”

text: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision : and so Abraham begat Isaac , and circumcised him the eighth day ; and Isaac begat Jacob ; and Jacob begat the twelve patriarchs .
text2: Stefano yi eƒe nuƒoa dzi be , “ Mawu de se na Abraham be wo ̀ atso aʋa na via ŋutsuviwo abe nubabla si le Mawu kple Abraham ƒe dzidzimeviwo dome la ƒe kpeɖodzinu ene . Le esia ta esi Isak si nye Abraham viŋutsu xɔ ŋkeke enyi ko la , fofoa tso aʋa nɛ . Isak ƒe viŋutsue nye Yakɔb ame si ha ̃ ƒe viŋutsu wuieveawo me Israel dukɔa ƒe tɔgbui wuieveawo dzɔ tso .

text: And the patriarchs , moved with envy , sold Joseph into Egypt : but God was with him ,
text2: Yosef si nye Yakɔb vi mamlɛtɔ la ƒe nu menyo nɔvia bubuawo ŋu kura o ale wodzrae na kluvisitsalawo , ame siwo kplɔe yi Egipte abe kluvi ene . Ke ha ̃ la , Mawu nɔ kplii

text: And delivered him out of all his afflictions , and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt ; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house .
text2: ale gbegbe be wo ̀ ɖee tso eƒe fukpekpewo kata ̃ me eye gawu la , Mawu na be Egipte fia Farao kpɔ ŋudzedze le eŋu . Le nunya manyagblɔ si Mawu na Yosef ta la Farao tsɔe ɖo dudzikpɔla ga ̃ e le Egipte dukɔa me eye wo ̀ gaɖoe tatɔ le eƒe fiasa ̃ blibo la ha ̃ me . ”

text: Now there came a dearth over all the land of Egypt and Chanaan , and great affliction : and our fathers found no sustenance .
text2: Eva eme be dɔ sese ̃ aɖe va to le Egipte kple Kanan nyigba dzi ale be , mi ́ a tɔgbuitɔgbuiwo kpe fu ŋutɔ . Nuɖuɖu vɔ le wo si keŋkeŋ .

text: But when Jacob heard that there was corn in Egypt , he sent out our fathers first .
text2: Yakɔb se be nuɖuɖu le Egipte nyigba dzi ale wo ̀ dɔ viawo ɖa be woaɖaƒle ɖe vɛ .

text: And at the second time Joseph was made known to his brethren ; and Joseph ' s kindred was made known unto Pharaoh .
text2: Esi wogayi Egipte zi evelia la , Yosef ɖe eɖokui fia nɔviawo elabena womekpɔe dze sii zi gba ̃ tɔ si wode afi ma la o . Eɖe wo fia fia Farao ha ̃ .

text: Then sent Joseph , and called his father Jacob to him , and all his kindred , threescore and fifteen souls .
text2: Yosef dɔ nɔviawo ɖa be ne woyi la , woakplɔ ye fofo Yakɔb , ye nɔviwo kple woƒe ƒometɔwo kata ̃ , ame siwo ƒe xexle ̃ me nɔ ame blaadre - vɔ - atɔ ̃ la vɛ na ye le Egipte .

text: So Jacob went down into Egypt , and died , he , and our fathers ,
text2: Esiae na be Yakɔb kple viawo kata ̃ ʋu va tsi Egipte afi si wo kata ̃ ku ɖo .

text: And were carried over into Sychem , and laid in the sepulchre that Abraham bought for a sum of money of the sons of Emmor the father of Sychem .
text2: Eye wotsɔ Yakɔb kple viawo va Sikem eye woɖi wo ɖe yɔdo si Abraham ƒle le Hemor viwo gbɔ la me . ”

text: But when the time of the promise drew nigh , which God had sworn to Abraham , the people grew and multiplied in Egypt ,
text2: Esime ɣeyiɣi si Mawu ɖo na Abraham be yeaɖe eƒe dzidzimeviwo tso kluvinyenye me le Egipte ɖo vɔ la Israelviwo gadzi ɖe edzi fu ̃ ŋutɔ le Egipte .

text: Till another king arose , which knew not Joseph .
text2: Ke dzɔgbevɔ ̃ etɔe la woɖo fia bubu zikpuia dzi le Egipte . Fia sia menya naneke tso Yosef ŋu o .

text: The same dealt subtilly with our kindred , and evil entreated our fathers , so that they cast out their young children , to the end they might not live .
text2: Le esia ta ewɔ tamesese ̃ le mi ́ a tɔgbuitɔgbuiwo ŋu ale gbegbe be wo ̀ na wowu woƒe vidzi ̃ wo .

text: In which time Moses was born , and was exceeding fair , and nourished up in his father ' s house three months :
text2: ” Le ɣeyiɣi sia me lɔƒo la , wodzi Mose si nye ɖevi dzeɖekɛ aɖe . Le se si nɔ anyi ɣemaɣi me ta la , esi wodzi Mose la , edzilawo ɣlae ɖe xɔ me ɣleti etɔ ̃ sɔŋ .

text: And when he was cast out , Pharaoh ' s daughter took him up , and nourished him for her own son .
text2: Ke esi wo ̀ va dzɔ be womagate ŋu aɣlae o ta la , wotsɔe yi ɖada ɖe teƒe aɖe . Fia Farao vinyɔnuvi va fɔe le afi ma ale wo ̀ tsɔe abe via ene hekpɔ edzi .

text: And Moses was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians , and was mighty in words and in deeds .
text2: Wohe Mose ɖe Egiptetɔwo ƒe nunya nu ale wo ̀ tsi va zu fiavi xɔŋkɔ aɖe le nunya kple dɔwɔwɔ me .

text: And when he was full forty years old , it came into his heart to visit his brethren the children of Israel .
text2: ” Esi Mose xɔ abe ƒe blaene ene la , ewɔ susu gbe ɖeka be yeaɖi tsa aɖakpɔ ye nɔvi Israelviwo ɖa .

text: And seeing one of them suffer wrong , he defended him , and avenged him that was oppressed , and smote the Egyptian :
text2: Le tsaɖiɖi sia me la eva ke ɖe Israel ɖakakpui aɖe kple Egiptetɔ aɖe ŋu wonɔ dzre wɔm . Mose kpɔe be Egiptetɔ la nɔ Israel ɖekakpuia ƒom nɔ funyafunya wɔmii eya ta edze Egiptetɔ la dzi hewui .

text: For he supposed his brethren would have understood how that God by his hand would deliver them : but they understood not .
text2: Mose bui be wɔna sia ana be Israelviwo axɔe se be Mawue ɖo ye ɖa be yeava ɖe wo le aboyo me hafi gake womexɔe nenema o . ”

text: And the next day he shewed himself unto them as they strove , and would have set them at one again , saying , Sirs , ye are brethren ; why do ye wrong one to another ?
text2: Le ŋufɔke la Mose gaɖi tsa yi etɔ Israelviwo gbɔ . Kasiaa , ekpɔ Israelvi dzidzi eve ha ̃ wonɔ dzre wɔm vevie . Mose te ɖe wo ŋu enumake be yeale ́ avu le wo dome . Egblɔ na wo be , ‘ Nɔviwo , menyo kura be miawo ɖeɖe mianɔ dzre wɔm alea o eya ta midzudzɔ ne miawɔ ɖeka . ’ ”

text: But he that did his neighbour wrong thrust him away , saying , Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us ?
text2: Ke ame siawo dometɔ si ƒe nya medzɔ o la gblɔ na Mose be wo ̀ akpɔ eya ŋutɔ ƒe nya gbɔ eye megade nu yewo tɔ me o . Ebia Mose be , ‘ Ame kae ɖo wo ̀ fia kple ʋɔnudrɔla ɖe mi ́ a dzi ? ’ Eyi dzi bia Mose be ,

text: Wilt thou kill me , as thou diddest the Egyptian yesterday ?
text2: ‘ Alo ɖe ne ̀ di be yeaƒo nye ha ̃ awu abe ale si ne ̀ wu Egiptetɔ ma etsɔ enea ? ”

text: Then fled Moses at this saying , and was a stranger in the land of Madian , where he begat two sons .
text2: Nya sia sese te ɖe Mose dzi ale gbegbe be wo ̀ si dzo le nutomea yi ɖanɔ Midian nyigba dzi afi si wo ̀ dzi eƒe viŋutsu eveawo le .

text: And when forty years were expired , there appeared to him in the wilderness of mount Sina an angel of the Lord in a flame of fire in a bush .
text2: Le ƒe blaene megbe la , mawudɔla aɖe ɖe eɖokui fia Mose le gbedzi le teƒe aɖe si te ɖe Sinai to la ŋu . Mawudɔla la ɖe eɖokui fiae le gbe aɖe si le dzo bim la me .

text: When Moses saw it , he wondered at the sight : and as he drew near to behold it , the voice of the Lord came unto him ,
text2: Esi Mose kpɔ dzobibia la , ewɔ nuku nɛ ŋutɔ eya ta eƒu du yi teƒea be yeakpɔ nu si wo ̀ nye . Ke esi wo ̀ ƒu dua yina la , ese Mawu ƒe gbe bena .

text: Saying , I am the God of thy fathers , the God of Abrham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob . Then Moses trembled , and durst not behold .
text2: ‘ Nyee nye tɔgbuiwo ̀ wo Abraham , Isak kple Yakɔb ƒe Mawu la . ’ Dzidzi ƒo Mose ale gbegbe be mete ŋu fɔ ta be yeakpɔ afi si gbea le ɖiɖim tso la o .

text: Then said the Lord to him , Put off thy shoes from thy feet : for the place where thou standest is holy ground .
text2: Mawu ƒe gbe yi edzi gblɔ nɛ be , ‘ Đe wo ̀ afɔkpawo le afɔ elabena teƒe si ne ̀ le la nye teƒe kɔkɔe .

text: I have seen , I have seen the affliction of my people which is in Egypt , and I have heard their groaning , and am come down to deliver them . And now come , I will send thee into Egypt .
text2: Mekpɔ fu ga ̃ si kpem vinyewo le le Egipte nyigba dzi , eye mese woƒe nublanuiɣli si dom wole la ha ̃ . Eya ta meva be maɖe wo tso fukpekpe sia me . Va ne madɔ wo ̀ ɖe Egipte ne na ̃ wɔ dɔ sia nam ’

text: This Moses whom they refused , saying , Who made thee a ruler and a judge ? the same did God send to be a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel which appeared to him in the bush .
text2: Ale Mose si gbɔ etɔwo gbe nu le eye wobiae be , ‘ Ame kae ɖo wo ̀ fia kple ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ la ɖe mia dzi ha ̃ ? ’ la , eya kee Mawu gaɖo ɖa be wo ̀ anye woƒe ɖela kple kplɔla .

text: He brought them out , after that he had shewed wonders and signs in the land of Egypt , and in the Red sea , and in the wilderness forty years .
text2: Ale to nukunu geɖewo wɔwɔ me la , Mose kplɔ Israelviwo tso Egipte . Woto Ƒu Dzi ̃ e la me eye wozɔ mɔ to gbedzi ƒe blaene sɔŋ .

text: This is that Moses , which said unto the children of Israel , A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren , like unto me ; him shall ye hear .
text2: ” Mose ŋutɔ gblɔ na Israelviwo be , ‘ Mawu ana nyagblɔɖila aɖe adzɔ tso mia me abe nye ke ene . ’

text: This is he , that was in the church in the wilderness with the angel which spake to him in the mount Sina , and with our fathers : who received the lively oracles to give unto us :
text2: Mose ƒe nya sia va eme pɛpɛpɛ elabe esi wonɔ gbedzi nɔ yiyim la , Mose nye avule ́ la si nɔ Israelviwo kple mawudɔla si na Mawu ƒe sewo le Sinai to dzi la dome . Se si nye Agbenya lae wo ̀ na wo . ”

text: To whom our fathers would not obey , but thrust him from them , and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt ,
text2: Ke nublanuitɔe la , mi ́ a tɔgbuiwo gbe nu le Mose gbɔ eye wodi be yewoatrɔ ayi Egipte .

text: Saying unto Aaron , Make us gods to go before us : for as for this Moses , which brought us out of the land of Egypt , we wot not what is become of him .
text2: Le nyateƒe me la , woyɔ Arɔn hegblɔ nɛ be , ‘ Nɔvi , me legba siwo anye mi ́ aƒe mawu siwo akplɔ mi ́ agbugbɔ yi Egipte na mi ́ elabena mi ́ enya nu si dzɔ ɖe Mose si kplɔ mi ́ dzoe le Egipte nyigba dzi la dzi o . ’

text: And they made a calf in those days , and offered sacrifice unto the idol , and rejoiced in the works of their own hands .
text2: Eya ta wowɔ legba ɖe nyivi ƒe nɔnɔme me eye wosubɔ nu si wotsɔ woƒe asi wɔe la kple dzidzɔ blibo hesaa vɔ nɛ .

text: Then God turned , and gave them up to worship the host of heaven ; as it is written in the book of the prophets , O ye house of Israel , have ye offered to me slain beasts and sacrifices by the space of forty years in the wilderness ?
text2: ” Wɔna sia na be Mawu ha ̃ ɖe asi le wo ŋu eye wosubɔ ɣe , ɣleti kple ɣletiviwo abe woƒe mawuwo ene . Mawu bia wo to nyagblɔɖila Amos dzi be , Israelviwo , esi mienɔ gbedzi ƒe blaene sɔŋ ɖe , nyee mienɔ vɔ sam naa ?

text: Yea , ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch , and the star of your god Remphan , figures which ye made to worship them : and I will carry you away beyond Babylon .
text2: Kpao , menye nyee miesa vɔ na o ke boŋ miaƒe susuwo kata ̃ nɔ miaƒe trɔ ̃ siwo ƒe ɖewo nye , ɣletiviwo la kple miaƒe legba bubuwo ŋu . Le esia ta mana woaɖe aboyo mi , akplɔ yi abe kluviwo ene ayi keke Babilonia godo ke . ”

text: Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness , as he had appointed , speaking unto Moses , that he should make it according to the fashion that he had seen .
text2: Stefano gblɔ yi dzi be , “ Mi ́ a tɔgbuitɔgbuiwo tsɔ ɖaseɖiɖi ƒe agbadɔ la ɖe ta nɔ gbea dzi , nɔ yiyim tso teƒe yi teƒe . Wowɔ ɖaseɖiɖi ƒe agbadɔ sia abe ale si tututu Mawu ɖee fia Mose be woawɔe ene .

text: Which also our fathers that came after brought in with Jesus into the possession of the Gentiles , whom God drave out before the face of our fathers , unto the days of David ;
text2: Le ƒe aɖewo megbe esi Yosua va zu kplɔla eye wo ̀ ho aʋa ɖe Trɔ ̃ subɔdukɔwo ŋu la wotsɔ agbadɔ sia yi woƒe nɔƒe yeye si wonɔ la , eye wowɔ eŋutidɔ va se ɖe Fia David ŋɔli . ”

text: Who found favour before God , and desired to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob .
text2: Mawu yra fia David ŋutɔ , eye David ha ̃ bia be Mawu naɖe mɔ na ye yeatu gbedoxɔ ga ̃ aɖe si anɔ anyi tegbee la na eya , Yakɔb ƒe Mawu la .

text: But Solomon built him an house .
text2: Ke David vi Salomo boŋue nye ame si va tu gbedoxɔ la nɛ .

text: Howbeit the most High dwelleth not in temples made with hands ; as saith the prophet ,
text2: Ke ha ̃ la , Mawu menɔa gbedoxɔ si amegbetɔ ŋutɔ tsɔ eƒe asi tui la me o . Elabena Mawu ŋutɔ gblɔ to eƒe nyagblɔɖila Yesaya dzi be ,

text: Heaven is my throne , and earth is my footstool : what house will ye build me ? saith the Lord : or what is the place of my rest ?
text2: ‘ Nye fiazikpuie nye dziƒo eye anyigbae nye nye afɔɖodzinu . Aƒe ka ƒomevi koŋ ame ate ŋu atu nam be manɔ eme ?

text: Hath not my hand made all these things ?
text2: Alo menye nyee wɔ dziƒo kple anyigba siaa oa ? ’ ”

text: Ye stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears , ye do always resist the Holy Ghost : as your fathers did , so do ye .
text2: Stefano yi dzi gblɔ na ƒuƒoƒea be , “ Mi trɔ ̃ subɔla tosese ̃ tɔ siawo , ɖe wo ̀ le be miase ̃ dzime atsi tre ɖe Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la ŋu ɣesiaɣia ? E ̃ , alea tututu mia tɔgbuiwo wɔe nye si , eye eya ƒomevi ko wɔm miawo ha ̃ miele .

text: Which of the prophets have not your fathers persecuted ? and they have slain them which shewed before of the coming of the Just One ; of whom ye have been now the betrayers and murderers :
text2: Mitɔ asi nyagblɔɖila si yome mia tɔgbuiwo meti hewɔ fui o la dzi nam . Wowu nyagblɔɖila siwo gblɔ Mesia ƒe vava ɖi eye miawo ha ̃ miede Mesia la asi eye miewui .

text: Who have received the law by the disposition of angels , and have not kept it .
text2: E ̃ , togbɔ be mawudɔlawoe tsɔ Mawu ƒe seawo vɛ na mi ha ̃ la , mieɖo koŋ gble ̃ seawo to wo dzi dada me . ”

text: When they heard these things , they were cut to the heart , and they gnashed on him with their teeth .
text2: Stefano ƒe nya sia tɔ dzi na Yudatɔwo ƒe kplɔlawo ŋutɔ . Wodo dziku vevie henɔ nyanyram le wo ɖokuiwo me .

text: But he , being full of the Holy Ghost , looked up stedfastly into heaven , and saw the glory of God , and Jesus standing on the right hand of God ,
text2: Ke Stefano ame si me Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la yɔ fu ̃ la li eƒe ŋkuwo ɖe dzi ga ̃ a , ekpɔ Mawu ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe ga ̃ la eye Yesu nɔ tsitre ɖe Mawu ƒe nuɖusime .

text: And said , Behold , I see the heavens opened , and the Son of man standing on the right hand of God .
text2: Stefano gblɔ na ameha la be , “ Mikpɔ ɖa mekpɔ dziƒo nu ʋu eye Amegbetɔvi la tsi tre ɖe Mawu ƒe nuɖusime . ”

text: Then they cried out with a loud voice , and stopped their ears , and ran upon him with one accord ,
text2: Nya sia gado dziku na wo ŋutɔ ale wo kata ̃ wotsɔ woƒe asiwo xe tome be yewomagase nya aɖeke o . Wodze Stefano dzi henɔ ɣli dom be ame aɖeke megase eƒe nya o .

text: And cast him out of the city , and stoned him : and the witnesses laid down their clothes at a young man ' s feet , whose name was Saul .
text2: Emegbe wohee do goe le dua me be yewoaƒu kpee wo ̀ aku . Đasefowo kple amewulawo ɖe woƒe awuwo na ɖekakpui aɖe si woyɔna be Saulo la be wo ̀ akpɔ wo dzi na yewo .

text: And they stoned Stephen , calling upon God , and saying , Lord Jesus , receive my spirit .
text2: Esi kpeawo nɔ Stefano ƒe afi sia fi dzem kpamkpamkpam la , edo gbe ɖa gblɔ be , “ Aƒetɔ Yesu , xɔ nye gbɔgbɔ la . ”

text: And he kneeled down , and cried with a loud voice , Lord , lay not this sin to their charge . And when he had said this , he fell asleep .
text2: Emegbe la , edze klo eye wo ̀ do ɣli gblɔ be , “ Aƒetɔ , me ̀ gaɖo nu vɔ ̃ sia teƒe na wo o . ” Ale wo ̀ dze anyi heku .

text: And Saul was consenting unto his death . And at that time there was a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem ; and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judaea and Samaria , except the apostles .
text2: Saulo da asi ɖe Stefano wuwu sia dzi kpem . Tso gbe ma gbe dzi ko amewo dze xɔsetɔ siwo le Yerusalem la yometiti gɔme vevie eye esia na be wo kata ̃ si yi Yudea kple Samaria nutowo me negbe apostoloawo ɖeɖe koe susɔ ɖe Yerusalem .

text: And devout men carried Stephen to his burial , and made great lamentation over him .
text2: Ke Yudatɔ aɖewo siwo vɔ ̃ a Mawu la va kɔ Stefano ƒe kukua yi ɖaɖi eye wofae ŋutɔ .

text: As for Saul , he made havock of the church , entering into every house , and haling men and women committed them to prison .
text2: Ke Saulo ɖoe kplikpaa be yeagble ̃ hame la . Etsoa aƒeme yia aƒeme , le ́ a ŋutsuwo kple nyɔnuwo siaa ɖadea gaxɔ me .

text: Therefore they that were scattered abroad went every where preaching the word .
text2: Ke xɔsetɔ siwo si dzo le Yerusalem la kaka Yesu ƒe nyanyui la le afi sia afi si woyi .

text: Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria , and preached Christ unto them .
text2: Filipo ha ̃ yi Samaria eye wo ̀ ɖe gbeƒa ̃ le Yesu ŋuti na wo .

text: And the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which Philip spake , hearing and seeing the miracles which he did .
text2: Filipo wɔ nukunu geɖewo le Samaria eya ta amewo va ɖoa toe ɣesiaɣi .

text: For unclean spirits , crying with loud voice , came out of many that were possessed with them : and many taken with palsies , and that were lame , were healed .
text2: Enya gbɔgbɔ vɔ ̃ wo do goe le amewo me , eye ne wodo go le ameawo me alea la wonɔa ɣli dom sesi ̃ e . Eyɔ dɔ tekunɔwo kple la ̃ metututɔwo .

text: And there was great joy in that city .
text2: Esia wɔe be dzidzɔ blibo yɔ dua me fu ̃ .

text: But there was a certain man , called Simon , which beforetime in the same city used sorcery , and bewitched the people of Samaria , giving out that himself was some great one :
text2: Ke ŋutsu aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Simɔn va nɔ Samaria dua me ; enye afakala xɔŋkɔ aɖe le eƒe nukunuwo ta , eya ŋutɔ da ŋkɔ ɖe eɖokui dzi be yenye ga ̃ .

text: To whom they all gave heed , from the least to the greatest , saying , This man is the great power of God .
text2: Amewo kata ̃ ku ɖe eŋu , ame ŋkutawo kple ame gblɔewo siaa eye woda ŋkɔ ɖe edzi be , “ Ame siae nye Mawu ƒe ŋuse ̃ si woyɔna be Ŋuse ̃ Ga ̃ la ” .

text: And to him they had regard , because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries .
text2: Amewo dze eyome hoo elabena enaa be wo nu kuna to eƒe afakaka la me ɣeyiɣi didi aɖe .

text: But when they believed Philip preaching the things concerning the kingdom of God , and the name of Jesus Christ , they were baptized , both men and women .
text2: Ke esi dua me tɔwo se Filipo ƒe nya la , woxɔe se be Yesu boŋue nye Mesia la . Woxɔ nya siwo Filipo gblɔ tso Mawufiaɖuƒe la ŋu ha ̃ dzi se eya ta wode mawutsi ta na ŋutsuwo kple nyɔnuwo siaa .

text: Then Simon himself believed also : and when he was baptized , he continued with Philip , and wondered , beholding the miracles and signs which were done .
text2: Nukutɔe la , Simɔn , afakala la , ŋutɔ ha ̃ xɔ mawunya dzi se ale wode mawutsi ta nɛ . Le esia megbe la enɔ Filipo ŋu kplikplikpli yia afi sia afi si wo ̀ yina la , eye nukunu siwo kata ̃ Filipo wɔ la na be eƒe nu ku ŋutɔ .

text: Now when the apostles which were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God , they sent unto them Peter and John :
text2: Esi apostolo siwo le Yerusalem se be mawunya ɖo Samaria la , woɖo Petro kple Yohanes ɖa be woaɖakpɔ ale si nuwo nɔ edzi yimii le afi ma ɖa .

text: Who , when they were come down , prayed for them , that they might receive the Holy Ghost :
text2: Esime ame dɔdɔawo va ɖo Samaria tete ko la , wodo gbe ɖa ɖe xɔsetɔ yeyeawo ta be woaxɔ Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la ,

text: ( For as yet he was fallen upon none of them : only they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus . )
text2: elabena tsi ko wode ta na wo le Aƒetɔ Yesu ƒe ŋkɔ me ke womexɔ Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la haɖe o .

text: Then laid they their hands on them , and they received the Holy Ghost .
text2: Esi Petro kple Yohanes nɔ gbea dom ɖa la , woda woƒe asiwo ɖe xɔsetɔawo dzi , eye enumake woxɔ Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la .

text: And when Simon saw that through laying on of the apostles ' hands the Holy Ghost was given , he offered them money ,
text2: Esi Simɔn kpɔ be wona Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe amewo to Apostoloawo ƒe asidada ɖe wo dzi me la , ena ga Apostoloawo eye wo ̀ gblɔ na wo be ,

text: Saying , Give me also this power , that on whomsoever I lay hands , he may receive the Holy Ghost .
text2: “ Mina ŋuse ̃ sia nye ha ̃ ale be ame sia ame si dzi mada asi ɖo la naxɔ Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la . ”

text: But Peter said unto him , Thy money perish with thee , because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money .
text2: Petro ɖo eŋu nɛ be , “ Wo ̀ ga natsrɔ ̃ kpli wo ̀ elabena e ̀ bu be yeate ŋu aƒle Mawu ƒe nunana kple ga !

text: Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter : for thy heart is not right in the sight of God .
text2: Wɔƒe kple gomekpɔkpɔ aɖeke mele asiwo ̀ le subɔsubɔdɔ sia me o elabena wo ̀ dzi menyo le Mawu ƒe ŋkume o .

text: Repent therefore of this thy wickedness , and pray God , if perhaps the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee .
text2: Dzudzɔ tame vɔ ̃ ɖi ɖoɖo ne na ̃ do gbe ɖa na Aƒetɔ la . Đewohi ̃ atsɔ wo ̀ susu vɔ ̃ ɖi sia ake wo ̀ .

text: For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness , and in the bond of iniquity .
text2: Elabena edze nam ƒa ̃ a be e ̀ yɔ fu ̃ u kple vevesese eye ne ̀ nye kluvi na nu vɔ ̃ . ”

text: Then answered Simon , and said , Pray ye to the Lord for me , that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me .
text2: Simɔn ɖo eŋu be , “ Do gbe ɖa na Aƒetɔ la ɖe tanye be nu siwo miegblɔ la dometɔ aɖeke madzɔ ɖe dzinye o . ” "

text: And they , when they had testified and preached the word of the Lord , returned to Jerusalem , and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans .
text2: Petro kple Yohanes nɔ Samaria hegblɔ mawunya se ̃ hafi gatrɔ yi Yerusalem . Wotɔ ɖe Samaria kɔƒe geɖewo ha ̃ me le mɔa dzi , hegblɔ nyanyui la na amewo le afi siawo ha ̃ .

text: And the angel of the Lord spake unto Philip , saying , Arise , and go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from Jerusalem unto Gaza , which is desert .
text2: Ke le Filipo gome la , mawudɔla aɖe va gblɔ nɛ be , " “ Tso na ̃ yi mɔ si tso Yerusalem heto Gaza gbegbe la dzi . ”

text: And he arose and went : and , behold , a man of Ethiopia , an eunuch of great authority under Candace queen of the Ethiopians , who had the charge of all her treasure , and had come to Jerusalem for to worship ,
text2: Filipo wɔ abe ale si wogblɔ nɛ la ene eye kasia ekpɔ ame aɖe si tso Yerusalem gbɔna le mɔa dzi . Ame siae nye Etiopia ŋutsu aɖe , si nye fianyɔnu Kandake ƒe gadzikpɔla ga ̃ la . Etso Yerusalem afi si wo ̀ yi ɖawɔ subɔsubɔ le Mawu ƒe gbedoxɔ la me ,

text: Was returning , and sitting in his chariot read Esaias the prophet .
text2: eye wo ̀ trɔ va yina aƒe . Esi wo ̀ nɔ mɔa dzi la enɔ Nyagblɔɖila Yesaya ƒe agbale ̃ xle ̃ m sesi ̃ e le eƒe tasiaɖam me .

text: Then the Spirit said unto Philip , Go near , and join thyself to this chariot .
text2: Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la gagblɔ na Filipo be , “ Te ɖe tasiaɖam la ŋu . ”

text: And Philip ran thither to him , and heard him read the prophet Esaias , and said , Understandest thou what thou readest ?
text2: Esi wo ̀ ɖe abla te ɖe tasiaɖam la ŋu eye wo ̀ se nu si xle ̃ m ŋutsua le la , Filipo biae be , “ E ̀ se nu si xle ̃ m ne ̀ le la gɔmea ? ”

text: And he said , How can I , except some man should guide me ? And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him .
text2: Etiopia ŋutsua ɖo eŋu nɛ be , “ Ao , nɔvi , ale ke wɔ mate ŋu ase egɔme le esime ame aɖeke meli aɖe eme nam o ? ” Azɔ eɖe kuku na Filipo be wo ̀ age ɖe tasiaɖam la me anɔ ye xa . Filipo wɔ nenema .

text: The place of the scripture which he read was this , He was led as a sheep to the slaughter ; and like a lamb dumb before his shearer , so opened he not his mouth :
text2: Biblia ƒe akpa si xle ̃ m wo ̀ nɔ la gblɔ be , “ Wokplɔe abe ale ̃ vi ene yina wuwu ge . Eye abe ale si ale ̃ vi nɔa anyi kpoo ne wole eƒe fuwo se ̃ m ene la , nenema ke eya ha ̃ wɔ , meke nu kura o .

text: In his humiliation his judgment was taken away : and who shall declare his generation ? for his life is taken from the earth .
text2: Le eƒe ɖokuibɔbɔ ta womedrɔ ̃ ʋɔnui ɖe mɔ dzɔdzɔe nu o . Ame kae ate ŋu agblɔ ale si dzidzime si me wo ̀ dzɔ ɖo la ƒe tagbɔ se ̃ e la afia ? Elabena woɖe eƒe agbe ɖa le anyigba dzi . ”

text: And the eunuch answered Philip , and said , I pray thee , of whom speaketh the prophet this ? of himself , or of some other man ?
text2: Etiopia ŋutsu la bia Filipo be , “ Nyagblɔɖila Yesaya ŋu eya ŋutɔ nɔ nu ƒom le loo alo ame bubu aɖe ŋuea ? ”

text: Then Philip opened his mouth , and began at the same scripture , and preached unto him Jesus .
text2: Biabia sia na be Filipo wɔ mawunya si wo ̀ xle ̃ la kple bubuwo ŋutidɔ heƒo nu le Yesu ŋu na Etiopia ŋutsua .

text: And as they went on their way , they came unto a certain water : and the eunuch said , See , here is water ; what doth hinder me to be baptized ?
text2: Esi wonɔ mɔa dzi yina se ̃ ko la , wova ke ɖe tɔsisi sue aɖe ŋu . Etiopia ŋutsua bia Filipo be , “ Kpɔ ɖa ! Tsie nye esi ; nu ka ta nyemade mawutsi ta zi ɖeka o ? ”

text: And Philip said , If thou believest with all thine heart , thou mayest . And he answered and said , I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God .
text2: Filipo ɖo eŋu nɛ be , “ Nenye be e ̀ xɔe se tso wo ̀ dzi blibo me ko la , ekema naneke mexe mɔ o . ” Etiopia ŋutsua ɖo eŋu be , “ Mexɔe se bena Yesu Kristoe nye Mawu Vi la . ”

text: And he commanded the chariot to stand still : and they went down both into the water , both Philip and the eunuch ; and he baptized him .
text2: Enumake etɔ tasiaɖam la eye wo ̀ ɖi ge ɖe tsia me eye Filipo de mawutsi ta nɛ .

text: And when they were come up out of the water , the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip , that the eunuch saw him no more : and he went on his way rejoicing .
text2: Esi wo ̀ do tso tsia me tete ko la , Aƒetɔ la ƒe Gbɔgbɔ kɔ Filipo dzoe ale be Etiopia ŋutsua megakpɔe o , ke eya ha ̃ dze aƒemɔ dzi kple dzidzɔ .

text: But Philip was found at Azotus : and passing through he preached in all the cities , till he came to Caesarea .
text2: Egblɔ nyanyui la le afi ma eye wo ̀ gagblɔe le du siwo kata ̃ le Kaesarea mɔ dzi la ha ̃ me .

text: And Saul , yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord , went unto the high priest ,
text2: Saulo gado ada ̃ ɖe xɔsetɔwo ŋu vevie wu tsa ̃ eye wo ̀ le ́ gbɔgbɔtsixe ɖe ƒo heganɔ wo yome tim kple ŋkubia ̃ . Eƒe susu kple didi kata ̃ koe nye be yeatsrɔ ̃ xɔsetɔ ɖe sia ɖe . Le esia ta eyi Osɔfoga ̃ la gbɔ

text: And desired of him letters to Damascus to the synagogues , that if he found any of this way , whether they were men or women , he might bring them bound unto Jerusalem .
text2: be wo ̀ ana agbale ̃ si ana ŋuse ̃ ye ale be ne yeayi Yudatɔwo ƒe ƒuƒoƒe siwo le Damasko ne woakpe ɖe ye ŋu be yeate ŋu ale ́ xɔsetɔ siawo kata ̃ le teƒe siawo , ŋutsuwo kple nyɔnuwo siaa , ade ga wo eye yeakplɔ wo va Yerusalem .

text: And as he journeyed , he came near Damascus : and suddenly there shined round about him a light from heaven :
text2: Esi wo ̀ susɔ vie ko wo ̀ aɖo Damasko dua me la , kekle ̃ ga ̃ aɖe kle ̃ ɖe edzi tso dziƒo .

text: And he fell to the earth , and heard a voice saying unto him , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ?
text2: Edze anyi kpla enumake . Ke ese gbe aɖe be , “ Saulo , Saulo , nu ka ta ne ̀ le yonyeme tim alea ? ”

text: And he said , Who art thou , Lord ? And the Lord said , I am Jesus whom thou persecutest : it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks .
text2: Saulo bia kple vɔvɔ ̃ be , “ Wo ̀ ame kae le nu ƒom ? ” Gbea ɖo eŋu nɛ be , “ Nye , Yesu , ame si yome tim ne ̀ le lae .

text: And he trembling and astonished said , Lord , what wilt thou have me to do ? And the Lord said unto him , Arise , and go into the city , and it shall be told thee what thou must do .
text2: Azɔ tsi tre eye na ̃ yi Damasko dua me ; ne e ̀ ɖo afi ma la , magblɔ nu siwo na ̃ wɔ la na wo ̀ . ”

text: And the men which journeyed with him stood speechless , hearing a voice , but seeing no man .
text2: Nyadzɔdzɔ sia wɔ nuku na Saulo ŋumewo ŋutɔ . Woƒe nu ku ale gbegbe be gbɔgblɔ bu ɖe wo elabena wonɔ gbeɖiɖi aɖe sem pɛpɛpɛ gake womekpɔ ame si nɔ nu ƒom la o .

text: And Saul arose from the earth ; and when his eyes were opened , he saw no man : but they led him by the hand , and brought him into Damascus .
text2: Saulo wɔ ɖɔɖɔɖɔ tso le anyigba gake nukutɔe la megate ŋu nɔ nu kpɔm o ; eƒe ŋku dzi tsyɔ eya ta wole ́ eƒe alɔnu kplɔe ɖɔɖɔɖɔ yi Damasko .

text: And he was three days without sight , and neither did eat nor drink .
text2: Enɔ dua me ŋkeke etɔ ̃ numaɖumaɖu kple tsimanomanoe .

text: And there was a certain disciple at Damascus , named Ananias ; and to him said the Lord in a vision , Ananias . And he said , Behold , I am here , Lord .
text2: Mawudzixɔsela aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Anania la nɔ Damasko dua me ɣemaɣi . Mawu yɔe le ŋutega me gbe ɖeka be , “ Anania . ” Etɔ eye wo ̀ gblɔ be , “ Nyee nye esi , Aƒetɔ . ”

text: And the Lord said unto him , Arise , and go into the street which is called Straight , and inquire in the house of Judas for one called Saul , of Tarsus : for , behold , he prayeth ,
text2: Mawu gblɔ nɛ be , “ Tso na ̃ yi ablɔ si woyɔna be ‘ Mɔ Dzɔdzɔe ’ la dzi , eye na ̃ di ŋutsu aɖe si woyɔna be Yuda la ƒe aƒe me . Ne e ̀ kpɔe la , bia ŋustua aɖe si woyɔna be Saulo tso Tarso la ta se le afi ma . Le gaƒoƒo sia me la , ele klo dzi le gbe dom ɖa nam vevie

text: And hath seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in , and putting his hand on him , that he might receive his sight .
text2: elabena meɖee fiae le ŋutega me be wo ̀ , Anania , a ̃ va egbɔ , a ̃ da asi ɖe edzi be eƒe ŋkuwo naʋu ale be wo ̀ agate ŋu akpɔ nu . ”

text: Then Ananias answered , Lord , I have heard by many of this man , how much evil he hath done to thy saints at Jerusalem :
text2: Anania gblɔ kple vɔvɔ ̃ ɣli be , “ Aƒetɔ , mese be funyafunya si gbegbe Saulo sia wɔ xɔsetɔwo le Yerusalem la mele gbɔgblɔ me o ɖe !

text: And here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all that call on thy name .
text2: Gawu la , mi ́ ese be ɖe wo ̀ xɔ agbale ̃ koŋ tso Osɔfoga ̃ wo gbɔ le Yerusalem be yeava le ́ xɔsetɔ siwo kata ̃ le Damasko le afii eye yeakplɔ wo ayi Yerusalem . ”

text: But the Lord said unto him , Go thy way : for he is a chosen vessel unto me , to bear my name before the Gentiles , and kings , and the children of Israel :
text2: Ke Aƒetɔ la ɖo eŋu na Anania be , “ Yi na ̃ wɔ ɖe nye gbe dzi . Elabena nye ŋutɔe tia ame sia be wo ̀ anye dɔwɔla nam eye wo ̀ agblɔ nye nya na trɔ ̃ subɔladukɔwo , fiawo kple Israelviwo ŋutɔ ha ̃ .

text: For I will shew him how great things he must suffer for my name ' s sake .
text2: Eye nye ŋutɔ magblɔ fu siwo wo ̀ akpe ɖe tanye la afiae . ”

text: And Ananias went his way , and entered into the house ; and putting his hands on him said , Brother Saul , the Lord , even Jesus , that appeared unto thee in the way as thou camest , hath sent me , that thou mightest receive thy sight , and be filled with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Anania tso heyi Saulo gbɔ eye wo ̀ da asi ɖe edzi gblɔ nɛ be , “ Nɔvinye Saulo , Aƒetɔ Yesu , ame si ɖe eɖokui fia wo ̀ le Damasko mɔ dzi la ɖom ɖa be mada gbe le ŋuwo ̀ eye tso esia dzi la Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la nayɔ mewo ̀ be na ̃ gakpɔ nu . ”

text: And immediately there fell from his eyes as it had been scales : and he received sight forthwith , and arose , and was baptized .
text2: Enumake ewɔ abe tsrowoe ge le eƒe ŋkuwo dzi ene . Ŋkuawo ʋu eye wo ̀ gade asi nukpɔkpɔ me . Anania de mawutsita nɛ enumake .

text: And when he had received meat , he was strengthened . Then was Saul certain days with the disciples which were at Damascus .
text2: Ŋuse ̃ gaɖo eya amea ŋu esi wona nanee wo ̀ ɖu vɔ . Saulo nɔ nusrɔ ̃ lawo gbɔ le Damasko hena ŋkeke geɖewo .

text: And straightway he preached Christ in the synagogues , that he is the Son of God .
text2: Tete wo ̀ dze mawunyagbɔgblɔ gɔme le woƒe ƒuƒoƒewo me le gbɔgblɔm be Yesue nye Mawu Vi la .

text: But all that heard him were amazed , and said ; Is not this he that destroyed them which called on this name in Jerusalem , and came hither for that intent , that he might bring them bound unto the chief priests ?
text2: Ame siwo kata ̃ se Saulo ƒe mawunya la ƒe nu ku ale gbegbe be wobia wo nɔewo be , “ Alo menye ame siae wɔ funyafunya geɖe Yesu yomedzelawo le Yerusalem le woƒe xɔse ta oa ? Mi ́ ese gɔ ̃ be ɖe wo ̀ va Damasko afii be yeale ́ xɔsetɔwo ade ga wo akplɔ yii na Osɔfowo le Yerusalem ! ”

text: But Saul increased the more in strength , and confounded the Jews which dwelt at Damascus , proving that this is very Christ .
text2: Saulo yi eƒe mawunyagbɔgblɔ dzi kple ŋuse ̃ ale gbegbe be , Yudatɔ siwo nɔ Damasko la mete ŋu tsi tre ɖe eƒe nya siwo ɖee fia kɔtee be Yesue nye Kristo la ŋu o .

text: And after that many days were fulfilled , the Jews took counsel to kill him :
text2: Le ŋkeke aɖewo megbe la Yudatɔwo ƒe kplɔlawo wɔ ɖoɖo be yewoawu Saulo .

text: But their laying await was known of Saul . And they watched the gates day and night to kill him .
text2: Ke ame aɖe va fi tofi ̃ na Saulo be dzɔlawo le Damasko ƒe agbowo nu dzɔm za ̃ kple keli bena ne eva yina la yewoawui .

text: Then the disciples took him by night , and let him down by the wall in a basket .
text2: Eya ta gbe ɖeka za ̃ la , Saulo yomedzela aɖewo tsɔe de kusi ga ̃ aɖe me heɖiɖii to gli si ƒo xla ̃ dua tame va se ɖe esime wo ̀ ɖo anyigba eye wo ̀ si dzo .

text: And when Saul was come to Jerusalem , he assayed to join himself to the disciples : but they were all afraid of him , and believed not that he was a disciple .
text2: Esi Saulo va ɖo Yerusalem la , edze agbagba be yeawɔ ɖeka kple xɔsetɔ siwo le afi ma la gake wonɔ vɔvɔ ̃ m nɛ eye womelɔ ̃ te ɖe eŋu o ; elabena wobu be alakpa dam wo ̀ nɔ be yezu wo dometɔ ɖeka .

text: But Barnabas took him , and brought him to the apostles , and declared unto them how he had seen the Lord in the way , and that he had spoken to him , and how he had preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus .
text2: Ke gbe ɖeka la , Barnaba kplɔ Saulo va apostoloawo gbɔe . Eƒo nu na wo le ale si Saulo kpɔ Aƒetɔa le Damasko mɔ dzi , nya siwo wo ̀ gblɔ nɛ kple ale si Saulo gblɔ mawunya kple ŋuse ̃ tɔxɛ le Yesu ƒe ŋkɔ me la ŋu na wo .

text: And he was with them coming in and going out at Jerusalem .
text2: Esia na be apostoloawo xɔ Saulo ɖe wo dome ale tso ɣemaɣi dzi la enɔ xɔsetɔwo ŋu kplikplikpli henɔ mawunya gblɔm dzideƒotɔe le Aƒetɔa ƒe ŋkɔ me .

text: And he spake boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus , and disputed against the Grecians : but they went about to slay him .
text2: Ke eva va eme be Helatɔ trɔ zu Yudatɔ aɖewo , ame siwo Saulo he nya kplii la wɔ ɖoɖo be yewoawui .

text: Which when the brethren knew , they brought him down to Caesarea , and sent him forth to Tarsus .
text2: Esi xɔsetɔ bubuawo se be Saulo ƒe agbe ɖo xaxa me alea la , wokplɔe yi Kaisarea eye tso afi ma la woɖoe ɖe wo de , Tarso .

text: Then had the churches rest throughout all Judaea and Galilee and Samaria , and were edified ; and walking in the fear of the Lord , and in the comfort of the Holy Ghost , were multiplied .
text2: Le ɣeyiɣi siawo kata ̃ me la , tomefafa blibo nɔ hame siwo le Yudea , Galilea kple Samaria nutowo me la me . Esia wɔ be hamea ƒe xexle ̃ me dzi ɖe edzi eye wo ̀ gase ̃ ŋu ɖe edzi wu le gbɔgbɔ me ha ̃ . Xɔsetɔwo srɔ ̃ ale si woanɔ agbee le mawuvɔvɔ ̃ me eye Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la ha ̃ na dzidzeme blibo wo .

text: And it came to pass , as Peter passed throughout all quarters , he came down also to the saints which dwelt at Lydda .
text2: Petro nɔ tsatsam le xɔsetɔwo dzi tso teƒe yi teƒe eye wo ̀ va ɖo Lida .

text: And there he found a certain man named Aeneas , which had kept his bed eight years , and was sick of the palsy .
text2: Teƒe sia wo ̀ kpɔ ŋutsu aɖe le ame si woyɔna be Aenea , ame si nɔ la ̃ metutudɔ le ́ m eye wo ̀ tsi aba dzi ƒe enyi sɔŋ .

text: And Peter said unto him , Aeneas , Jesus Christ maketh thee whole : arise , and make thy bed . And he arose immediately .
text2: Petro yɔe gblɔ nɛ be , “ Aenea , Yesu Kristo da gbe le ŋuwo ̀ , eya ta tsi tre eye na ̃ ŋlɔ wo ̀ aba . ” Ŋutsua ƒe la ̃ me se ̃ enumake .

text: And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him , and turned to the Lord .
text2: Nukunu sia wɔe be ame siwo kata ̃ le Lida kple Saron dze Aƒetɔ la yome elabena wokpɔ Aenea wo ̀ nɔ zɔzɔm . Petro fɔ Tabita tso ku me

text: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha , which by interpretation is called Dorcas : this woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did .
text2: Nyɔnu dɔmenyotɔ aɖe nɔ Yopa dua me si woyɔna be Tabita si gɔmee nye Dɔkas . Nyɔnu sia nye xɔsetɔ si wɔa dɔmenyo na amewo ŋutɔ , vevɔ ame dahewo .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that she was sick , and died : whom when they had washed , they laid her in an upper chamber .
text2: Le ɣeyiɣi sia me tututu la nyɔnu sia dze dɔ eye wo ̀ ku . Wodzra eƒe kukua ɖo eye woɖoe aba dzi le dziƒoxɔ aɖe dzi .

text: And forasmuch as Lydda was nigh to Joppa , and the disciples had heard that Peter was there , they sent unto him two men , desiring him that he would not delay to come to them .
text2: Ke esi nyɔnua xɔlɔ ̃ wo se Petro ŋkɔ le Lida la woɖe ame eve ɖo ɖee kple kukuɖeɖe be wo ̀ aɖe abla ava yewo gbɔ le Yopa , elabena Lida tsɔ ɖe Yopa gbɔ .

text: Then Peter arose and went with them . When he was come , they brought him into the upper chamber : and all the widows stood by him weeping , and shewing the coats and garments which Dorcas made , while she was with them .
text2: Petro lɔ ̃ va Yopa . Esi wo ̀ va ɖo tete ko la , wokplɔe yi xɔ si me wotsɔ Dɔkas ƒe kukua mlɔe . Xɔa me yɔ fu ̃ kple konyifalawo , ame siwo dometɔ geɖewo nye ahosi siwo Dɔkas lɔ ̃ avɔ alo awu na le eƒe agbeme . Đe sia ɖe nɔ nu siwo Dɔkas wɔ nɛ la tsɔm fia nɔvia .

text: But Peter put them all forth , and kneeled down , and prayed ; and turning him to the body said , Tabitha , arise . And she opened her eyes : and when she saw Peter , she sat up .
text2: Esi Petro ge ɖe xɔa me la , ebia tso wo kata ̃ si be woado go ana mɔ ye . Esi wodo go la , Petro dze klo do gbe ɖa , eye wo ̀ trɔ ɖe ame kukua gbɔ gblɔ nɛ bena , “ Nɔvi Dɔkas , tsi tre ! ” Enumake ame kukua ʋu ŋku eye esi wo ̀ kpɔ Petro la , efɔ bɔbɔ nɔ abatia dzi .

text: And he gave her his hand , and lifted her up , and when he had called the saints and widows , presented her alive .
text2: Petro le ́ eƒe alɔnu eye wo ̀ tsi tre . Azɔ Petro yɔ xɔsetɔawo kple ahosiawo va xɔa mee eye wo ̀ tsɔ Dɔkas de asi na wo .

text: And it was known throughout all Joppa ; and many believed in the Lord .
text2: Nukunya sia kaka ɖe du bliboa me abe gbe ƒuƒu si wotɔ dzoe la ƒe bibi ene , eye ame geɖewo ŋutɔ trɔ hexɔ Aƒetɔa dzi se .

text: And it came to pass , that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner .
text2: Petro nɔ Yopa dua me ŋkeke geɖe eye wo ̀ nɔ Simɔn si nye La ̃ gbale ̃ ŋutidɔwɔla la gbɔ le eƒe aƒe me .

text: There was a certain man in Caesarea called Cornelius , a centurion of the band called the Italian band ,
text2: Roma ŋutsu aɖe si nye asrafomega ̃ la nɔ Kaisarea le ɣemaɣi . Eŋkɔe nye Kornelio eye wo ̀ nye asrafomega ̃ nɔ Italiatɔwo ƒe aʋakɔ ɖeka nu .

text: A devout man , and one that feared God with all his house , which gave much alms to the people , and prayed to God alway .
text2: Ame sia nye mawuvɔ ̃ la adodoe aɖe eye eƒe aƒemetɔwo kata ̃ ha ̃ nye mawuvɔ ̃ lawo . Ewɔa dɔmenyo ŋutɔ eye mefena kple gbedodoɖa ha ̃ o .

text: He saw in a vision evidently about the ninth hour of the day an angel of God coming in to him , and saying unto him , Cornelius .
text2: Gbe ɖeka abe ɣetrɔ ga etɔ ̃ me ene la , ekpɔ ŋutega esime wo ̀ nɔ gbe dom ɖa . Ekpɔ mawudɔla aɖe wo ̀ gbɔna egbɔ . Mawudɔla la yɔe be , “ Kornelio ! ”

text: And when he looked on him , he was afraid , and said , What is it , Lord ? And he said unto him , Thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before God .
text2: Kornelio vɔ ̃ ŋutɔ . Đe ko woke ŋku ɖe te ga ̃ a nɔ mawudɔla la kpɔm . Mlɔeba la ebiae be , “ Amega ̃ , nya kae dzɔ ? Nu ka dim ne ̀ le tso gbɔnye ? ” Mawudɔla la ɖo eŋu nɛ be , “ Mawu se wo ̀ gbedodoɖawo eye wo ̀ de dzesi wo ̀ dɔmenyowɔwɔwo kata ̃ ha ̃ .

text: And now send men to Joppa , and call for one Simon , whose surname is Peter :
text2: Dɔ amewo ɖe Yopa ne woaɖayɔ ŋutsu aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Simɔn Petro la vɛ be wo ̀ ava kpɔ wo ̀ ɖa .

text: He lodgeth with one Simon a tanner , whose house is by the sea side : he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do .
text2: Simɔn Petro sia le ŋutsu bubu aɖe si woyɔna be Simɔn si nye lagbale ̃ ŋutidɔwɔla aɖe la , ƒe aƒeme le ƒuta lɔƒo . ” "

text: And when the angel which spake unto Cornelius was departed , he called two of his household servants , and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually ;
text2: Esi mawudɔla la dzo tete ko la , Kornelio yɔ eƒe subɔla eve kple eya ŋutɔ ƒe asrafowo dometɔ ɖeka , ame si ha ̃ vɔ ̃ a Mawu la ,

text: And when he had declared all these things unto them , he sent them to Joppa .
text2: eye wo ̀ gblɔ nu si dzɔ la na wo . Azɔ eɖo wo ɖe Yopa be woaɖakplɔ Petro vɛ .

text: On the morrow , as they went on their journey , and drew nigh unto the city , Peter went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth hour :
text2: Le ŋufɔke ƒe ŋdɔ me la , wonɔ tetem ɖe du la ŋu ; ɣemayi la , Petro yi xɔta be yeado gbe ɖa .

text: And he became very hungry , and would have eaten : but while they made ready , he fell into a trance ,
text2: Ke dɔ de asi ewuwu me eye wo ̀ di be yeaɖu nu , ke esi wo ̀ nɔ nua ɖam la , ekpɔ ŋutega . "

text: And saw heaven opened , and a certain vessel descending unto him , as it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners , and let down to the earth :
text2: Ekpɔ aklala ga ̃ aɖe si wotsi ka eƒe dzoge eneawo la wo ̀ nɔ ɖiɖim tso dziƒo gbɔna anyigba .

text: Wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth , and wild beasts , and creeping things , and fowls of the air .
text2: Ekpɔ la ̃ afɔenewo , nutatawo kple dziƒoxevi vovovowo le avɔ la dzi .

text: And there came a voice to him , Rise , Peter ; kill , and eat .
text2: Petro se gbeɖiɖi aɖe wo ̀ gblɔ nɛ be , “ Heyi na ̃ wu la ̃ siawo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe si ne ̀ lɔ ̃ la , na ̃ ɖu . ”

text: But Peter said , Not so , Lord ; for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean .
text2: Ke Petro ɖo eŋu be , “ Gbeɖe , Aƒetɔ , nyemate ŋu awɔ esia o . Mi ́ Yudatɔwo la , se meɖe mɔ be mi ́ aɖu la ̃ siawo ƒomevi o eye nyemeɖu wo dometɔ aɖeke kpɔ le nye agbe me o . ”

text: And the voice spake unto him again the second time , What God hath cleansed , that call not thou common .
text2: Gbeɖiɖia gayi edzi gblɔ na Petro be , “ Me ̀ gagbe Mawu ƒe gbe dzi wɔwɔ o . Ne Mawu da asi ɖe nane dzi be ekɔ la , me ̀ kpɔ mɔ agblɔ be mekɔ o . ”

text: This was done thrice : and the vessel was received up again into heaven .
text2: Woɖe ŋutega sia fia Petro zigbɔzi etɔ ̃ sɔŋ , eye le eya megbe la , wohe aklala la dzoe yi dziƒo .

text: Now while Peter doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen should mean , behold , the men which were sent from Cornelius had made inquiry for Simon ' s house , and stood before the gate ,
text2: Ŋutega sia wɔ moya na Petro ŋutɔ . Mese egɔme o eye menya nu si tututu Mawu di be yeaɖe fiae ha ̃ o .

text: And called , and asked whether Simon , which was surnamed Peter , were lodged there .
text2: Le ɣemaɣi me tututu la , Kornelio ƒe amedɔdɔwo va ɖo aƒea me henɔ tsitre ɖe aƒea ƒe agbonu nɔ Simɔn Petro ta biam se be afi kae wo ̀ le maha ̃ ?

text: While Peter thought on the vision , the Spirit said unto him , Behold , three men seek thee .
text2: Ke esi Petro ganɔ tame bum le ŋutega la ŋu la , Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la gblɔ nɛ be , “ Ame etɔ ̃ aɖewo le diwo ̀ m le aƒea me .

text: Arise therefore , and get thee down , and go with them , doubting nothing : for I have sent them .
text2: Eya ta ɖi na ̃ yi ɖakpe wo , eye na ̃ dze wo yome ayi kpli wo elabena nyee dɔ wo ɖo ɖe gbɔwo ̀ . Me ̀ gavɔ ̃ o , nu sia nu ayi edzi nyuie . ”

text: Then Peter went down to the men which were sent unto him from Cornelius ; and said , Behold , I am he whom ye seek : what is the cause wherefore ye are come ?
text2: Ale Petro ɖi ɖe anyigba . Ekpɔ amedzroawo , eye wo ̀ gblɔ na wo be , “ Nyee nye ame si dim miele . Nu kae miele diyem be mawɔ na mi ? ”

text: And they said , Cornelius the centurion , a just man , and one that feareth God , and of good report among all the nation of the Jews , was warned from God by an holy angel to send for thee into his house , and to hear words of thee .
text2: Ŋutsuawo ɖo eŋu nɛ be , “ Ame dɔdɔwo mienye tso Kornelio si nye Roma srafowo ƒe amega ̃ ɖeka la gbɔ . Enye ame dzɔdzɔe kple mawuvɔ ̃ la , eye Yudatɔwo kata ̃ ha ̃ bunɛ ŋutɔ . Mawudɔla aɖe ɖe eɖokui fiae eye wo ̀ bia tso esi be wo ̀ adɔ ame ne woayɔ wo ̀ ɖee be na ̃ gblɔ nu si wo ̀ awɔ la nɛ . ” "

text: Then called he them in , and lodged them . And on the morrow Peter went away with them , and certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him .
text2: Petro se nya siawo kata ̃ eye wo ̀ xɔ ameawo atuu . Ena dzeƒe wo be woatsi adɔ . Le ŋufɔke la , Petro kplɔ xɔsetɔ eve aɖewo tso Yopa kpe ɖe eɖokui ŋu eye wodze mɔ kple Kornelio ƒe ame dɔdɔwo ɖo ta Kaisarea .

text: And the morrow after they entered into Caesarea . And Cornelius waited for them , and had called together his kinsmen and near friends .
text2: Wova ɖo Kaisarea le ŋkeke evea gbe . Kornelio nɔ mɔ kpɔm na wo vevie eye wo ̀ yɔ eƒe ƒometɔwo kple xɔlɔ ̃ wo ha ̃ be woava do gbe na Petro .

text: And as Peter was coming in , Cornelius met him , and fell down at his feet , and worshipped him .
text2: Esi Petro ge ɖe aƒea me tete ko la , Kornelio ɖe abla yi ɖadze klo ɖe ekɔme be yeasubɔe .

text: But Peter took him up , saying , Stand up ; I myself also am a man .
text2: Ke Petro gblɔ nɛ be , " “ Tso kaba , elabena menye Mawue menye na ̃ subɔ o . Amegbetɔ ko nye ha ̃ menye . ”

text: And as he talked with him , he went in , and found many that were come together .
text2: Kornelio tsi tre eye eya kple Petro woɖo dze vie emegbe la woyi afi si ame mamlɛawo ƒo ƒu ɖo .

text: And he said unto them , Ye know how that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to keep company , or come unto one of another nation ; but God hath shewed me that I should not call any man common or unclean .
text2: Le gbelɔlɔ ̃ vɔ megbe la , Petro tsi tre hegblɔ na ƒuƒoƒea be , “ Miawo ŋutɔ mienya be mele be nye abe Yudatɔ ene mava mi Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo ƒe aƒeme alea o . Gake Mawu ɖee fiam le ŋutega me be , mele be mabu ame aɖeke be enye nu maɖinu o .

text: Therefore came I unto you without gainsaying , as soon as I was sent for : I ask therefore for what intent ye have sent for me ?
text2: Eya ta esi miaƒe ame dɔdɔwo va ɖo gbɔnye ko la , nyemehe ɖe megbe kura o , ke boŋ metso dze mɔ dzi enumake . Azɔ nya kae le mia si ? Migblɔe mase . ”

text: And Cornelius said , Four days ago I was fasting until this hour ; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house , and , behold , a man stood before me in bright clothing ,
text2: Kornelio ɖo eŋu gblɔ nɛ be , “ Egbee nye ŋkeke enelia , esi menɔ gbe dom ɖa le gaƒoƒo sia tututu me abe ale si mewɔnɛ ɖaa ene . Ame aɖe si do awu ɣi si nɔ dzo dam miamiamia la va do ɖe ŋkunyeme .

text: And said , Cornelius , thy prayer is heard , and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God .
text2: Egblɔ nam be , ‘ Kornelio , Mawu se wo ̀ gbedodoɖawo eye wo ̀ kpɔ dzidzɔ le wo ̀ dɔmenyowɔwɔwo ŋu . Azɔ la , dɔ ame aɖewo ɖe Yopa ,

text: Send therefore to Joppa , and call hither Simon , whose surname is Peter ; he is lodged in the house of one Simon a tanner by the sea side : who , when he cometh , shall speak unto thee .
text2: be ne woayi aɖayɔ Simɔn Petro vɛ na wo ̀ . Simɔn Petro sia le Simɔn si nye la ̃ gbale ̃ ŋuti dɔwɔla aɖe ƒe aƒe me le ƒuta .

text: Immediately therefore I sent to thee ; and thou hast well done that thou art come . Now therefore are we all here present before God , to hear all things that are commanded thee of God .
text2: Esia tae medɔ ame ɖo ɖe gbɔwo ̀ ɖo eye enyo ŋutɔ be ne ̀ va zi ɖeka ha ̃ . Azɔ mi ́ kata ̃ mi ́ eƒo ƒu ɖi , le Aƒetɔ la ŋkume le klalo be mi ́ ase nya si Mawu de asiwo ̀ be na ̃ gblɔ na mi ́ . ”

text: Then Peter opened his mouth , and said , Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons :
text2: Petro ɖo eŋu gblɔ be , “ Eme kɔ nam ƒa ̃ a azɔ be nyateƒee Mawu mekpɔa ame ŋkume o ,

text: But in every nation he that feareth him , and worketh righteousness , is accepted with him .
text2: ke boŋ exɔa ame sia ame si vɔ ̃ nɛ eye wo ̀ wɔa nu si le eteƒe , du ka ke mee wo ̀ tso ha ̃ .

text: The word which God sent unto the children of Israel , preaching peace by Jesus Christ : ( he is Lord of all : )
text2: Meka ɖe edzi be miawo ha ̃ miese nyanyui si wohe vɛ na Israelviwo la , be Yesu he tomefafa va amegbetɔwo kple Mawu domee eye Yesue nye Mesia kple xexea me kata ̃ ƒe Aƒetɔ .

text: That word , I say , ye know , which was published throughout all Judaea , and began from Galilee , after the baptism which John preached ;
text2: Yohanes Mawutsidetanamela dze nyanyui sia kaka gɔme tso Galilea eye wo ̀ kaka ɖe Yudea nuto bliboa kata ̃ me .

text: How God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power : who went about doing good , and healing all that were oppressed of the devil ; for God was with him .
text2: Meka ɖe edzi be mienya ha ̃ be Mawu da asi ɖe Yesu , Nazaretitɔ la , dzi to Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la me eye wo ̀ na ŋuse ̃ si na be wo ̀ te ŋu nɔ tsatsam henɔ dɔmenyo wɔm na amewo lae . Eda gbe le dɔle ́ lawo ŋu henya gbɔgbɔ vɔ ̃ wo do goe le amewo me elabena Mawu nɔ kplii ɖaa . ”

text: And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews , and in Jerusalem ; whom they slew and hanged on a tree :
text2: Petro yi dzi be , “ Ke mi ́ apostoloawoe nye ɖaseɖilawo na nu siwo kata ̃ wo ̀ wɔ le Israel kple Yerusalem afi si wokla ̃ e ɖe ati ŋu hewui le .

text: Him God raised up the third day , and shewed him openly ;
text2: Ke Mawu gafɔ Yesu ɖe tsitre tso ame kukuwo dome le ŋkeke etɔ ̃ agbe tututu eye wo ̀ ɖee fia ame tɔxɛ aɖewo si eya ŋutɔ tia .

text: Not to all the people , but unto witnesses chosen before of God , even to us , who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead .
text2: Meɖee fia le dutoƒo o ke boŋ eɖee fia mi ́ apostoloawo eye mi ́ eɖu nu heno nu kplii le eƒe fɔfɔ tso ame kukuwo dome megbe .

text: And he commanded us to preach unto the people , and to testify that it is he which was ordained of God to be the Judge of quick and dead .
text2: Eye Yesu dɔ mi ́ be mi ́ agblɔ nyanyui la na amewo kata ̃ eye mi ́ aɖe gbeƒa ̃ e be Mawu tia Yesu be wo ̀ anye ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ la na amewo kata ̃ , agbagbeawo kple kukuawo siaa .

text: To him give all the prophets witness , that through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sins .
text2: Nyagblɔɖilawo kata ̃ ha ̃ ŋlɔ nu tso Yesu ŋu gblɔ be , ame sia ame si axɔ edzi ase la , woatsɔ eƒe nu vɔ ̃ wo akee to eƒe ŋkɔ la me . ”

text: While Peter yet spake these words , the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word .
text2: Le esime Petro nɔ nya siawo gblɔm la , Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la dze ame siwo kata ̃ nɔ to ɖom la dzi .

text: And they of the circumcision which believed were astonished , as many as came with Peter , because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy Ghost .
text2: Nɔvi xɔsetɔ siwo tso aʋatsotso la me , ame siwo va kple Petro la ƒe mo wɔ yaa be wokɔ Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la ɖe Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo gɔ ̃ ha ̃ dzi .

text: For they heard them speak with tongues , and magnify God . Then answered Peter ,
text2: Elabena wose wonɔ aɖe yeye gblɔm nɔ Mawu kafum . Tete Petro gblɔ bena ,

text: Can any man forbid water , that these should not be baptized , which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we ?
text2: “ Đe ame aɖe ate ŋu axe mɔ be womade mawutsi ta na ame siawo oa ? Woawo ha ̃ xɔ Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la abe miawo ke ene . ”

text: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord . Then prayed they him to tarry certain days .
text2: Ale wɔ Petro de mawutsi ta na wo le Yesu si nye Mesia la ŋkɔ me . Le esia megbe la , Kornelio ɖe kuku na Petro be wo ̀ anɔ yewo gbɔ ŋkeke aɖewo hafi adzo .

text: And the apostles and brethren that were in Judaea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God .
text2: Eteƒe medidi kura hafi apostoloawo kple nɔvi bubu siwo le Yudea la se be Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo ha ̃ xɔ nyanyui la o .

text: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem , they that were of the circumcision contended with him ,
text2: Ale wœwu Yakobo , Yohanes nåvi la , kple yi .
column6: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem , they that were of the circumcision contended with him ,
column8: Ke esi Petro trɔ va ɖo Yerusalem la , Yudatɔ siwo xɔ Yesu dzi se la he nya ɖe eŋu vevie hegblɔ nɛ be ,

text: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem , they that were of the circumcision contended with him ,
text2: Ale wœwu Yakobo , Yohanes nåvi la , kple yi .
column6: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem , they that were of the circumcision contended with him ,

column6: Now they which were scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phenice , and Cyprus , and Antioch , preaching the word to none but unto the Jews only .
column8: Le ɣeyiɣi siawo me la , xɔsetɔ siwo si le Yerusalem , le yometiti si va le Stefano wuwu megbe la , dometɔ aɖewo zɔ mɔ yi kekeke Foenike , Kipro kple Antioxia nutowo me henɔ nyanyui la gblɔm na ame siwo nye Yudatɔwo ko .

text: Now they which were scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phenice , and Cyprus , and Antioch , preaching the word to none but unto the Jews only .
text2: Esi Herodes då ame ∂ o ∂ a be woakplå Petro v § eye womekpåe o la , ena wol ∞ asrafo wuiadeawo kat ∑ drß √ ånu wo eye wotso kufia na wo hewu wo enumake . Le esia megbe la Herodes dzo yi ∂ anå Kaisarea vie .
column6: Now they which were scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phenice , and Cyprus , and Antioch , preaching the word to none but unto the Jews only .
column8: Le ɣeyiɣi siawo me la , xɔsetɔ siwo si le Yerusalem , le yometiti si va le Stefano wuwu megbe la , dometɔ aɖewo zɔ mɔ yi kekeke Foenike , Kipro kple Antioxia nutowo me henɔ nyanyui la gblɔm na ame siwo nye Yudatɔwo ko .

text: And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene , which , when they were come to Antioch , spake unto the Grecians , preaching the Lord Jesus .
text2: Gake xɔsetɔ siwo tso Kipro kple Kirene heyi Antioxia la dometɔ aɖewo ƒo nu na Helatɔ aɖewo ha ̃ le Aƒetɔ Yesu ŋu .
column6: And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene , which , when they were come to Antioch , spake unto the Grecians , preaching the Lord Jesus .
column8: Le esime Herodes nå Kaisarea la , ame dådå a ∂ ewo tso Tiro kple Sidon va egbå . Herodes melßa Tiro kple Sidontåwo ƒe nya kura o . Le esia ta ame dådåawo va dze xålß Blasto si nye agbal ¢ Ωlåla g ∑ le fia la ƒeme gbå eye wobia tso esi be wœa ∂ e kuku na Herodes ∂ e yewo nu ale be Ωutifafa nava yewo kple fia la dome . Esia hi ∑ vevie elabena Tiro kple Sidontåwo kpåa woƒe nunyiame tso dukå siwo dzi ∂ um Herodes le la gbå .

text: And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene , which , when they were come to Antioch , spake unto the Grecians , preaching the Lord Jesus .
text2: Gake xɔsetɔ siwo tso Kipro kple Kirene heyi Antioxia la dometɔ aɖewo ƒo nu na Helatɔ aɖewo ha ̃ le Aƒetɔ Yesu ŋu .
column6: And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene , which , when they were come to Antioch , spake unto the Grecians , preaching the Lord Jesus .
column8: Le esime Herodes nå Kaisarea la , ame dådå a ∂ ewo tso Tiro kple Sidon va egbå . Herodes melßa Tiro kple Sidontåwo ƒe nya kura o . Le esia ta ame dådåawo va dze xålß Blasto si nye agbal ¢ Ωlåla g ∑ le fia la ƒeme gbå eye wobia tso esi be wœa ∂ e kuku na Herodes ∂ e yewo nu ale be Ωutifafa nava yewo kple fia la dome . Esia hi ∑ vevie elabena Tiro kple Sidontåwo kpåa woƒe nunyiame tso dukå siwo dzi ∂ um Herodes le la gbå .

text: And the hand of the Lord was with them : and a great number believed , and turned unto the Lord .
text2: Eye Aƒetɔ la de bubu nu si wowɔ la ŋu ale be Trɔ ̃ subɔla siawo dometɔ geɖewo trɔ zu Yesu yomedzelawo .
column6: And the hand of the Lord was with them : and a great number believed , and turned unto the Lord .
column8: Wo ∂ o Ωkeke na ame dådåawo be woava kpå Herodes , esi Ωkekea ∂ o la , wova ƒo ƒu , eye Herodes do eƒe fiawu nå eƒe fiazikpui dzi , heƒo nu na amehawo .

text: And the hand of the Lord was with them : and a great number believed , and turned unto the Lord .
text2: Eye Aƒetɔ la de bubu nu si wowɔ la ŋu ale be Trɔ ̃ subɔla siawo dometɔ geɖewo trɔ zu Yesu yomedzelawo .
column6: And the hand of the Lord was with them : and a great number believed , and turned unto the Lord .
column8: Wo ∂ o Ωkeke na ame dådåawo be woava kpå Herodes , esi Ωkekea ∂ o la , wova ƒo ƒu , eye Herodes do eƒe fiawu nå eƒe fiazikpui dzi , heƒo nu na amehawo .

text: Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem : and they sent forth Barnabas , that he should go as far as Antioch .
text2: Esi hame si le Yerusalem se nu si le edzi yim la , woɖo Barnaba ɖe Antioxia be wo ̀ aɖakpe ɖe xɔsetɔ yeyeawo ŋu .
column6: Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem : and they sent forth Barnabas , that he should go as far as Antioch .
column8: Esi wœƒo nu vå la , amehawo do ≈ li kple dzidzå heda Ωkå ∂ e Herodes dzi be , “ Eƒo nu abe mawu a ∂ e ene eye menye abe amegbetå ene o . ” Esia na be dzi dzå Herodes Ωutå eye wœkå e ∂ okui ∂ e dzi hlodzoo .

text: Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem : and they sent forth Barnabas , that he should go as far as Antioch .
text2: Esi hame si le Yerusalem se nu si le edzi yim la , woɖo Barnaba ɖe Antioxia be wo ̀ aɖakpe ɖe xɔsetɔ yeyeawo ŋu .
column6: Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem : and they sent forth Barnabas , that he should go as far as Antioch .
column8: Esi wœƒo nu vå la , amehawo do ≈ li kple dzidzå heda Ωkå ∂ e Herodes dzi be , “ Eƒo nu abe mawu a ∂ e ene eye menye abe amegbetå ene o . ” Esia na be dzi dzå Herodes Ωutå eye wœkå e ∂ okui ∂ e dzi hlodzoo .

text: Who , when he came , and had seen the grace of God , was glad , and exhorted them all , that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord .
text2: Enumake , mawudåla a ∂ e ƒo Herodes eye wœna dål ∞ le a ∂ e dze edzi . ¸ å viwo ge ∂ e eƒe l ∑ me eye wo ∂ ui wœku , elabena elß be amewo nasubå ye le esi wœatså bubu na Mawu teƒe .
column6: Who , when he came , and had seen the grace of God , was glad , and exhorted them all , that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord .
column8: Esi Barnaba kpɔ nu ga ̃ siwo Mawu wɔ le Antioxia la , dzi dzɔe ŋutɔ . Egado ŋuse ̃ xɔsetɔawo be woayi dzi ale ́ ɖe Mawu ŋu goŋgoŋgoŋ nenye be nya sia nya le dzɔdzɔm ha ̃ .

text: Who , when he came , and had seen the grace of God , was glad , and exhorted them all , that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord .
text2: Enumake , mawudåla a ∂ e ƒo Herodes eye wœna dål ∞ le a ∂ e dze edzi . ¸ å viwo ge ∂ e eƒe l ∑ me eye wo ∂ ui wœku , elabena elß be amewo nasubå ye le esi wœatså bubu na Mawu teƒe .
column6: Who , when he came , and had seen the grace of God , was glad , and exhorted them all , that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord .
column8: Esi Barnaba kpɔ nu ga ̃ siwo Mawu wɔ le Antioxia la , dzi dzɔe ŋutɔ . Egado ŋuse ̃ xɔsetɔawo be woayi dzi ale ́ ɖe Mawu ŋu goŋgoŋgoŋ nenye be nya sia nya le dzɔdzɔm ha ̃ .

text: For he was a good man , and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith : and much people was added unto the Lord .
text2: Barnaba nye ŋutsu dɔmenyotɔ aɖe si me Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la yɔ fu ̃ eye eƒe xɔse ha ̃ li ke sesi ̃ e . To ame sia ƒe dɔwɔwɔ me la , ame geɖewo trɔ zu xɔsetɔwo .
column6: For he was a good man , and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith : and much people was added unto the Lord .
column8: Le ≈ eyi ≈ i siawo me la nyanyui la nå ta kekem alåtsåtsåe eye ame ge ∂ ewo trå zu xåsetåwo .

text: For he was a good man , and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith : and much people was added unto the Lord .
text2: Barnaba nye ŋutsu dɔmenyotɔ aɖe si me Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la yɔ fu ̃ eye eƒe xɔse ha ̃ li ke sesi ̃ e . To ame sia ƒe dɔwɔwɔ me la , ame geɖewo trɔ zu xɔsetɔwo .
column6: For he was a good man , and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith : and much people was added unto the Lord .
column8: Le ≈ eyi ≈ i siawo me la nyanyui la nå ta kekem alåtsåtsåe eye ame ge ∂ ewo trå zu xåsetåwo .

text: Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus , for to seek Saul :
text2: Barnaba kple Saulo ga ∂ i tsa va Yerusalem eye esi wowu då si wå ge woyi nu tete ko la wogatrå dzo yi Antrioxia eye wokplå Marko Yohanes h ∑ yii .
column6: Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus , for to seek Saul :
column8: Tso Antioxia la , Barnaba ti Saulo ƒe mɔ yi Tarso .

text: Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus , for to seek Saul :
text2: Barnaba kple Saulo ga ∂ i tsa va Yerusalem eye esi wowu då si wå ge woyi nu tete ko la wogatrå dzo yi Antrioxia eye wokplå Marko Yohanes h ∑ yii .
column6: Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus , for to seek Saul :
column8: Tso Antioxia la , Barnaba ti Saulo ƒe mɔ yi Tarso .

text: And when he had found him , he brought him unto Antioch . And it came to pass , that a whole year they assembled themselves with the church , and taught much people . And the disciples were called Christians first in Antioch .
text2: Esi wo ̀ ke ɖe eŋu la ekplɔe eye wo ame evea trɔ va Antioxia henɔ afi ma ƒe ɖeka sɔŋ , nɔ nu fiam xɔsetɔwo . Antioxiae wona ŋkɔ xɔsetɔwo le zi gba ̃ tɔ be , “ Kristotɔwo . ”

text: And in these days came prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch .
text2: Le ɣeyiɣi sia me tututu la , nyagblɔɖila aɖewo tso Yerusalem va Antioxia .

text: And there stood up one of them named Agabus , and signified by the spirit that there should be great dearth throughout all the world : which came to pass in the days of Claudius Caesar .
text2: Gbe ɖeka wo dometɔ ɖeka si woyɔna be Agabo la gblɔ nya ɖi tso Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la ƒe ŋuse ̃ me be dɔ ga ̃ aɖe gbɔna toto ge le xexea me kata ̃ . Nya sia va eme le fia Klaudio ƒe dziɖuɣi .

text: Then the disciples , every man according to his ability , determined to send relief unto the brethren which dwelt in Judaea :
text2: Le esia ta xɔsetɔwo ɖo be yewoadzɔ nu , aɖo ɖe yewo nɔvi Kristotɔ siwo le Yudea eye ame sia ame nadzɔ nu abe ale si wo ̀ ate ŋu ene .

text: Which also they did , and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul .
text2: Wowɔ esia eye wotsɔ woƒe nunanawo de Barnaba kple Saulo si be woatsɔ ayi na hanunɔlawo le Yerusalem .

text: Now about that time Herod the king stretched forth his hands to vex certain of the church .
text2: Le ɣemaɣi me la fia Herodes le ́ hamevi aɖewo heɖoe be yeawɔ fu wo le xɔse la ta .

text: And he killed James the brother of John with the sword .
text2: Ale wo ̀ wu Yakobo , Yohanes nɔvi la , kple yi .

text: And because he saw it pleased the Jews , he proceeded further to take Peter also . ( Then were the days of unleavened bread . )
text2: Herodes kpɔ be nuwɔna sia do dzidzɔ na Yudatɔwo ƒe dumega ̃ wo ŋutɔ eya ta ena wole ́ Petro ha ̃ le esime wonɔ Ŋutitotoŋkeke la ɖum , eye wo ̀ dee gaxɔ me .

text: And when he had apprehended him , he put him in prison , and delivered him to four quaternions of soldiers to keep him ; intending after Easter to bring him forth to the people .
text2: Ena asrafo wuiade nɔ eŋu dzɔm . Herodes ɖoe be ne woɖu Ŋutitotoŋkekea vɔ la , yeaɖe asi le Petro ŋu na Yudatɔwo woadrɔ ̃ ʋɔnui eye woawui .

text: Peter therefore was kept in prison : but prayer was made without ceasing of the church unto God for him .
text2: Ke hamea kata ̃ nɔ gbe dom ɖa vevie atraɖii na Mawu be Petro nanɔ dedie le gaxɔa me .

text: And when Herod would have brought him forth , the same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers , bound with two chains : and the keepers before the door kept the prison .
text2: Le za ̃ si do ŋgɔ na gbe si gbe woɖo be woawu Petro me la , Petro nɔ alɔ ̃ dɔm le asrafo eve dome . Wode ga asi nɛ sesi ̃ e . Asrafo bubuwo ha ̃ ganɔ gaxɔa ƒe agbonu dzɔm .

text: And , behold , the angel of the Lord came upon him , and a light shined in the prison : and he smote Peter on the side , and raised him up , saying , Arise up quickly . And his chains fell off from his hands .
text2: Kasia Aƒetɔ ƒe dɔla aɖe va do eye kekeli kle ̃ ɖe gaxɔ la me . Dɔla la ƒo Petro ƒe axame henyɔe tso alɔ ̃ me . Egblɔ nɛ be , “ Netsɔ , tsi tre ! ” Enumake gakɔsɔkɔsɔ la ge le Petro ƒe alɔnu .

text: And the angel said unto him , Gird thyself , and bind on thy sandals . And so he did . And he saith unto him , Cast thy garment about thee , and follow me .
text2: Tete mawudɔla la gblɔ nɛ be , “ Do wo ̀ awuwo kple wo ̀ afɔkpa . ” Petro wɔ nenema eye mawudɔla la yi edzi gblɔ nɛ be , “ Bla wo ̀ alidzi sesi ̃ e ne na ̃ dze yonyeme . ”

text: And he went out , and followed him ; and wist not that it was true which was done by the angel ; but thought he saw a vision .
text2: Petro wɔ abe ale si mawudɔla la gblɔ nɛ la ene eye wo ̀ dze eyome do go le gaxɔa me . Nu siwo nɔ dzɔdzɔm la wɔ na Petro abe drɔ ̃ e kum wo ̀ nɔ alo ŋutega kpɔm wo ̀ nɔ ene . Mexɔe se be kodzogbe yenɔ o .

text: When they were past the first and the second ward , they came unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city ; which opened to them of his own accord : and they went out , and passed on through one street ; and forthwith the angel departed from him .
text2: Wozɔ to agbo gba ̃ tɔ eveawo me bɔbɔe eye esi wova ɖo agbo ga ̃ mamlɛa si wotsɔ gakpo wɔe gbɔ la , agboa ŋutɔ ʋu le eɖokui si ale be wodo go hege ɖe dua ƒe ablɔ ŋutɔ dzi . Esi wogazɔ yi ŋgɔgbe vie ko la , mawudɔla la bu le Petro gbɔ .

text: And when Peter was come to himself , he said , Now I know of a surety , that the Lord hath sent his angel , and hath delivered me out of the hand of Herod , and from all the expectation of the people of the Jews .
text2: Azɔ ko hafi Petro nya nu si tututu dzɔ eye wo ̀ gblɔ na eɖokui be , “ Nyateƒe , Mawu dɔ eƒe dɔla ɖa wo ̀ va ɖem le Herodes kple Yudatɔwo ƒe tame vɔ ̃ si woɖo ɖe ŋunye la me . ”

text: And when he had considered the thing , he came to the house of Mary the mother of John , whose surname was Mark ; where many were gathered together praying .
text2: Petro nɔ tsitre , bu tame se ̃ , eye wo ̀ ɖoe be yeayi Maria si nye Marko Yohanes dada ƒeme , afi si hametɔ geɖewo ƒo ƒu ɖo , henɔ gbe dom ɖa le .

text: And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate , a damsel came to hearken , named Rhoda .
text2: Esi Petro va ɖo aƒea ƒe agbo nu la eƒo ʋɔa eye nyɔnuvi aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Roda la va be yeaʋui . Ke gba ̃ la , ebia ame si nɔ ʋɔa ƒom la ƒe ŋkɔ ta se .

text: And when she knew Peter ' s voice , she opened not the gate for gladness , but ran in , and told how Peter stood before the gate .
text2: Esi Roda se Petro ƒe gbe le agboa godo la dzi dzɔe ale gbegbe be wo ̀ ƒu du yi ɖe aƒea me ɖagblɔe na ƒuƒoƒea be Petro va le agboa nu le eƒom .

text: And they said unto her , Thou art mad . But she constantly affirmed that it was even so . Then said they , It is his angel .
text2: Ameawo mexɔ nyɔnuvia ƒe nya sia dzi se o eye ame aɖewo gblɔ nɛ gɔ ̃ be , “ Ewɔ abe ɖe wo ̀ susu da ene . ” Ke eganɔ gbe tem ɖe edzi na ameawo be Petro ƒe gbee yese . Ale wogblɔ be , “ Đewohi ̃ eƒe dzikpɔdɔlae le agboa nu . ” Elabena woxɔe se be wowui xoxo .

text: But Peter continued knocking : and when they had opened the door , and saw him , they were astonished .
text2: Ke Petro ganɔ ʋɔa ƒoƒo dzi ŋuse ̃ tɔe . Mlɔeba la , woyi ɖaʋu agboa eye esi wokpɔ Petro la gbɔgblɔ bu ɖe wo ŋutɔ .

text: But he , beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace , declared unto them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison . And he said , Go shew these things unto James , and to the brethren . And he departed , and went into another place .
text2: Petro bia tso wo si be woazi ɖoɖoe kpoo ale wo ̀ gblɔ ale si Mawu ɖee le gaxɔa me la na wo . Ebia tso wo si be woana Yakobo kple ame mamlɛawo nanya nu le nu si dzɔ la ŋu eye eya ŋutɔ dzo yi teƒe bubu afi si wo ̀ anɔ dedie le .

text: Now as soon as it was day , there was no small stir among the soldiers , what was become of Peter .
text2: Le fɔŋli me la zi ga ̃ aɖe tɔ le gaxɔa me . Ame aɖeke menya afi si Petro to o .

text: And when Herod had sought for him , and found him not , he examined the keepers , and commanded that they should be put to death . And he went down from Judaea to Caesarea , and there abode .
text2: Esi Herodes dɔ ame ɖo ɖa be woakplɔ Petro vɛ eye womekpɔe o la , ena wole ́ asrafo wuiadeawo kata ̃ drɔ ̃ ʋɔnu wo eye wotso kufia na wo hewu wo enumake . Le esia megbe la Herodes dzo yi ɖanɔ Kaisarea vie .

text: And Herod was highly displeased with them of Tyre and Sidon : but they came with one accord to him , and , having made Blastus the king ' s chamberlain their friend , desired peace ; because their country was nourished by the king ' s country .
text2: Le esime Herodes nɔ Kaisarea la , ame dɔdɔ aɖewo tso Tiro kple Sidon va egbɔ . Herodes melɔ ̃ a Tiro kple Sidontɔwo ƒe nya kura o . Le esia ta ame dɔdɔawo va dze xɔlɔ ̃ Blasto si nye agbale ̃ ŋlɔla ga ̃ le fia la ƒeme gbɔ eye wobia tso esi be wo ̀ aɖe kuku na Herodes ɖe yewo nu ale be ŋutifafa nava yewo kple fia la dome . Esia hia ̃ vevie elabena Tiro kple Sidontɔwo kpɔa woƒe nunyiame tso dukɔ siwo dzi ɖum Herodes le la gbɔ .

text: And upon a set day Herod , arrayed in royal apparel , sat upon his throne , and made an oration unto them .
text2: Woɖo ŋkeke na ame dɔdɔawo be woava kpɔ Herodes , esi ŋkekea ɖo la , wova ƒo ƒu , eye Herodes do eƒe fiawu nɔ eƒe fiazikpui dzi , heƒo nu na amehawo .

text: And the people gave a shout , saying , It is the voice of a god , and not of a man .
text2: Esi wo ̀ ƒo nu vɔ la , amehawo do ɣli kple dzidzɔ heda ŋkɔ ɖe Herodes dzi be , “ Eƒo nu abe mawu aɖe ene eye menye abe amegbetɔ ene o . ” Esia na be dzi dzɔ Herodes ŋutɔ eye wo ̀ kɔ eɖokui ɖe dzi hlodzoo .

text: And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him , because he gave not God the glory : and he was eaten of worms , and gave up the ghost .
text2: Enumake , mawudɔla aɖe ƒo Herodes eye wo ̀ na dɔle ́ le aɖe dze edzi . Ŋɔ viwo ge ɖe eƒe la ̃ me eye woɖui wo ̀ ku , elabena elɔ ̃ be amewo nasubɔ ye le esi wo ̀ atsɔ bubu na Mawu teƒe .

text: But the word of God grew and multiplied .
text2: Le ɣeyiɣi siawo me la nyanyui la nɔ ta kekem alɔtsɔtsɔe eye ame geɖewo trɔ zu xɔsetɔwo .

text: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem , when they had fulfilled their ministry , and took with them John , whose surname was Mark .
text2: Barnaba kple Saulo gaɖi tsa va Yerusalem eye esi wowu dɔ si wɔ ge woyi nu tete ko la wogatrɔ dzo yi Antrioxia eye wokplɔ Marko Yohanes ha ̃ yii .

text: Now there were in the church that was at Antioch certain prophets and teachers ; as Barnabas , and Simeon that was called Niger , and Lucius of Cyrene , and Manaen , which had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch , and Saul .
text2: Nyagblɔɖila kple nufiala aɖewo nɔ Antioxia hamea me ɣemaɣi eye wo dometɔ aɖewoe nye Barnaba kple Simɔn si wogayɔna ha ̃ be , “ Ameyibɔ , ” Lukio , tso Kirene , Manaim si nye Fia Herodes nɔvi kpakple Saulo .

text: As they ministered to the Lord , and fasted , the Holy Ghost said , Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work whereunto I have called them .
text2: Gbe ɖeka , esi ame siawo ƒo ƒu henɔ gbe dom ɖa nɔ nu tsim nɔ dɔdɔm la , Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la gblɔ na wo be , “ Mitia Barnaba kple Saulo be woayi aɖawɔ dɔ tɔxɛ si ta meyɔ wo la nam . ”

text: And when they had fasted and prayed , and laid their hands on them , they sent them away .
text2: Wogayi edzi wɔ nutsitsidɔ hedo gbe ɖa hena ɣeyiɣi aɖe eye le esia megbe la , woda asi ɖe Barnaba kple Saulo dzi , do gbe ɖa ɖe wo ta eye wodo mɔ wo be woayi .

text: So they , being sent forth by the Holy Ghost , departed unto Seleucia ; and from thence they sailed to Cyprus .
text2: Saulo kple Barnaba dze mɔ le Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la ƒe kpɔkplɔ te heyi ɖe Seleukia . Le afi sia la , woɖo tɔdziʋu heyi ɖe Kipro . Wokplɔ Marko Yohanes ha ̃ ɖe asi abe woƒe kpeɖeŋutɔ ene .

text: And when they were at Salamis , they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews : and they had also John to their minister .
text2: Esi wova ɖo du si woyɔna be Salami me la , woyi ɖe Yudatɔwo ƒe ƒuƒoƒe eye wogblɔ mawunya le afi ma .

text: And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos , they found a certain sorcerer , a false prophet , a Jew , whose name was Bar - jesus :
text2: Le esia megbe la , wogblɔ mawunya le du geɖewo me tso teƒe yi teƒe le Kipro ƒukpo bliboa dzi . Esi wova ɖo du si woyɔna be Pafo me la , wokpɔ Yudatɔ aɖe si woyɔna be , Bar Yesu . Ame sia nye ameflula , aʋatsonyagblɔɖila , kple afakala aɖe . Bar Yesu dze xɔlɔ ̃ Sergio Paulo si nye gɔvina le afi ma , eye wo ̀ nye ame si si

text: Which was with the deputy of the country , Sergius Paulus , a prudent man ; who called for Barnabas and Saul , and desired to hear the word of God .
text2: tagbɔ le eye wo ̀ sea nu gɔme ha ̃ . Gbe ɖeka , gɔvina Paulo be woava gblɔ Mawu ƒe nya la na ye .

text: But Elymas the sorcerer ( for so is his name by interpretation ) withstood them , seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith .
text2: Esi wonɔ nya la gblɔm nɛ la , afakala sia si ƒe ŋkɔ le Helagbe mee nye Elima la , te kpɔ be yeagble ̃ to na gɔvina la be megase Saulo kple Barnaba ƒe nyawo o , eye be megaxɔ Mawu dzi se ha ̃ o .

text: Then Saul , ( who also is called Paul , ) filled with the Holy Ghost , set his eyes on him ,
text2: Ke Saulo ame si wogayɔna be Paulo si me Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe yɔ fu ̃ la li ̃ ŋku ɖe Elima dzi ga ̃ a kple dziku eye wo ̀ blu ɖe eta be ,

text: And said , O full of all subtilty and all mischief , thou child of the devil , thou enemy of all righteousness , wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord ?
text2: “ Wo ̀ Abosam vi , ame vɔ ̃ ɖi , wo ̀ ameflula si le ́ a fu nu nyui ɖe sia ɖe , ɣekaɣie na ̃ dzudzɔ tsitretsitsi ɖe Aƒetɔ la ŋu ?

text: And now , behold , the hand of the Lord is upon thee , and thou shalt be blind , not seeing the sun for a season . And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness ; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand .
text2: Azɔ Mawu ahe to na wo ̀ eya ta wo ̀ ŋkuwo agba ̃ ale be ma ̃ gate ŋu akpɔ nu o hena ɣeyiɣi aɖe . ” Enumake Elima ƒe ŋku dzi tsyɔ eye wo ̀ de asi asitsatsa le yame me , henɔ kuku ɖem be ame aɖe nale ́ yeƒe alɔnu afia mɔ ye .

text: Then the deputy , when he saw what was done , believed , being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord .
text2: Nu sia wɔ nuku na gɔvina la ŋutɔ . Ekpɔe dze sii be ŋuse ̃ aɖe le mawunya me eya ta wo ̀ zu xɔsetɔ .

text: Now when Paul and his company loosed from Paphos , they came to Perga in Pamphylia : and John departing from them returned to Jerusalem .
text2: Le nu siawo megbe la , Paulo kple eŋumewo ɖo tɔdziʋu hedzo le Pafo ɖo ta Pamfilia si wogayɔna ha ̃ be Terki . Du gba ̃ tɔ si me wova ɖi go ɖo lae nye Perga . Yohanes gble ̃ wo ɖi le teƒe sia hetrɔ dzo yi Yerusalem .

text: But when they departed from Perga , they came to Antioch in Pisidia , and went into the synagogue on the sabbath day , and sat down .
text2: Ke Barnaba kple Paulo ya tso me yi Antioxia si le Pisidia nutome . Le Sabat ŋkeke dzi la woyi sɔleme le Yudatɔwo ƒe ƒuƒoƒe .

text: And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them , saying , Ye men and brethren , if ye have any word of exhortation for the people , say on .
text2: Esi woxle ̃ nya tso Mose ƒe Agbale ̃ kple Nyagblɔɖilawo ƒe Agbale ̃ awo me vɔ abe ale si wowɔnɛ ɖaa ene la , ƒuƒoƒemega ̃ wo dɔ ame ɖo ɖe Barnaba kple Paulo gbɔ gblɔ bena , “ Nɔviŋutsuwo , ne nuxlɔ ̃ amenya aɖe le mia si na ameawo la migblɔe , mieɖe kuku . ”

text: Then Paul stood up , and beckoning with his hand said , Men of Israel , and ye that fear God , give audience .
text2: Paulo tsi tre hedo gbe na wo eye wo ̀ da akpe na wo le mɔnukpɔkpɔ si wona wo la ta . Eƒo nu gblɔ na wo be , “ Israel ŋutsuwo kple ame sia ame si le afii , si vɔ ̃ a Mawu . Gba ̃ la , medi be maɖo ŋku blemanya ɖekaɖeka aɖewo dzi na mi . ”

text: The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers , and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt , and with an high arm brought he them out of it .
text2: Israel dukɔ sia ƒe Mawu , tia mi ́ aƒe dukɔ sia eye wo ̀ de bubu eŋu . Eɖee tso kluvinyenye me le Egipte nyigba dzi bubutɔe .

text: And about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness .
text2: Ekpɔ wo dzi kplɔ wo ɖɔɖɔɖɔ le gbedzi ƒe blaene sɔŋ .

text: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Chanaan , he divided their land to them by lot .
text2: Le esia megbe la , Mawu tsrɔ ̃ dukɔ adre sɔŋ le Kanan nyigba dzi eye wo ̀ tsɔ anyigba sia na Israelviwo abe woƒe domenyinu ene .

text: And after that he gave unto them judges about the space of four hundred and fifty years , until Samuel the prophet .
text2: Nu siawo yi edzi anɔ abe ƒe alafa ene blaetɔ ̃ ene . Le esiawo megbe la Mawu na ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ lawo ɖu dukɔa dzi va se ɖe nyagblɔɖila Samuel dzi .

text: And afterward they desired a king : and God gave unto them Saul the son of Cis , a man of the tribe of Benjamin , by the space of forty years .
text2: “ Ke nu kae va dzɔ ? Israelviwo ɖe kuku na Mawu be wo ̀ ana fia yewo abe ale si wo ̀ le dukɔ bubuwo sii la ene , eya ta Mawu na Saulo si nye Kish ƒe vi la va ɖu wo dzi abe fia ene . Saulo tso Benyamin ƒomea me eye wo ̀ ɖu fia ƒe blaene .

text: And when he had removed him , he raised up unto them David to be their king ; to whom also he gave testimony , and said , I have found David the son of Jesse , a man after mine own heart , which shall fulfil all my will .
text2: Ke emegbe la Mawu ɖe Saulo ɖa le zikpuia dzi eye wo ̀ tsɔ David si nye Yese vi la ɖo eteƒe . Mawu kpɔ ŋudzedze le David ŋu eye wo ̀ ɖi ɖase le eŋu be , ‘ David enye ame si dze nye dzi ŋu elabena ewɔ nye lɔlɔ ̃ nu . ’

text: Of this man ' s seed hath God according to his promise raised unto Israel a Saviour , Jesus :
text2: Fia David sia ƒe dzidzimevie nye Yesu ame si nye Đela si ŋugbe Mawu do na Israel dukɔ la . ”

text: When John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel .
text2: Paulo yi eƒe nuƒoa dzi be , “ Hafi Yesu sia nava la ame aɖe va do ŋgɔ nɛ si nye Yohanes Mawutsidetanamela . Ame sia gblɔ mawunya be ehia ̃ be Israelviwo kata ̃ nadzudzɔ nu vɔ ̃ wɔwɔ eye woatrɔ ɖe Mawu ŋu .

text: And as John fulfilled his course , he said , Whom think ye that I am ? I am not he . But , behold , there cometh one after me , whose shoes of his feet I am not worthy to loose .
text2: Esi Yohanes nɔ eƒe dɔ nu wum la , ebia amewo be , ‘ Đe miebu be nyee nye Mesia la maha ̃ ? Kpao menye nyee o . Ame si gbɔna la tri akɔ wum . Ne wotsɔm sɔ kplii la , nyemeɖi naneke kura o . ”
