text: Men and brethren , children of the stock of Abraham , and whosoever among you feareth God , to you is the word of this salvation sent .
text2: Nɔvinyewo , mi Abraham ƒe dzidzimeviwo kple mi Trɔ ̃ subɔla siwo vɔ ̃ a Mawu siaa , medi be mianya be , mi ́ awoe woɖo ɖeɖe ƒe gbedeasi sia ɖa . ”

text: For they that dwell at Jerusalem , and their rulers , because they knew him not , nor yet the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath day , they have fulfilled them in condemning him .
text2: Yudatɔ siwo le Yerusalem kple woƒe dumega ̃ wo wɔ ɖe nu si woŋlɔ da ɖi la dzi pɛpɛpɛ hewu Yesu . Wowui elabena , togbɔ be wonɔa nyagblɔɖilawo ƒe nyawo xle ̃ m ha ̃ la , womekpɔe dze sii eye womenya be eyae nye Đela si ŋu nyagblɔɖilawo nɔ nu ƒom le la o .

text: And though they found no cause of death in him , yet desired they Pilate that he should be slain .
text2: Le nyateƒe me la , womekpɔ vodada aɖeke le eŋu be wo ̀ adze na ku o gake wobia tso Pilato si be wo ̀ atso kufia nɛ kokoko .

text: And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him , they took him down from the tree , and laid him in a sepulchre .
text2: Esi nu sia nu va eme pɛpɛpɛ abe ale si woŋlɔe da ɖi le eƒe ku ŋu ene la , woɖe eƒe kukua le atitsoga ŋu heɖii ɖe yɔdo me .

text: But God raised him from the dead :
text2: ” Ke nɔvinyewo , Mawu gagbɔ agbee tso ku me ,

text: And he was seen many days of them which came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem , who are his witnesses unto the people .
text2: eye wo ̀ ɖe eɖokui fia ame siwo nɔ eŋu tso Yerusalem yi Galilea la zi geɖe . Ame siawo ɖi ɖase le eƒe tsitretsitsi ŋu ɖaa le dutoƒo le teƒe geɖewo .

text: And we declare unto you glad tidings , how that the promise which was made unto the fathers ,
text2: Nyanyui sia gblɔm mi ́ ele na mi ; ŋugbe si Mawu do na mi ́ a fofowo ,

text: God hath fulfilled the same unto us their children , in that he hath raised up Jesus again ; as it is also written in the second psalm , Thou art my Son , this day have I begotten thee .
text2: ŋugbedodo sia va eme na mi ́ , wo viwo esi wo ̀ fɔ Yesu ɖe tsitre tso ame kukuwo dome abe ale si woŋlɔe ɖe Psalmo evelia mee ene be , ‘ Wo ̀ e nye vinyeŋutsu , egbe mezu fofowo ̀ . ’

text: And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead , now no more to return to corruption , he said on this wise , I will give you the sure mercies of David .
text2: Kpeɖodzi be Mawu fɔe ɖe tsitre tso ame kukuwo dome eye makpɔ gbegble ̃ o le nya siawo me be , ‘ Matsɔ yayra kɔkɔe kple vava ̃ tɔ si ŋugbe wodo na David la na wo ̀ . ’

text: Wherefore he saith also in another psalm , Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption .
text2: Nenema ke wogblɔ le teƒe bubu ha ̃ be , ‘ Mana wo ̀ Kɔkɔetɔ la na ̃ to gbegble ̃ me o . ’

text: For David , after he had served his own generation by the will of God , fell on sleep , and was laid unto his fathers , and saw corruption :
text2: Menye David ŋutie wonɔ nya siawo gblɔm tsoe o , elabena ele nyanya me na mi ́ kata ̃ be esi David wɔ eƒe agbemedɔ vɔ abe ale si Mawu dii ene la , eku , woɖii eye eƒe ŋutila ̃ vo ɖe tome .

text: But he , whom God raised again , saw no corruption .
text2: Nya siawo ku ɖe ame bubu aɖe si Mawu gbɔ agbee tso ku me eye ku mekpɔ ŋuse ̃ aɖeke ɖe edzi o la boŋ ŋu . ”

text: Be it known unto you therefore , men and brethren , that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins :
text2: Paulo yi eƒe nuƒoƒoa dzi gblɔ na wo be , “ Nɔvinyewo , miɖo to miase nya sia ɖa . Yesu sia tae woatsɔ miaƒe nu vɔ ̃ wo ake mi .

text: And by him all that believe are justified from all things , from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses .
text2: Ame sia ame si xɔ edzi se la , woaɖee tso nu vɔ ̃ sime eye wo ̀ azu ame dzɔdzɔe . Nu sia nye nu ga ̃ aɖe si Yudatɔwo ƒe sewo mete ŋu wɔ na ame aɖeke o .

text: Beware therefore , lest that come upon you , which is spoken of in the prophets ;
text2: Mikpɔ nyuie , be nya siwo nyagblɔɖilawo gblɔ la nagaɖi mia ŋu o .

text: Behold , ye despisers , and wonder , and perish : for I work a work in your days , a work which ye shall in no wise believe , though a man declare it unto you .
text2: Wogblɔe be , ‘ Mi ame siwo doa vlo nyateƒe la la , mike ŋku ɖi miakpɔ nu ʋuu va se ɖe esime miatsrɔ ̃ . Mele dɔ ga ̃ aɖe wɔm le mia dome , gake ne wogblɔe miese la , miele exɔ ge ase akpɔ o . ’ ”

text: And when the Jews were gone out of the synagogue , the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them the next sabbath .
text2: Gbe ma gbe esime amewo kaka le ƒuƒoƒea la , ɖewo gblɔ na Paulo be eƒe nya vivi yewo nu ŋutɔ eya ta wo ̀ agatrɔ va ƒo nu na yewo le Sabat si agava la dzi .

text: Now when the congregation was broken up , many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas : who , speaking to them , persuaded them to continue in the grace of God .
text2: Ke ame geɖe siwo nye Yudatɔwo kple Trɔ ̃ subɔla siwo vɔ ̃ a Mawu la dze wo yome le ablɔ dzi eye Paulo kple Barnaba gblɔ na wo kple kukuɖeɖe be woaxɔ Mawu ƒe dɔmenyo si wo ̀ wɔ na wo la .

text: And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of God .
text2: Le ŋkeke enyia gbe la du bliboa kata ̃ kloe va ƒo ƒu be yewoase Mawu ƒe nya la .

text: But when the Jews saw the multitudes , they were filled with envy , and spake against those things which were spoken by Paul , contradicting and blaspheming .
text2: Amehawo ƒe agbɔsɔsɔ alea do ŋɔdzi na Yudatɔwo ale woʋa ̃ ŋu Paulo kple Barnaba ale gbegbe bena wogblɔ busunyawo eye wotsi tre ɖe nya sia nya si Paulo gblɔ la ŋu vevie .

text: Then Paul and Barnabas waxed bold , and said , It was necessary that the word of God should first have been spoken to you : but seeing ye put it from you , and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life , lo , we turn to the Gentiles .
text2: Nu sia meɖe dzi le Paulo kple Barnaba ƒo o ke boŋ wogblɔ kple dzideƒo be , “ Edze be woagblɔ Mawu ƒe nya nyui sia na mi Yudatɔwo gba ̃ , gake esi mieɖi gbɔ ̃ nya nyui la eye miebu mia ɖokui abe yewomedze na agbe mavɔ la o la , fifia mi ́ atsɔe ayii na Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo boŋ .

text: For so hath the Lord commanded us , saying , I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles , that thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth .
text2: Esia nye se si Mawu de nam be , ‘ Mewɔ wo ̀ be na ̃ nye akaɖi na Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo eye na ̃ kplɔ wo tso xexea me ƒe dzogoewo kata ̃ dzi ava be woakpɔ ɖeɖe le gbɔnye . ’ ”

text: And when the Gentiles heard this , they were glad , and glorified the word of the Lord : and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed .
text2: Paulo ƒe nya sia do dzidzɔ na Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo eye wo dometɔ siwo Mawu ŋutɔ tia da ɖi na agbe mavɔ la xɔe se .

text: And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region .
text2: Ale wɔ mawunya la keke ta le nutome ma kata ̃ me .

text: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women , and the chief men of the city , and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas , and expelled them out of their coasts .
text2: Dɔme ve Yudatɔwo ƒe dumega ̃ wo ale gbegbe be wode ʋunyaʋunya dua me nyɔnu ŋkutatɔ siwo vɔ ̃ a Mawu kple dumega ̃ wo me , ale be tɔtɔ ga ̃ aɖe va eye to esia me la wonya Paulo kple Barnaba do goe le dua me .

text: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them , and came unto Iconium .
text2: Ke woawo ha ̃ ʋuʋu woƒe afɔkewo ɖe anyi abe dzɔgbevɔ ̃ e ƒe dzesi ene eye woyi woƒe mɔzɔzɔa dzi ɖo ta Ikonio .

text: And the disciples were filled with joy , and with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Ke dzidzɔ blibo yɔ ame siwo trɔ zu xɔsetɔwo la me eye Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la ha ̃ yɔ wo me fu ̃ .

text: And it came to pass in Iconium , that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews , and so spake , that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed .
text2: Abe ale si wowɔnɛ le afi sia afi si wode ene la , Paulo kple Barnaba gayi Yudatɔwo ƒe ƒuƒoƒe le Ikonio ha ̃ eye wogblɔ nya kple ŋuse ̃ tɔxɛ aɖe ale be ame geɖe siwo nye Yudatɔwo kple Helatɔwo siaa , trɔ zu xɔsetɔwo .

text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles , and made their minds evil affected against the brethren .
text2: Ke Yudatɔ siwo medina be yewoase Mawu ƒe ɖeɖenya sia o la , gblɔ nya baɖa ƒomevi geɖewo ɖe Paulo kple Barnaba ŋu . Wowɔ esia be Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo nagaxɔ woƒe nyawo dzi ase o .

text: Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord , which gave testimony unto the word of his grace , and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands .
text2: Esia ha ̃ meɖe dzi le Paulo kple Barnaba ƒo kura o , ke boŋ wonɔ dua me hegblɔ mawunya kple dzideƒo ɣeyiɣi didi aɖe . Aƒetɔ la na ŋuse ̃ wo wowɔ nukunu geɖewo be woafia kɔtee be eƒe nya la kakam wole vava ̃ .

text: But the multitude of the city was divided : and part held with the Jews , and part with the apostles .
text2: Dua me tɔwo ma ɖe akpa eve , ɖewo nɔ Yudatɔwo ƒe dumega ̃ wo yome eye ɖewo ha ̃ nɔ Paulo kple Barnaba yome .

text: And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles , and also of the Jews with their rulers , to use them despitefully , and to stone them ,
text2: Ke ame aɖewo va nɔ ɖoɖo wɔm be yewoade zitɔtɔ Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo ƒe ha , Yudatɔwo kple Yudatɔwo ƒe dumega ̃ wo me ɖe Paulo kple Barnaba ŋu ale be ame siawo nadze Paulo kple Barnaba dzi aƒu kpe wo , awɔ nuvevi wo .

text: They were ware of it , and fled unto Lystra and Derbe , cities of Lycaonia , and unto the region that lieth round about :
text2: Esi apostoloawo se nya sia la , wosi dzo le dua me heyi Likaonia ƒe duwo , Listra kple Derbe nutomewo .

text: And there they preached the gospel .
text2: Eye wogblɔ nyanyui la fia le afi mawo ha ̃ .

text: And there sat a certain man at Lystra , impotent in his feet , being a cripple from his mother ' s womb , who never had walked :
text2: Le Listra la ŋutsua aɖe le anyinɔƒe , ame si metea ŋu tsia tre ɖe eƒe afɔwo dzi o , eye wo ̀ nye tekunɔ tso dadaa ƒe dɔme ke ; mezɔ azɔli ̃ kpɔ o .

text: The same heard Paul speak : who stedfastly beholding him , and perceiving that he had faith to be healed ,
text2: Ame sia ɖo to Paulo esi wo ̀ nɔ nu ƒom na ameawo . Paulo li ̃ ŋku ɖe edzi ga ̃ a eye wo ̀ kpɔ be xɔse le esi na dɔyɔyɔ ,

text: Said with a loud voice , Stand upright on thy feet . And he leaped and walked .
text2: eya ta Paulo yɔe gblɔ be , “ Tsi tre ɖe wo ̀ afɔwo dzi ! ” Le gbeɖeɖe sia nu la , ŋutsua ti kpo eye wo ̀ de asi azɔli ̃ zɔzɔ me .

text: And when the people saw what Paul had done , they lifted up their voices , saying in the speech of Lycaonia , The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men .
text2: Nukunu sia wu gbɔgblɔ na amehawo eye wogblɔ le wo nɔewo dome le woawo ŋutɔwo degbe me be , “ ame siawo la , mawuwoe wonye le amegbetɔ ƒe nɔnɔme me . ”

text: And they called Barnabas , Jupiter ; and Paul , Mercurius , because he was the chief speaker .
text2: Le woƒe nuwɔnawo ta la , wona ŋkɔ Barnaba be Yupiter si nye Helatɔwo ƒe mawu eye woyɔ Paulo be Merkurio elabena eyae nye ame si nɔ nu ƒom geɖe wu .

text: Then the priest of Jupiter , which was before their city , brought oxen and garlands unto the gates , and would have done sacrifice with the people .
text2: Enumake Yupiter ƒe trɔ ̃ nua si ƒe nɔƒe le dua godo la tsɔ seƒoƒowo kple nunanawo fu ̃ vɛ eye wo ̀ wɔ dzadzraɖo be yeawu nyitsu ga ̃ aɖe atsɔ asa vɔe na wo le dua ƒe agbowo nu le ameha la ŋkume .

text: Which when the apostles , Barnabas and Paul , heard of , they rent their clothes , and ran in among the people , crying out ,
text2: Nuwɔna sia gba ̃ dzi na Barnaba kple Paulo vevie ŋutɔ ale wosi du ge ɖe ameawo dome eye wodo ɣli gblɔ na wo be ,

text: And saying , Sirs , why do ye these things ? We also are men of like passions with you , and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God , which made heaven , and earth , and the sea , and all things that are therein :
text2: “ Mi ́ a tɔwo , nu kae nye busunu sia wɔm miele ? Mi ́ awo ha ̃ amegbetɔwo ko mi ́ enye abe miawo ke ene . Đe mi ́ eva be mi ́ agblɔ nyanyui sia na mi be miadzudzɔ nu maɖinu siawo tɔgbi subɔsubɔ eye miado gbe ɖa na Mawu gbagbe si wɔ dzi kple anyigba kple atsiaƒu kpakple nu siwo kata ̃ le eme la boŋ .

text: Who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways .
text2: Tsa ̃ la Mawu ɖe asi le dukɔ ɖe sia ɖe ŋu wo ̀ wɔ nu si dze eŋu .

text: Nevertheless he left not himself without witness , in that he did good , and gave us rain from heaven , and fruitful seasons , filling our hearts with food and gladness .
text2: Ke ha ̃ la medzudzɔ ɖaseɖiɖi tso eɖokui ŋuti o , elabena ewɔa nu nyuiwo na mi ́ , enaa tsidzadza mi ́ tso dziƒo kple nuƒa ̃ ɣiwo kple nuŋeɣiwo eye wo ̀ na nuɖuɖu geɖe mi ́ hetsɔ dzidzɔ yɔ mi ́ aƒe dziwo me fu ̃ . ”

text: And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people , that they had not done sacrifice unto them .
text2: Togbɔ be woɖe nya me na ameawo alea ha ̃ la , ese ̃ se hafi wozi wo dzi be womete ŋu sa vɔ la na wo o .

text: And there came thither certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium , who persuaded the people , and , having stoned Paul , drew him out of the city , supposing he had been dead .
text2: Ke le ŋkeke ʋe aɖewo ko megbe la , Yudatɔ aɖewo gatso Antioxia kple Ikonio va do ɖe Listra eye wogade ʋunyaʋunya dua me tɔwo me ɖe Paulo ŋu . Amehawo ho ɖe Paulo ŋu , ƒu kpee nyui va se ɖe esime wo ̀ ku ƒenyi eye wohee do goe le dua me elabena wobu be eku .

text: Howbeit , as the disciples stood round about him , he rose up , and came into the city : and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe .
text2: Xɔsetɔwo kple nɔvinɔviwo va ƒo ƒu ɖe eŋu kasia , Paulo fɔ , wo kata ̃ trɔ yi Listra dua me , eye le ŋkeke evea gbe la , wo kple Barnaba dzo yi Derbe .

text: And when they had preached the gospel to that city , and had taught many , they returned again to Lystra , and to Iconium , and Antioch ,
text2: Wonɔ Derbe hegblɔ nyanyui la le afi ma ŋkeke ʋe aɖewo eye ame geɖewo trɔ zu woƒe nusrɔ ̃ lawo . Emegbe la wogatrɔ yi Listra , Ikonio kple Antioxia eye wodo ŋuse ̃ xɔsetɔwo hefia ale si woalɔ ̃ Mawu kple wo nɔewoe ɖe edzi wu la wo .

text: Confirming the souls of the disciples , and exhorting them to continue in the faith , and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Wode dzi ƒo na xɔsetɔawo be woale ́ woƒe xɔse la me ɖe asi sesi ̃ e togbɔ be wole funyafunya wɔm wo ha ̃ elabena fukpekpe mee woato age ɖe dziƒofiaɖuƒe la me .

text: And when they had ordained them elders in every church , and had prayed with fasting , they commended them to the Lord , on whom they believed .
text2: Paulo kple Barnaba ɖo hamemega ̃ wo ɖe ha sia ha nu eye wowɔ nutsitsidɔ kple gbedodoɖa hetsɔ ameawo de asi na Mawu be wo ̀ akpɔ wo dzi le woƒe dɔwɔwɔwo me .

text: And after they had passed throughout Pisidia , they came to Pamphylia .
text2: Azɔ woyi woƒe mɔzɔzɔa dzi to Pisidia nutome va ɖo Pamfilia alo Terki .

text: And when they had preached the word in Perga , they went down into Attalia :
text2: Wogagblɔ nya le Perga ha ̃ hafi tso eme yi Atalia .

text: And thence sailed to Antioch , from whence they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled .
text2: Mlɔeba la , woɖo tɔdziʋu hetrɔ va ɖo Antioxia afi si wodze woƒe mɔzɔzɔa gɔme le . Afi siae Mawu de dɔ si nu wowu fifia la asi na wo le .

text: And when they were come , and had gathered the church together , they rehearsed all that God had done with them , and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles .
text2: Esi wogbɔ va ɖo Antioxia la woyɔ xɔsetɔawo kata ̃ ƒo ƒui heka nu ga ̃ siwo Mawu wɔ kpli wo la ta na wo . Wogblɔ ale si Mawu ʋu xɔse ƒe mɔ na Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo ha ̃ la na ameawo .

text: And there they abode long time with the disciples .
text2: Paulo kple Barnaba tsi Antioxia henɔ xɔsetɔawo gbɔ ɣeyiɣi didi aɖe .

text: And certain men which came down from Judaea taught the brethren , and said , Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses , ye cannot be saved .
text2: Le ɣeyiɣi si me Paulo kple Barnaba nɔ Antioxia la , ame aɖewo tso Yudea va Antioxia dua me . Ame siawo va nɔ nu fiam Trɔ ̃ subɔla siwo trɔ zu kristotɔwo la be , ehia ̃ vevie be woatso aʋa na wo abe ale si Yudatɔwo wɔnɛ ene , hafi woakpɔ ɖeɖe .

text: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them , they determined that Paul and Barnabas , and certain other of them , should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question .
text2: Paulo kple Barnaba melɔ ̃ ɖe nya sia dzi kura o ale wohe nya kple nenem me siawo vevie . Mlɔeba la , Antioxia ha la ɖe hametɔ aɖewo kpe ɖe Paulo kple Barnaba ŋu heɖo wo ɖe Yerusalem be woayi aɖadzro nya sia me kple apostoloawo kple hamemega ̃ wo anya woƒe susu le eŋu ava gblɔ na yewo .

text: And being brought on their way by the church , they passed through Phenice and Samaria , declaring the conversion of the Gentiles : and they caused great joy unto all the brethren .
text2: Ha blibo la kata ̃ yi ɖaɖo ame dɔdɔawo ɖa va se ɖe Antioxia dua godo , eye woyi woƒe mɔzɔzɔ dzi . Le mɔa dzi la , ame dɔdɔawo tɔ ɖe Foenike kple Samaria du siwo le mɔa dzi la me eye wogblɔ ale si Mawu le dɔ wɔm le Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo dome la na xɔsetɔ siwo le afi ma . Nya sia do dzidzɔ blibo na ame sia ame si see .

text: And when they were come to Jerusalem , they were received of the church , and of the apostles and elders , and they declared all things that God had done with them .
text2: Ame dɔdɔawo va ɖo Yerusalem eye wowɔ takpekpe kple apostoloawo kple hamemega ̃ wo kata ̃ . Paulo kple Barnaba ƒo nu tso dɔ si wɔm Mawu le to wo dzi le teƒe vovovowo la ŋu na wo .

text: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed , saying , That it was needful to circumcise them , and to command them to keep the law of Moses .
text2: Ke enumake , ame siwo nye Farisitɔwo tsa ̃ hafi trɔ zu kristotɔwo la , tsi tre eye wogblɔ be ele be woatso aʋa na Trɔ ̃ subɔla siwo trɔ zu xɔsetɔwo kata ̃ eye woawɔ ɖe Yudatɔwo ƒe sewo kple kɔnuwo kata ̃ ha ̃ dzi pɛpɛpɛ .

text: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter .
text2: Nya sia na be apostoloawo kple hamemega ̃ wo gaɖo ŋkeke be yewoabu tame le nya la ŋu nyuie .

text: And when there had been much disputing , Peter rose up , and said unto them , Men and brethren , ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us , that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel , and believe .
text2: Esi ŋkekea ɖo la wo kata ̃ wogava ƒo ƒu eye wodzro nya sia me ɣeyiɣi didi aɖe . Mlɔeba la , Petro tsi tre heƒo nu na wo gblɔ be , “ Nɔvinyewo , miawo ŋutɔ mienya be anɔ abe ƒe aɖewo nye esi va yi ene la , Mawu tiam le mia dome eye wo ̀ ɖom ɖa be magblɔ nyanyui la na Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo ale be woawo ha ̃ woaxɔ se azu kristotɔwo .

text: And God , which knoweth the hearts , bare them witness , giving them the Holy Ghost , even as he did unto us ;
text2: Mawu si nya amegbetɔ ɖe sia ɖe ƒe dzime la , xɔ wo hena Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la wo abe ale si wo ̀ na mi ́ awo ha ̃ ene .

text: And put no difference between us and them , purifying their hearts by faith .
text2: Mede vovototo aɖeke mi ́ kple woawo dome o elabena eɖe woƒe nu vɔ ̃ wo ɖa tso xɔse me abe mi ́ awo ke ene .

text: Now therefore why tempt ye God , to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples , which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear ?
text2: Ke nɔvinyewo , nu ka ta miedi be miate Mawu kpɔ adi be yewoatsɔ agba kpekpe si mi ́ awo ŋutɔ kple mi ́ a tɔgbuitɔgbuiwo mete ŋu tsɔ o la da ɖe woawo dzi be woatsɔ maha ̃ ?

text: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved , even as they .
text2: Ao , ɖe miexɔe se kpɔ be Aƒetɔ Yesu , si nye Mawu ƒe nunana la dzi koe ame sia ame ato akpɔ ɖeɖe oa ? ”

text: Then all the multitude kept silence , and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul , declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them .
text2: Le nuƒo sia megbe la ƒuƒoƒea zi ɖoɖoe eye nyahahe aɖeke megayi edzi o . Esia na mɔnu Paulo kple Barnaba be wogblɔ nukunu ga ̃ siwo Mawu wɔ to wo dzi le Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo dome la na wo .

text: And after they had held their peace , James answered , saying , Men and brethren , hearken unto me :
text2: Esi woawo ha ̃ ƒe gbe dze anyi la , Yakobo ha ̃ tsi tre heƒo nu gblɔ be , “ Tɔnyetɔwo , miɖo tom .

text: Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles , to take out of them a people for his name .
text2: Petro gblɔ ale si Mawu ŋutɔ tia amewo tso Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo dome bena woasubɔ ye ade bubu yeƒe ŋkɔ ŋuti la na mi .

text: And to this agree the words of the prophets ; as it is written ,
text2: Trɔsubɔla siwo trɔ zu Kristotɔ siawo ƒe nya sɔ kple nyagblɔɖila Amos ƒe nyagblɔɖi sia be

text: After this I will return , and will build again the tabernacle of David , which is fallen down ; and I will build again the ruins thereof , and I will set it up :
text2: ‘ Le nu siawo megbe la magatrɔ ava eye magatu David ƒe aƒe si mu dze anyi la , magagbugbɔ aɖo eƒe gli gbagba ̃ wo eye mafɔ wo ɖe tsitre ,

text: That the residue of men might seek after the Lord , and all the Gentiles , upon whom my name is called , saith the Lord , who doeth all these things .
text2: ale be ame susɔewo adi Aƒetɔ la kple Trɔ ̃ subɔla siwo ŋu woyɔ nye ŋkɔ ɖo la , Aƒetɔ la , ame si wɔa nu siawo kata ̃ lae gblɔe . ’

text: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world .
text2: Esiae nye nu si Aƒetɔ , ame si ɖe eƒe ɖoɖo si wo ̀ wɔ tso gɔmedzedzea me fia mi ́ la , gblɔ .

text: Wherefore my sentence is , that we trouble not them , which from among the Gentiles are turned to God :
text2: Esia ta nye nyametsotsoe nye be , mehia ̃ be mi ́ aɖe fu na ame siwo trɔ va Mawu gbɔ la o .

text: But that we write unto them , that they abstain from pollutions of idols , and from fornication , and from things strangled , and from blood .
text2: Ke ɖe ko mi ́ abia tso wo si be woadzudzɔ la ̃ siwo wotsɔ sa vɔe na trɔ ̃ wo kple la ̃ siwo tsi ʋu me la ɖuɖu eye hekpe ɖe esiawo ŋu la , woadzudzɔ ahasiwɔwɔ .

text: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him , being read in the synagogues every sabbath day .
text2: Elabena tso blema ke la , nu siawo nye kɔ na Yudatɔwo eye woƒoa nu le wo ŋu le Sabat sia Sabat dzi le Yudatɔwo ƒe ƒuƒoƒewo . ”

text: Then pleased it the apostles and elders , with the whole church , to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas ; namely , Judas surnamed Barsabas , and Silas , chief men among the brethren :
text2: Azɔ la apostoloawo kple hamemega ̃ wo kata ̃ va lɔ ̃ ɖe edzi be yewoaɖe ame aɖewo woakplɔ Paulo kple Barnaba ɖo ayi Antioxia be woaɖagblɔ nu si dzi woɖo kpee la na hame si le afi ma . Wotia hamemega ̃ eve be woayi . Woawoe nye Yuda si wogayɔna be Barsaba kple Sila .

text: And they wrote letters by them after this manner ; The apostles and elders and brethren send greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia :
text2: Woŋlɔ agbale ̃ de ame dɔdɔawo si eye emenyawo yi ale , “ Mi ́ a nɔvi Trɔ ̃ subɔla siwo trɔ ̃ zu xɔsetɔwo le Antioxa , Siria kple Kilikia , mixɔ gbedoname tso apostoloawo , hamemega ̃ wo kple mia nɔvi siwo le Yerusalem la gbɔ .

text: Forasmuch as we have heard , that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words , subverting your souls , saying , Ye must be circumcised , and keep the law : to whom we gave no such commandment :
text2: Mi ́ ese be xɔsetɔ aɖe siwo tso mi ́ a gbɔ le afii la va mia dome eye wova gblɔ nya aɖewo , siwo ɖe fu na miaƒe susu eye woʋuʋu miaƒe xɔse kple ɖeɖekpɔkpɔ la na mi . Mi ́ edi be mianya be , menye mi ́ awoe dɔ ame siawo ɖo ɖe mi o .

text: It seemed good unto us , being assembled with one accord , to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul ,
text2: Ke esi mi ́ awo ha ̃ miebu nya la ŋu eye mi ́ kata ̃ mi ́ eɖo kpe nu si nye nyateƒea dzi vɔ la , mi ́ eɖoe be anye susu nyui aɖe ŋutɔ be mi ́ aɖe ame dɔdɔ eve siwo woakplɔ mi ́ a nɔvi lɔlɔ ̃ awo , Paulo kple Barnaba , ɖo ava mia gbɔ .

text: Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Ame dɔdɔ eve siawo nye Yuda kple Sila , ame siwo tsɔ woƒe agbe ke faa na mi ́ aƒe Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo .

text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas , who shall also tell you the same things by mouth .
text2: Mi ́ eka ɖe dzi be ame siawo aƒo nu aɖo kpe nu si nye mi ́ aƒe susu le nya siwo le fu ɖem na mi ́ aƒe susuwo la dzi na mi .

text: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost , and to us , to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things ;
text2: Mi ́ ekpɔe dze sii be enyo Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la kple mi ́ awo ha ̃ ŋu be menyo be mi ́ atsɔ agba ga ̃ aɖeke ada ɖe mia dzi wu nu vevi siawo ko o ,

text: That ye abstain from meats offered to idols , and from blood , and from things strangled , and from fornication : from which if ye keep yourselves , ye shall do well . Fare ye well .
text2: be miatsri trɔ ̃ wo ƒe vɔsawo kple ʋu kpakple la ̃ tsiʋumewo ɖuɖu eye miatsri ahasiwɔwɔ ha ̃ . Ne miekpɔ mia ɖokui dzi nyuie le nu siawo me la , ekema miewɔe nyuie . Minɔ anyi nyuie . ”

text: So when they were dismissed , they came to Antioch : and when they had gathered the multitude together , they delivered the epistle :
text2: Ame dɔdɔ eneawo dze mɔ ɖo ta Antioxia enumake . Esi wova ɖo la woƒo kristotɔwo kata ̃ nu ƒu eye wotsɔ gbedeasia ɖo woƒe ŋkume .

text: Which when they had read , they rejoiced for the consolation .
text2: Esi woxle ̃ agbale ̃ a eye wose emenyawo la , hame bliboa kpɔ dzidzɔ manyagblɔ aɖe .

text: And Judas and Silas , being prophets also themselves , exhorted the brethren with many words , and confirmed them .
text2: Hekpe ɖe agbale ̃ a ŋu la , Yuda kple Sila ame siwo nya Mawu ƒe nya nyuie la gaƒo nu geɖe na hamea hedo ŋuse ̃ woƒe xɔse .

text: And after they had tarried there a space , they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles .
text2: Wonɔ Antioxia ŋkeke geɖe hafi wodo mɔ wo kple dzidzɔgbedoname tso Antioxia hamea gbɔ vɛ na Yerusalem hame si dɔ wo ɖa .

text: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still .
text2: Ke enyo Sila ŋu be yeatsi afi ma .

text: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch , teaching and preaching the word of the Lord , with many others also .
text2: Paulo kple Barnaba ha ̃ gatsi Antioxia hena kpekpeɖeŋu ame siwo nɔ mawunya gblɔm henɔ nu fiam amewo le afi ma .

text: And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas , Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord , and see how they do .
text2: Le ŋkeke aɖewo megbe la , Paulo doe ɖe Barnaba gbɔ be , “ Na mi ́ agbugbɔ ayi aɖakpɔ nɔvi siwo le du siwo me mi ́ egblɔ Aƒetɔ la ƒe nya la le la , akpɔ ale si wole zɔzɔmii la ɖa . ”

text: And Barnabas determined to take with them John , whose surname was Mark .
text2: Barnaba lɔ ̃ , ke edi be yewoatsɔ Yohanes , si woyɔna be Marko la , akpe ɖe yewo ɖokui ŋu .

text: But Paul thought not good to take him with them , who departed from them from Pamphylia , and went not with them to the work .
text2: Ke le ale si Marko gble ̃ wo ɖi le Pamfilia eye meyi dɔa dzi kple wo o ta la Paulo mebui be enyo be wo ̀ agayi kpli yewo o .

text: And the contention was so sharp between them , that they departed asunder one from the other : and so Barnabas took Mark , and sailed unto Cyprus ;
text2: Nu sia he masɔmasɔ de Paul kple Barnaba dome ale gbegbe be wo dome ma . Barnaba kplɔ Marko ɖe asi eye woɖo tɔdziʋu yi Kipro .

text: And Paul chose Silas , and departed , being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God .
text2: Ke Paulo ha ̃ tsɔ Sila kpe ɖe eɖokui ŋu , eye nɔviawo tsɔ wo de asi na Aƒetɔ la ƒe amenuveve .

text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia , confirming the churches .
text2: Woto Siria kple Kilikia nutowo me henɔ ŋuse ̃ dom hame siwo nɔ afi ma .

text: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra : and , behold , a certain disciple was there , named Timotheus , the son of a certain woman , which was a Jewess , and believed ; but his father was a Greek :
text2: Teƒe gba ̃ tɔ si Paulo kple Sila de lae nye Derbe . Emegbe woyi Listra . Le afi sia la wodo go nusrɔ ̃ la aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Timoteo ame si dada nye Yudatɔ kple kristotɔ ke fofoa nye Helatɔ .

text: Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium .
text2: Timoteo nye ɖekakpui aɖe si ƒe dɔwɔwɔ dze kristotɔ siwo le Listra kple Ikonio ŋu nyuie ŋutɔ .

text: Him would Paul have to go forth with him ; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters : for they knew all that his father was a Greek .
text2: Le esia ta Paulo bia tso esi be wo ̀ adze yewo yome le yewoƒe mɔzɔzɔ la me . Hafi woadze mɔ la , Paulo tso aʋa na Timoteo be wo ̀ aganye nuɖianu na Yudatɔ siwo le nutomea la o , elabena ele nyanya me na ame sia ame be Helatɔe nye Timoteo fofo .

text: And as they went through the cities , they delivered them the decrees for to keep , that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem .
text2: Azɔ woyi woƒe mɔzɔzɔ dzi henɔ tsatsam le duwo me . Afi sia afi si woɖo la , wogblɔa nya siwo dzi apostolowo kple hamemega ̃ wo ɖo kpee le Yerusalem le Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo siwo zu kristotɔwo ŋu la na hameawo .

text: And so were the churches established in the faith , and increased in number daily .
text2: Esia na be hameviawo tsi ɖe edzi le gbɔgbɔ me eye woƒe xexle ̃ me ha ̃ dzi ɖe edzi .

text: Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia , and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia ,
text2: Tso afi ma la , woyi Frigia kple Galatia nutome elabena Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la meɖe mɔ na wo be woayi Asia nyigba dzi le ɣeyiɣi sia me o .

text: After they were come to Mysia , they assayed to go into Bithynia : but the Spirit suffered them not .
text2: Woto Misia liƒo dzi heyina Bitinia le dzigbe godzi . Ke Yesu ƒe gbɔgbɔ gaxe mɔ na wo eya ta womete ŋu yi Bitinia o

text: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas .
text2: ke boŋ woto Misia nutome heyi Troa .

text: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night ; There stood a man of Macedonia , and prayed him , saying , Come over into Macedonia , and help us .
text2: Le gbe ma gbe ƒe za ̃ me la , Paulo kpɔ ŋutega aɖe . Ekpɔ ame aɖe si tsi tre ɖe Makedonia le Hela nyigba dzi nɔ kuku ɖem nɛ be , “ Tso ƒu la na ̃ va mi ́ a gbɔ le Makedonia le afii ne na ̃ va kpe ɖe mi ́ a ŋu . ”

text: And after he had seen the vision , immediately we endeavored to go into Macedonia , assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them .
text2: Enumake mi ́ eɖoe be mi ́ ayi Makedonia elabena edze na mi ́ kɔtee be Mawu le mi ́ a ɖom ɖe afi ma be mi ́ ayi aɖagblɔ nyanyui la .

text: Therefore loosing from Troas , we came with a straight course to Samothracia , and the next day to Neapolis ;
text2: Mi ́ eɖo tɔdziʋu le Troa va Samotrake eye le ŋkeke evea gbe la , mi ́ eva ɖo Neapoli .

text: And from thence to Philippi , which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia , and a colony : and we were in that city abiding certain days .
text2: Mlɔeba la mi ́ eva ɖo Filipi si nye Romatɔwo ƒe dutsotso aɖe si le Makedonia nyigba ƒe liƒo dzi tututu . Mi ́ enɔ afi ma ŋkeke geɖewo .

text: And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side , where prayer was wont to be made ; and we sat down , and spake unto the women which resorted thither .
text2: Le Sabat dzi la mi ́ eyi tɔsisi aɖe si didi tso dua gbɔ vie la to afi si mi ́ ese be ame aɖewo ƒoa ƒu ɖo doa gbe ɖa le , eye gbe ma gbe la mi ́ egblɔ mawunya na nyɔnu siwo va teƒea .

text: And a certain woman named Lydia , a seller of purple , of the city of Thyatira , which worshipped God , heard us : whose heart the Lord opened , that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul .
text2: Nyɔnu siawo dometɔ ɖekae nye Lidia si nye avɔdzrala aɖe tso Tiatira . Enye mawuvɔ ̃ la xoxo eye esi Paulo nɔ nu ƒom la Mawu ʋu eƒe dzi eye wo ̀ xɔ nya siwo kata ̃ Paulo gblɔ la dzi se .

text: And when she was baptized , and her household , she besought us , saying , If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord , come into my house , and abide there . And she constrained us .
text2: Esia ta mi ́ ede mawutsita na eya kple eƒe aƒemetɔwo kata ̃ eye emegbe la ekpe mi ́ be , mi ́ ava dze ye ƒeme . Lidia gblɔ na mi ́ be , ‘ Ne miexɔe se tututu be nye ha ̃ menye Aƒetɔ la tɔ vava ̃ la ekema miva dze gbɔnye . ’ Eƒoe ɖe mi ́ a nu ʋuu va se ɖe esime mi ́ elɔ ̃ yi ɖadze egbɔ . Wode Paulo kple Sila gaxɔ me .

text: And it came to pass , as we went to prayer , a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us , which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying :
text2: Gbe ɖeka esi mi ́ enɔ mɔ dzi yina gbedoɖaƒe le tɔa to la , mi ́ edo go ɖetugbi aɖe si me gbɔgbɔ vɔ ̃ nɔ eye wo ̀ tea ŋu kaa afa na amewo eye to esia me wo ̀ wɔa ga geɖe ŋutɔ na eƒe aƒetɔ elabena kluvi wo ̀ nye .

text: The same followed Paul and us , and cried , saying , These men are the servants of the most high God , which shew unto us the way of salvation .
text2: Đetugbi sia nɔ mi ́ a yome nɔ ɣli dom be , “ ‘ Ame siawo la , Mawu Dziƒoʋi ̃ tɔ ƒe dɔlawo wonye eye ɖe wova be yewoafia mi ale si miawɔ be woatsɔ miaƒe nu vɔ ̃ wo ake mi . ’ ”

text: And this did she many days . But Paul , being grieved , turned and said to the spirit , I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her . And he came out the same hour .
text2: Đetugbi la wɔ nenem nu sia ŋkeke geɖe ke gbe ɖeka la , eva glo Paulo ale wo ̀ trɔ ɖe ɖetugbi la ŋu heblu ɖe gbɔgbɔ vɔ ̃ si le eme la ta be , “ Mele gbe ɖem na wo ̀ le Yesu Kristo ƒe ŋkɔ me be do go le ɖetugbi sia me fifi laa ! ” Gbɔgbɔ vɔ ̃ la do go le eme enumake .

text: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone , they caught Paul and Silas , and drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers ,
text2: Nuwɔna sia do dziku na ɖetugbi sia ƒe aƒetɔwo elabena wobu woƒe gakpɔmɔnu . Le esia ta wona wole ́ Paulo kple Sila hekplɔ wo yi ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ la ga ̃ wo ƒe ŋkume le dutoƒo .

text: And brought them to the magistrates , saying , These men , being Jews , do exceedingly trouble our city ,
text2: Nutsotso si wowɔ ɖe wo ŋu na dumega ̃ wo lae nye be , “ Yudatɔ siawo va le to gble ̃ m na amewo le dua me

text: And teach customs , which are not lawful for us to receive , neither to observe , being Romans .
text2: be woawɔ nu siwo tsi tre ɖe Romatɔwo ƒe sewo ŋu . ”

text: And the multitude rose up together against them : and the magistrates rent off their clothes , and commanded to beat them .
text2: Kasia , ameha ga ̃ aɖe va ƒo ƒu henɔ ɣli dom . Edze ƒa ̃ be woɖo be yewoawɔ ʋunyaʋunya . Le esia ta dumega ̃ wo bu fɔ Paulo kple Sila eye woɖe gbe be woaƒo wo kple ati .

text: And when they had laid many stripes upon them , they cast them into prison , charging the jailor to keep them safely :
text2: Esi woƒo wo wo ̀ te wo ŋu nyuie la , wotsɔ wo de gaxɔ me , eye wogblɔ na gaxɔdzikpɔla vevie be ne menya o ameawo si la ekema eya ŋutɔ aku .

text: Who , having received such a charge , thrust them into the inner prison , and made their feet fast in the stocks .
text2: Le esia ta gaxɔdzikpɔla ha ̃ mefe kpli wo kura o . Etsɔ wo de gaxɔa ƒe gogloeaƒe ke eye wo ̀ de ga afɔ na wo sesi ̃ e .

text: And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed , and sang praises unto God : and the prisoners heard them .
text2: Le za ̃ bliboa me la Paulo kple Sila nɔ gbe dom ɖa nɔ ha dzim nɔ Mawu kafum . Gaxɔmenɔla bubuawo ha ̃ nɔ woƒe hawo sem .

text: And suddenly there was a great earthquake , so that the foundations of the prison were shaken : and immediately all the doors were opened , and every one ' s bands were loosed .
text2: Le za ̃ ga wuieve me tututu la , anyigba ʋuʋu sesi ̃ e eye gaxɔ bliboa ʋuʋu kpekpekpe ̃ , ʋɔtruawo kata ̃ ʋu le wo ɖokuiwo si eye ga si wode gaxɔmenɔla ɖe sia ɖe la ɖe ɖa .

text: And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep , and seeing the prison doors open , he drew out his sword , and would have killed himself , supposing that the prisoners had been fled .
text2: Esi gaxɔdzikpɔla nyɔ tso alɔ ̃ me eye wo ̀ kpɔ be ʋɔtruawo kata ̃ nɔ ʋuʋu ɖi la , vɔvɔ ̃ ɖoe elabena ebu be gamenɔlawo kata ̃ si dzo . Le esia ta , eɖe eƒe yi le aku me be yeawu ye ɖokui .

text: But Paul cried with a loud voice , saying , Do thyself no harm : for we are all here .
text2: Ke Paulo do ɣli gblɔ nɛ be , “ Nɔvi , me ̀ gawɔ nuvevi ɖokuiwo o ; mi ́ kata ̃ mi ́ ele afii . ”

text: Then he called for a light , and sprang in , and came trembling , and fell down before Paul and Silas ,
text2: Enumake gaxɔdzikpɔla la bia akaɖi ; ƒu du yi ɖe eme eye wo ̀ dze klo ɖe Paulo kple Sila ƒe afɔ nu le dzodzo nyanyanya me .

text: And brought them out , and said , Sirs , what must I do to be saved ?
text2: Ekplɔ wo do goe hebia be , “ Aƒetɔ , nu kae le nam be mawɔ bena makpɔ ɖeɖe ? ”

text: And they said , Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ , and thou shalt be saved , and thy house .
text2: Woɖo eŋu nɛ be , “ Ne e ̀ xɔ Aƒetɔ Yesu dzi se la , ekema wo ̀ kple wo ̀ aƒe blibo la miakpɔ xɔxɔ . ”

text: And they spake unto him the word of the Lord , and to all that were in his house .
text2: Wogblɔ Aƒetɔ la ƒe nya nɛ kple eƒe aƒemetɔwo kata ̃ .

text: And he took them the same hour of the night , and washed their stripes ; and was baptized , he and all his , straightway .
text2: Le za ̃ ma ke me gaxɔdzikpɔla klɔ woƒe abiwo na wo ; eye enumake wode mawutsi tsi ta na eya kple eƒe aƒe bliboa .

text: And when he had brought them into his house , he set meat before them , and rejoiced , believing in God with all his house .
text2: Ena nu wo , woɖu eye aƒea me tɔwo kata ̃ yɔ fu ̃ kple dzidzɔ elabena wotrɔ zu Mawu dzi xɔselawo .

text: And when it was day , the magistrates sent the serjeants , saying , Let those men go .
text2: Le ŋdi me la ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ lawo ɖo kpovitɔwo ɖe gaxɔdzikpɔla la kple gbeɖeɖe sia be , “ Đe asi le ŋutsu mawo ŋu ne woadzo . ”

text: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul , The magistrates have sent to let you go : now therefore depart , and go in peace .
text2: Gaxɔdzikpɔla la gblɔ nya la na Paulo be , “ Ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ lawo ɖo gbe ɖa be woaɖe asi le wo ̀ kple Sila ŋuti . Eya ta miate ŋu adzo azɔ . Miheyi le ŋutifafa me . ”

text: But Paul said unto them , They have beaten us openly uncondemned , being Romans , and have cast us into prison ; and now do they thrust us out privily ? nay verily ; but let them come themselves and fetch us out .
text2: Ke Paulo gblɔ na kpovitɔwo be , “ Woƒo mi ́ le dutoƒo ʋɔnumadrɔ ̃ madrɔ ̃ e , togbɔ be mi ́ enye Romatɔwo ha ̃ ; wode mi gaxɔ me , ke azɔ la woaɖe mi ́ ado goe le adzamea ? Gbeɖe ! Đe ko woawo ŋutɔ nava hafi woakplɔ mi adoe . ”

text: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates : and they feared , when they heard that they were Romans .
text2: Kpovitɔ siwo wodɔ ɖo ɖe gaxɔdzikpɔla gbɔ la trɔ va gblɔ Paulo ƒe nya la na ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ lawo eye vɔvɔ ̃ ɖo wo ŋutɔ esi wose be Paulo kple Sila nye Romatɔwo ta .

text: And they came and besought them , and brought them out , and desired them to depart out of the city .
text2: Dumega ̃ wo ɖe abla va wo gbɔ le gaxɔa me eye woɖe kuku na wo be woado go adzo le dua me .

text: And they went out of the prison , and entered into the house of Lydia and when they had seen the brethren , they comforted them , and departed .
text2: Paulo kple Sila trɔ yi Lidia ƒe aƒe me , eye xɔsetɔwo va ƒo ƒu ɖe wo ŋu eye wogagblɔ nyanyui la na wo hafi dzo le dua me .

text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where was a synagogue of the Jews :
text2: Azɔ ame eveawo zɔ mɔ to Amfipolis kple Apolonia nutomewo va ɖo Tesalonika afi si Yudatɔwo ƒe ƒuƒoƒe aɖe le .

text: And Paul , as his manner was , went in unto them , and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures ,
text2: Paulo yi ƒuƒoƒe sia abe ale si wo ̀ wɔne ɖaa ene eye wo ̀ gblɔ mawunya na ameawo .

text: Opening and alleging , that Christ must needs have suffered , and risen again from the dead ; and that this Jesus , whom I preach unto you , is Christ .
text2: Ewɔ esia Sabat etɔ ̃ siwo kplɔ wo nɔewo ɖo . Eɖe mawunya ƒe akpa si ku ɖe Mesia la ƒe fukpekpe , ku kple tsitretsitsi ŋu la me na wo , eye wo ̀ dze agbagba ha ̃ ɖee fia wo tso mawunya me be “ Yesue nye Mesia alo Đela la vava ̃ . ”

text: And some of them believed , and consorted with Paul and Silas ; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude , and of the chief women not a few .
text2: Ame geɖe siwo se Paulo ƒe nya la trɔ zu kristotɔwo eye wo dometɔ aɖewo nye Helatɔ siwo me mawuvɔvɔ ̃ le , kple dua me nyɔnu ŋkutatɔ aɖewo .

text: But the Jews which believed not , moved with envy , took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort , and gathered a company , and set all the city on an uproar , and assaulted the house of Jason , and sought to bring them out to the people .
text2: Yudatɔwo ƒe amega ̃ siwo nɔ dua me la ʋa ̃ ŋu Paulo kple Sila eya ta woƒo gbevu aɖewo nu ƒu eye wowɔ ʋunyaʋunya le dua me le Paulo kple Sila ta . Wova dze Yason ƒe aƒe afi si wonɔ la dzi kple susu be yewoale ́ Paulo kple Sila ahe wo va dumega ̃ wo ŋkumee ne woahe to na wo .

text: And when they found them not , they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city , crying , These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also ;
text2: Ke womekpɔ Paulo kple Sila le aƒea me o eya ta wole ́ Yason kple kristotɔ aɖewo , kplɔ wo yi dumega ̃ wo gbɔe . Wotsɔ nya ɖe Yason kple etɔwo ŋu eye wotso wo nu kple ɣli be , “ Paulo kple Sila , ame siwo he tɔtɔ va xexea me ƒe akpa geɖewo la va mi ́ aƒe du me afi sia ha ̃ hele ʋunyaʋunya hem vɛ . ”

text: Whom Jason hath received : and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar , saying that there is another king , one Jesus .
text2: Ke Yason ya na sitsoƒe wo ɖe eƒe aƒe me . Le esia ta wo kata ̃ wodze na ku elabena wole gbɔgblɔm be fia bubu aɖe gali si ŋkɔe nye Yesu , ame sia lolo wu Kaisaro . ” "

text: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city , when they heard these things .
text2: Nya siawo medzɔ dzi na dumega ̃ wo kple dua me tɔwo kura o .

text: And when they had taken security of Jason , and of the other , they let them go .
text2: Eya ta woka ŋkume na Yason kple etɔwo vevie eye wona ame aɖe de megbe na wo be yewomagawɔ nu sia ƒomevi azɔ o hafi woɖe asi le wo ŋu .

text: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea : who coming thither went into the synagogue of the Jews .
text2: Le za ̃ ma me la kristotɔ siwo le dua me la kplɔ Paulo kple Sila do goe le dua me alɔtsɔtsɔe eye woyi Beroea . Paulo kple Sila gayi woƒe dɔ dzi le afi sia ha ̃ heyi ɖagblɔ mawunya le Yudatɔwo ƒe ƒuƒoƒe si le dua me la me .

text: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica , in that they received the word with all readiness of mind , and searched the scriptures daily , whether those things were so .
text2: Beroeatɔwo ya le ́ fɔ ɖe nya la ŋu wu Tesalonikatɔwo , eye woɖo to Paulo ƒe nyagbɔgblɔ kple dzidzɔ . Woawo ŋutɔwo ha ̃ nɔa mawunya la me dzrom ɣesiaɣi be yewoakpɔe ɖa be nyateƒenya gblɔm Paulo kple Sila nɔ maha ̃ . "

text: Therefore many of them believed ; also of honourable women which were Greeks , and of men , not a few .
text2: To esia me la , wo dometɔ geɖewo zu xɔsetɔwo eye Helatɔ ŋkutatɔ siwo nye nyɔnuwo kple ŋutsuwo siaa xɔ nya la dzi se .

text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea , they came thither also , and stirred up the people .
text2: Esi Yudatɔ siwo tso Tesalonika la gase be Paulo nɔ mawunya gblɔm le Beroea la , wogati wo yome yi afi ma ha ̃ eye wo ̀ gade zi ameawo me ɖe wo ŋu .

text: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea : but Silas and Timotheus abode there still .
text2: Ke kritsotɔwo wɔ kaba ɖo Paulo ɖe anyigbe gome lɔƒo gake Sila kple Timoteo ya tsi anyi .

text: And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens : and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed , they departed .
text2: Ame siwo kplɔ Paulo yii la ɖoe ɖa va se ɖe Atene hafi trɔ yi Beroea . Paulo de gbe asi ma wo be woagblɔ na Sila kple Timoteo be woawɔ kaba ava tu ye le Atene .

text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens , his spirit was stirred in him , when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry .
text2: Esi Paulo nɔ Sila kple Timoteo lalam le Atene la , eɖi tsa le dua me . Nu siwo wo ̀ kpɔ la ɖu dzi nɛ ŋutɔ . Ekpɔ be legbawo bɔ ɖe dua me fu ̃ .

text: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews , and with the devout persons , and in the market daily with them that met with him .
text2: Eyi Yudatɔwo ƒe ƒuƒoƒe be yeadzro nya me kple Yudatɔwo kple Helatɔ vɔ ̃ mawuwo . Eƒo nu na ameha si le dua ƒe takpeƒe la ha ̃ gbe sia gbe .

text: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans , and of the Stoicks , encountered him . And some said , What will this babbler say ? other some , He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods : because he preached unto them Jesus , and the resurrection .
text2: Paulo dzro nya me kple xexemenunyala ga ̃ aɖewo siwo woyɔna be Epikurea kple Stoiktɔwo la ha ̃ . Esi wo ̀ ƒo nu na wo tso Yesu ƒe ku kple tsitretsitsi ŋu la , wo dometɔ aɖewo gblɔ be Paulo ƒe tagbɔ gble ̃ alo dzixɔse yeye aɖe boŋ ŋue wo ̀ nɔ nu ƒom le .

text: And they took him , and brought him unto Areopagus , saying , May we know what this new doctrine , whereof thou speakest , is ?
text2: Ale wole ́ e hekplɔe yi takpeƒe si woyɔna be Areopago la , afi ma wobia tso esi be , “ Na mi ́ ase nya tso nufiafia yeye si ne ̀ he vɛ la ŋu .

text: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears : we would know therefore what these things mean .
text2: E ̀ le nya masekpɔ aɖewo gblɔm ɖe miaƒe towo me , mi ́ edi be mi ́ ase nya siawo gɔme kple nu si wonye . ”

text: ( For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else , but either to tell , or to hear some new thing . )
text2: Atenetɔwo kata ̃ kple amedzroawo ha ̃ lɔ ̃ a anyinɔnɔ ɖe takpeƒe wɔa woƒe ɣeyiɣi ŋutidɔ to nyamedzodzro kple susu yeyewo xɔxɔ me .

text: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars ' hill , and said , Ye men of Athens , I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious .
text2: Esi ŋkekea ɖo la , Paulo tsi tre ɖe ameha la titina le Mastogbɛ la dzi heƒo nu gblɔ na wo bena , “ Nɔvinye Atenetɔwo , edze nam ƒa ̃ be mienye ame siwo kpɔa dzidzɔ le mawuvɔvɔ ̃ ŋu ŋutɔ ,

text: For as I passed by , and beheld your devotions , I found an altar with this inscription , TO THE UNKNOWN GOD . Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship , him declare I unto you .
text2: elabena esi menɔ tsa ɖim le miaƒe dua me la , mekpɔ legba geɖewo kple vɔsamlekpuiwo ha ̃ . Nukutɔe la mekpɔ ɖe si mieme na ŋkɔe be , ‘ Mawu si mienya o la tɔe . ’ Mawu si miesubɔna le manyamanya me la ƒe nyae metsɔ vɛ na mi . ”

text: God that made the world and all things therein , seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth , dwelleth not in temples made with hands ;
text2: “ Mawu siae wɔ dziƒo kple anyigba kple nu siwo kata ̃ le eme eye wo ̀ nye ga ̃ kple aƒetɔ na nu sia nu . Le esia ta menɔa gbedoxɔ si amewo tsɔ asi tui la me o ,

text: Neither is worshipped with men ' s hands , as though he needed any thing , seeing he giveth to all life , and breath , and all things ;
text2: eye le esime naneke mehia ̃ nɛ o ta la , amegbetɔ mate ŋu awɔ naneke nɛ o . Ke eya boŋ na agbegbɔgbɔ nu sia nu eye wo ̀ naa nu ame sia ame ɖe eƒe hiahia ̃ nu .

text: And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth , and hath determined the times before appointed , and the bounds of their habitation ;
text2: Mawu siae wɔ amegbetɔ siwo kata ̃ tso dzɔtsoƒe ɖeka eye wo ̀ kaka wo ɖe xexea me ƒe akpa ɖe sia ɖe . Eɖo liƒo na dukɔwo eye wo ̀ ɖo dukɔ siwo ayi ŋgɔ kple esiwo adze anyi la da ɖi xoxo . ”

text: That they should seek the Lord , if haply they might feel after him , and find him , though he be not far from every one of us :
text2: Mawu ƒe didie nye be amegbetɔwo nadii , ake ɖe eŋu togbɔ be egbɔ medidi tso ame aɖeke gbɔ o hafi ha ̃ .

text: For in him we live , and move , and have our being ; as certain also of your own poets have said , For we are also his offspring .
text2: Eya mee mi ́ ele agbe le abe ale si miaƒe hɛnɔ aɖe gblɔe ene bena , ‘ Mi ́ awoe nye Mawu viwo . ’

text: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God , we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold , or silver , or stone , graven by art and man ' s device .
text2: Eya ta ne mi ́ enye Mawu viwo la ekema menyo be mi ́ abu be Mawu nye legba si amegbetɔ awɔ kple klosalo kple sika alo akpae kple kpe o .

text: And the times of this ignorance God winked at ; but now commandeth all men every where to repent :
text2: Tsa ̃ la Mawu mia ŋku ɖe amegbetɔ ƒe numanyamanya dzi . Ke azɔ la ede se be ame sia ame naɖe asi le legbawo ŋu eye wo ̀ asubɔ ye ɖeka ko .

text: Because he hath appointed a day , in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he hath ordained ; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men , in that he hath raised him from the dead .
text2: Elabena eɖo ŋkeke tɔxɛ aɖe da ɖi be yeava drɔ ̃ ʋɔnu xexeame , eya ŋutɔ tia ame si le ʋɔnua drɔ ̃ ge la da ɖi eye eyae nye ame si wo ̀ fɔ ɖe tsitre tso ame kukuwo dome . ”

text: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead , some mocked : and others said , We will hear thee again of this matter .
text2: Esi wosee wo ̀ gblɔ , nya tso fɔfɔ tso ame kukuwo dome ŋu la , nyasela aɖewo koe ŋutɔ ke ame bubuwo ha ̃ be , “ Mi ́ edi be mi ́ agase nya sia ɣebubuɣi ”

text: So Paul departed from among them .
text2: Ale Paulo dzo le takpeƒea .

text: Howbeit certain men clave unto him , and believed : among the which was Dionysius the Areopagite , and a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
text2: Ame ʋe aɖewo ya dze eyome trɔ zu xɔsetɔwo . Ame siawo dometɔ aɖewo nye Dionisio si nye dumega ̃ ɖeka kple nyɔnu aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Damari .

text: After these things Paul departed from Athens , and came to Corinth ;
text2: Le nu siawo megbe la , Paulo dzo le Atene heyi Korinto afi si wo ̀ do go Yudatɔ aɖe si woyɔna be Akuila la le .

text: And found a certain Jew named Aquila , born in Pontus , lately come from Italy , with his wife Priscilla ; ( because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome : ) and came unto them .
text2: Wodzi Akuila le Ponto eye eya kple srɔ ̃ a Priskila nɔ Roma tsa ̃ gake Kaisaro Klaudio va de se be woanya Yudatɔwo kata ̃ dzoe le Roma dua me , eye le esia ta Akuila kple srɔ ̃ a ʋu va tsi Korinto .

text: And because he was of the same craft , he abode with them , and wrought : for by their occupation they were tentmakers .
text2: Paulo dze Akuila kple srɔ ̃ a gbɔ le Korinto eye wo ̀ wɔ dɔ kpli wo elabena wo kata ̃ nye avɔgbadɔwɔlawo .

text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath , and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks .
text2: Paulo yia Yudatɔwo ƒe ƒuƒoƒe si le dua me le Sabat ɖe sia aɖe dzi hedzroa mawunya me kple Yudatɔwo kpakple Helatɔwo siaa .

text: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia , Paul was pressed in the spirit , and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Esi Sila kple Timoteo tso Makedonia va ɖo Korinto ko la , Paulo ɖe asi le eƒe avɔgbadɔwɔwɔa ŋu eye wo ̀ nɔ nya gblɔm na Yudatɔwo gbe sia gbe henɔ ɖase ɖim be Yesue nye Mesia la .

text: And when they opposed themselves , and blasphemed , he shook his raiment , and said unto them , Your blood be upon your own heads ; I am clean : from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles .
text2: Ke le ale si Yudatɔwo tsi tre ɖe eŋu sesi ̃ e eye gawu la , wonɔ fewu ɖum henɔ busunyawo gblɔm ɖe Yesu ŋu ta la , Paulo ɖe ta le woƒe nya me eye wo ̀ gblɔ na wo be , “ Miaƒe ʋu neva miawo ŋutɔ ƒe ta dzi . Nye asi megale miaƒe nya me o . Tso azɔ dzi yina la magblɔ nyanyui la na Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo . ”

text: And he departed thence , and entered into a certain man ' s house , named Justus , one that worshipped God , whose house joined hard to the synagogue .
text2: Le esia megbe la edzo yi ɖanɔ Trɔ ̃ subɔla aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Tito Yusto la gbɔ . Ame sia ƒe aƒe te ɖe Yudatɔwo ƒe ƒuƒoƒe la ŋu eye wo ̀ nye mawuvɔ ̃ la adodoe aɖe .

text: And Crispus , the chief ruler of the synagogue , believed on the Lord with all his house ; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed , and were baptized .
text2: To Paulo ƒe afi ma nɔnɔ me la , Krispo si nye Yudatɔwo ƒe ƒuƒoƒea ƒe amega ̃ la kple eƒe aƒe blibo la me tɔwo kata ̃ trɔ zu kristotɔwo eye wode mawutsi ta na wo . Nenema kee nye Korintotɔ bubu geɖewo ha ̃ .

text: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision , Be not afraid , but speak , and hold not thy peace :
text2: Gbe ɖeka ƒe za ̃ me la , Mawu ƒo nu na Paulo le drɔ ̃ eƒe be , “ Me ̀ gavɔ ̃ o ; nɔ nya la gbɔgblɔ dzi eye me ̀ gazi ɖoɖoe o .

text: For I am with thee , and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee : for I have much people in this city .
text2: Elabena meli kpli wo ̀ eye ame aɖeke mate atsi tre ɖe ŋuwo ̀ o , ame geɖewo le du sia me siwo nye tɔnyewo . ”

text: And he continued there a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
text2: Nu sia do ŋuse ̃ Paulo ale wo ̀ nɔ Korinto ƒe ɖeka kple afa ̃ sɔŋ henɔ Mawu ƒe nyateƒenya la gblɔm .

text: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia , the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul , and brought him to the judgment seat ,
text2: Ke esi wova ɖo Galio gɔvinae le Akaya nutome la , Yudatɔwo gatso ɖe Paulo ŋu eye wohee va gɔvina la gbɔe be wo ̀ adrɔ ̃ ʋɔnui .

text: Saying , This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law .
text2: Wotsɔ nya ɖe eŋu be , “ Ŋutsu sia le amewo hem be woasubɔ Mawu le mɔ si mesɔ kple Romatɔwo tɔ o la dzi . ”

text: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth , Gallio said unto the Jews , If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness , O ye Jews , reason would that I should bear with you :
text2: Esi Paulo ke nu ko la , Galio xɔ nya la hegblɔ na Yudatɔwo be , “ Ne mi Yudatɔwo ɖe miele nutsotso nam tso nu vlo wɔwɔ aɖe alo amewuwu ŋuti la , anye ne maɖo to mi .

text: But if it be a question of words and names , and of your law , look ye to it ; for I will be no judge of such matters .
text2: Gake esi wo ̀ nye nu si ku ɖe miawo kple ame aɖe ƒe xɔse ŋuti la , miawo ŋutɔwo mikpɔ egbɔ . Nyemedi be manye ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ la le nya sia me o . ”

text: And he drave them from the judgment seat .
text2: Ale Galio nya wo do goe le ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ ƒea .

text: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes , the chief ruler of the synagogue , and beat him before the judgment seat . And Gallio cared for none of those things .
text2: Amehawo do dziku vevie ale be wodze Sostene si nye Yudatɔwo ƒe ƒuƒoƒea ƒe amega ̃ yeyea dzi eye wole ́ e heƒoe nyuie le ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ xɔa godo , gake Galio mede nu eme kura o .

text: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while , and then took his leave of the brethren , and sailed thence into Syria , and with him Priscilla and Aquila ; having shorn his head in Cenchrea : for he had a vow .
text2: Paulo ganɔ dua me ŋkeke aɖewo eye emegbe la , ekla ̃ kristotɔwo eye wo ̀ ɖo tɔdziʋu hedzo yi Siria nutome . Ekplɔ Priskilia kple Akuila ha ̃ ɖe asi . Esi wova ɖo Kentarea la , Paulo lu ̃ ta kolikoli le adzɔgbeɖeɖe si wo ̀ wɔ do ŋgɔe le Yudatɔwo ƒe kɔnu nu la ta .

text: And he came to Ephesus , and left them there : but he himself entered into the synagogue , and reasoned with the Jews .
text2: Esi wova ɖo Efeso la Paulo gble ̃ Akuila kple Priskila ɖe tɔdziʋua me eye wo ̀ yi ɖe dua me be yeadzro nya me kple Yudatɔ siwo le afi ma la le woƒe ƒuƒoƒe .

text: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them , he consented not ;
text2: Wobia tso esi be wo ̀ anɔ anyi vie gake egbe .

text: But bade them farewell , saying , I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem : but I will return again unto you , if God will . And he sailed from Ephesus .
text2: Ke esi wo ̀ le dzodzom le wo gbɔ la edo ŋugbe na wo be , “ Ne Mawu lɔ ̃ la matrɔ ava . ” Eya megbe la eɖo tɔdziʋu tso Efeso .

text: And when he had landed at Caesarea , and gone up , and saluted the church , he went down to Antioch .
text2: Esi wo ̀ ɖo Kaisarea la , e ̀ yi ɖado gbe na hamea eye wo ̀ yi Antioxia .

text: And after he had spent some time there , he departed , and went over all the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order , strengthening all the disciples .
text2: Enɔ afi ma vie eye wo ̀ dze mɔ ɖo ta Terki ke etɔ ɖe Galatia kple Frigia nutomewo eye wo ̀ do ŋuse ̃ hame siwo le nutomeawo hekpe ɖe wo ŋu be woagatsi ɖe edzi le gbɔgbɔ me . Apolo va Efeso kple Kɔrinto

text: And a certain Jew named Apollos , born at Alexandria , an eloquent man , and mighty in the scriptures , came to Ephesus .
text2: Eva va eme be Yudatɔ aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Apolo la tso Aleksandria si le Egipte la va Efeso . Ame sia nye mawunyanyala adodoe aɖe .

text: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord ; and being fervent in the spirit , he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord , knowing only the baptism of John .
text2: Wofia nui tso Aƒetɔ la ƒe mɔ ŋuti , egblɔa nya dzideƒotɔe eye wo ̀ fiaa nu tso Yesu ŋuti pɛpɛpɛ , togbɔ be Yohanes ƒe mawutsideta ko wo ̀ nya ha ̃ .

text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue : whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard , they took him unto them , and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly .
text2: Edze nufiafia gɔme le ƒuƒoƒea dzideƒotɔe . Esi Akuila kple Priskila se eƒe nyawo la wokpee yi wo ƒe aƒeme heɖe Mawu ƒe mɔ me nɛ tsitotsito wu esi wo ̀ nya tsa ̃ .

text: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia , the brethren wrote , exhorting the disciples to receive him : who , when he was come , helped them much which had believed through grace :
text2: Apolo di vevie be yeayi Hela nutome , ale xɔsetɔ siwo le Antioxia la do ŋuse ̃ e be wo ̀ ayi . Woŋlɔ agbale ̃ ɖo ɖe xɔsetɔ siwo le afi ma la be ne Apolo va la ,

text: For he mightily convinced the Jews , and that publickly , shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ .
text2: woaxɔe akpɔ edzi nyuie . Esi wo ̀ va ɖo Hela nutome la , egblɔ mawunya kple ŋuse ̃ eye wo ̀ do ŋuse ̃ hame siwo nɔ afi ma . Edzro nya me kple Yudatɔwo le dutoƒo eye wo ̀ ɖi ɖase be mawunya ɖee fia kɔtee be Yesue nye Mesia la vava ̃ . Paulo ƒe mɔzɔzɔ etɔ ̃ lia

text: And it came to pass , that , while Apollos was at Corinth , Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus : and finding certain disciples ,
text2: Esime Apolo ganɔ Korinto la , Paulo ha ̃ zɔ mɔ to Terki nutowo me va ɖo Efeso . Ekpɔe be xɔsetɔ aɖewo le afi ma eye le woƒe nyamedzodzro me la ,

text: He said unto them , Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed ? And they said unto him , We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost .
text2: Paulo bia wo se be , “ Esi miezu kristotɔwo ɖe , miexɔ Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe ɖe mia mea ? ” Ke woɖo eŋu be , “ Ao , mi ́ exɔ Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la o eye le nyateƒe me la , mi ́ ese eŋkɔ ha ̃ kpɔ o . Nu kae wo ̀ nye ? ”

text: And he said unto them , Unto what then were ye baptized ? And they said , Unto John ' s baptism .
text2: Paulo yi dzi bia wo be , “ Ekema nu ka dzie miexɔ se hafi wode mawutsi ta na mi ? ” Woɖo eŋu be , “ Wode mawutsi ta na mi ́ ɖe Yohanes Mawutsidetanamela ƒe nufiafia nu . ”

text: Then said Paul , John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance , saying unto the people , that they should believe on him which should come after him , that is , on Christ Jesus .
text2: Nya sia mevivi na Paulo o ale wo ̀ fia wo be Yohanes Mawutsidetanamela ɖe ko wo ̀ wɔe be yeafia ale si ame nadzudzɔ nu vɔ ̃ wɔwɔ atrɔ va Mawu gbɔ eye emegbe la wo ̀ axɔ Yesu Kristo ame si ƒe nya Yohanes gblɔ be ele vava ge la dzi ase ale be woade mawutsi ta nɛ ɖe eƒe ŋkɔ me .

text: When they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Esi wose nya sia la wo kata ̃ wolɔ ̃ eye Paulo gbugbɔ de mawutsi ta na wo ɖe Yesu Kristo ƒe ŋkɔ me .

text: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them , the Holy Ghost came on them ; and they spake with tongues , and prophesied .
text2: Emegbe la , Paulo do gbe ɖa ɖe wo ta eye wo ̀ da asi ɖe wo dzi ale be Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la ge ɖe wo me , eye woƒo nu kple gbegbɔgblɔ bubuwo hegblɔ nya ɖi ha ̃ .

text: And all the men were about twelve .
text2: Ameawo ƒe xexle ̃ me nɔ ame wuieve .

text: And he went into the synagogue , and spake boldly for the space of three months , disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God .
text2: Paulo nɔ Efeso ɣleti etɔ ̃ nɔ mawunya gblɔm le Sabat dzi . Edzea agbagba ɣesiaɣi be yeagblɔ nu si dzi wo ̀ xɔ se le mawufiaɖuƒea ŋu kple nu si ta wo ̀ xɔ edzi se la afia eye wo ̀ tena kpɔna be yeaɖe nya me na amewo be woaxɔ Yesu dzi ase .

text: But when divers were hardened , and believed not , but spake evil of that way before the multitude , he departed from them , and separated the disciples , disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus .
text2: Ame aɖewo mexɔ eƒe nya o ale wotsi tre ɖe eŋu vevie hegblɔ busunya geɖe ɖe Kristo ŋu le dutoƒo , nu sia na be Paulo dzo le wo gbɔ . Ke ekplɔ ame siwo xɔ eƒe nya la ɖe asi yi Tirano Takpexɔa me afi si wo ̀ ƒo nu na wo le gbe sia gbe .

text: And this continued by the space of two years ; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus , both Jews and Greeks .
text2: Ewɔ nu sia ƒe eve sɔŋ ale be Yudatɔwo kple Helatɔ siwo kata ̃ le Ausia si le Terki nutome la kata ̃ se nyanyui la .

text: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul :
text2: Mawu wɔ nukunu tɔxɛwo to Paulo ƒe asi dzi ,

text: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons , and the diseases departed from them , and the evil spirits went out of them .
text2: ale gbegbe be wo ̀ tsɔa takuviwo kple akɔtawuiwo kaa dɔnɔwo ŋu wohayana eye gbɔgbɔ vɔ ̃ wo ha ̃ doa go le wo me .

text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews , exorcists , took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus , saying , We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth .
text2: Yudatɔ aɖewo ha ̃ nɔ tsatsam tso du me yi du me henɔ gbɔgbɔ vɔ ̃ wo nyam le amewo me . Ame siawo va ɖo be yewoayɔ Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo ƒe ŋkɔ anya gbɔgbɔ vɔ ̃ e kpɔ be adze edzi na yewo maha ̃ ? Woɖoe be ne yewotu ame si me gbɔgbɔ vɔ ̃ le la , yewoado ɣli ɖe eta be , “ Meɖe gbe na wo ̀ le Yesu Kristo , ame si ƒe nya gblɔm Paulo le la ƒe ŋkɔ me be na ̃ do go ! ”

text: And there were seven sons of one Sceva , a Jew , and chief of the priests , which did so .
text2: Ame siwo nɔ nu sia wɔm la woe nye Yudatɔwo ƒe Osɔfo aɖe si woyɔna be Skeva la ƒe viŋutsuvi adreawo .

text: And the evil spirit answered and said , Jesus I know , and Paul I know ; but who are ye ?
text2: Wova ke ɖe ame aɖe si me gbɔgbɔ vɔ ̃ le la ŋu vava ̃ eye wote kpɔ be yewoanya gbɔgbɔ vɔ ̃ a le Yesu ƒe ŋkɔ me . Ke gbɔgbɔ vɔ ̃ la bia wo be , “ Menya nu tso Yesu kple Paulo ŋu nyuie , ke miawo ɖe , ame kawoe mienye ? ”

text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them , and overcame them , and prevailed against them , so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded .
text2: Enumake edzo dze wo dometɔ eve dzi , ƒo wo de abi wo ŋu eye wo ̀ vuvu awu le wo ŋu ale be wosi do go le aƒea me amamae .

text: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus ; and fear fell on them all , and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified .
text2: Nya sia kaka ɖe Yudatɔwo kple Helatɔwo siaa dome le Efeso dua me . Ale vɔvɔ ̃ tɔxɛ aɖe dze wo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe dzi eye wode bubu Aƒetɔ Yesu ƒe ŋkɔ ŋu .

text: And many that believed came , and confessed , and shewed their deeds .
text2: Ame geɖewo va eye woʋu woƒe nu vɔ ̃ ɖi wɔwɔwo me .

text: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together , and burned them before all men : and they counted the price of them , and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver .
text2: Ame aɖe siwo nye afakalawo la lɔ woƒe dzogba ̃ lewo kple nu kpotokpotoewo vɛ eye wotɔ dzo wo le dutoƒo . Nu siwo wotɔ dzoe la ƒe home anɔ abe ŋkeke ɖeka ƒe fetu ene .

text: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed .
text2: Esia nye dzesi be mawunya xɔ aƒe le nutome vava ̃ .

text: After these things were ended , Paul purposed in the spirit , when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia , to go to Jerusalem , saying , After I have been there , I must also see Rome .
text2: Emegbe la , Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la dee Paulo me be , wo ̀ ayi Hela nutome hafi atrɔ ayi Yerusalem . Eya ŋutɔ ha ̃ ɖoe be tso afi ma la ele be yeayi Roma ha ̃ .

text: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him , Timotheus and Erastus ; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season .
text2: Eɖo eƒe kpeɖeŋutɔ eve siwo nye Timoteo kple Erasto la ɖa be woadze ŋgɔ ayi Makedonia , Hela nutome , ke eya ŋutɔ gatsi Terki vie .

text: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way .
text2: Ke le ɣemaɣi la , masɔmasɔ ga ̃ aɖe va Efeso dua me le kristotɔwo ta .

text: For a certain man named Demetrius , a silversmith , which made silver shrines for Diana , brought no small gain unto the craftsmen ;
text2: Ame si he masɔmasɔ sia vɛ lae nye Demetrio . Ame sia nye klosalonutula eye dɔwɔviwo nɔ esi fu ̃ . Wonɔa Helatɔwo ƒe mawu , Diana , ƒe legbawo wɔm kple klosalo .

text: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation , and said , Sirs , ye know that by this craft we have our wealth .
text2: Gbe ɖeka la , Demetrio ƒo eƒe dɔwɔlawo kple ame siwo kata ̃ nye klosalonutulawo le dua me la nu ƒu eye wo ̀ ƒo nu na wo ale “ Mi ́ a tɔwo , miawo ŋutɔwo mienya be klosalonutudɔ siae mi ́ ewɔna ɖuna .

text: Moreover ye see and hear , that not alone at Ephesus , but almost throughout all Asia , this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people , saying that they be no gods , which are made with hands :
text2: Ke ele nyanya me na mi kata ̃ bena , Paulo va le tagbɔ gble ̃ m na amewo be mawu siwo wotsɔ asi wɔe la menye Mawu gbagbe o eye esia na be mi ́ aƒe dɔ megale edzi yim tututu le Efeso afii kple nutomea kata ̃ o .

text: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought ; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised , and her magnificence should be destroyed , whom all Asia and the world worshippeth .
text2: Azɔ medi be mianya be menye mi ́ aƒe dɔwɔna ɖeɖe tae mele nya siawo gblɔm o ke boŋ ele bɔbɔe be mi ́ aƒe mawu bubutɔ , Diana , subɔsubɔ dzi aɖe kpɔtɔ eye madidi o la , Diana , si nye mawuga ̃ si wosubɔna le mi ́ a ƒe nutome afii kple xexeame godoo la ƒe ŋkɔ abu keŋ . ”

text: And when they heard these sayings , they were full of wrath , and cried out , saying , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Nya sia de ada ̃ tame na ameha la ale wode asi ɣlidodo me sesi ̃ e be , “ Diana , Efesotɔwo ƒe mawu la , lolo loo ! ”

text: And the whole city was filled with confusion : and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus , men of Macedonia , Paul ' s companions in travel , they rushed with one accord into the theatre .
text2: Ɣlidodo sia na be amewo va ƒo zi be yewoakpɔ nu si le edzi yim la ɖa eye le ɣeyiɣi kpui aɖe megbe la , du blibo la kata ̃ tɔ zi . Ame sia ame ƒu du yi ƒuƒoƒea eye wole ́ Gayo kple Aristako ame siwo nye Paulo ƒe mɔzɔhatiwo , be woadrɔ ̃ ʋɔnu wo .

text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people , the disciples suffered him not .
text2: Paulo di vevie be yeadze wo yome ayi ƒuƒoƒea gake nusrɔ ̃ la bubuawo meɖe mɔ nɛ o .

text: And certain of the chief of Asia , which were his friends , sent unto him , desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre .
text2: Roma srafo siwo le nutomea la dometɔ siwo nye Paulo xɔlɔ ̃ wo ha ̃ ɖo ame ɖe egbɔ gblɔ nɛ be megado ta ɖe afi ma o ne menye nenema o la eƒe agbe aɖo xaxa me .

text: Some therefore cried one thing , and some another : for the assembly was confused ; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together .
text2: Takpekpea ŋutɔ tɔ zi kɔtɔɔ . Ame sia ame nɔ ɣli dom nɔ nya sia nya ƒomevi si dze eŋu la gblɔm . Vava ̃ , wo dometɔ geɖe ha ̃ menya nu si tututu ta wova ƒo ƒu ɖe afi ma gɔ ̃ ha ̃ o .

text: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude , the Jews putting him forward . And Alexander beckoned with the hand , and would have made his defence unto the people .
text2: Yudatɔ aɖewo kpɔ Aleksandro ɖa le amewo dome eye enumake wohee do goe wo ̀ va tsi tre ɖe ameha la ŋkume . Ekɔ asi dzi eye ɖoɖoe zi , ale wo ̀ de asi nuƒoƒo me na wo .

text: But when they knew that he was a Jew , all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Ke esi ameha la kpɔe dze sii be Yudatɔ wo ̀ nye la , wogade asi ɣlidodo me be , “ Diana , Efesotɔwo ƒe mawu la , lolo loo ! Diana , Efesotɔwo ƒe Mawu la , lolo loo ! ”

text: And when the townclerk had appeased the people , he said , Ye men of Ephesus , what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana , and of the image which fell down from Jupiter ?
text2: Mlɔeba la , dudzikpɔla ble wo nu wozi ɖoɖoe ale wo ̀ ƒo nu na wo gblɔ be , “ Efesotɔwo , ame sia ame nya be Efeso du siae nye trɔ ̃ ga ̃ Diana si ge tso dziƒo la ƒe du ga ̃ .

text: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against , ye ought to be quiet , and to do nothing rashly .
text2: Le esia ta mehia ̃ be ne ame aɖe gblɔ nya bubu aɖe ko la , mianɔ ʋunyʋunya wɔm alea gbegbe o .

text: For ye have brought hither these men , which are neither robbers of churches , nor yet blasphemers of your goddess .
text2: Ame siwo miele ́ va afii la mefi naneke le Diana ƒe gbedoxɔ me o eye womegblɔ nya gbegble ̃ aɖeke ɖe Diana ŋu ha ̃ o .

text: Wherefore if Demetrius , and the craftsmen which are with him , have a matter against any man , the law is open , and there are deputies : let them implead one another .
text2: Gake ne Demetrio kple eƒe hadɔwɔlawo kpɔ be nya aɖe le yewo kple ame siawo dome la ekema ɖe wo ̀ le na wo be woatsɔ nya ɖe wo ŋu le ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ ƒe . Ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ lawo ha ̃ le klalo be yewoadrɔ ̃ nyaa na wo .

text: But if ye inquire any thing concerning other matters , it shall be determined in a lawful assembly .
text2: Ne nya bubu aɖe gali la , ekema woate ŋu ayi Dutakpekpea me aɖale ́ wo kpɔ .

text: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day ' s uproar , there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse .
text2: Ke ne miekpɔ nyuie o la , Roma dziɖuɖua abia tso mi ́ a si be mi ́ ana akɔnta le egbe ƒe ʋunyaʋunya si nu ta mele o la ŋu , eye nyemenya nya ka magblɔ ne wo ̀ va eme alea o . ”

text: And when he had thus spoken , he dismissed the assembly .
text2: Ale dudzikpɔla la kaka ƒuƒoƒoa eye ame sia ame trɔ dzo yi aƒeme .

text: And after the uproar was ceased , Paul called unto him the disciples , and embraced them , and departed for to go into Macedonia .
text2: Le nu siawo kata ̃ megbe la , Paulo yɔ nusrɔ ̃ lawo eye wo ̀ gagblɔ nya na wo hede dzi ƒo na wo . Emegbe la ekla ̃ wo

text: And when he had gone over those parts , and had given them much exhortation , he came into Greece ,
text2: hedzo ɖo ta Hela nutome . Le du sia du si me wo ̀ ɖo le mɔa dzi me la , eƒoa nu hexlɔ ̃ a nu xɔsetɔ siwo le afi ma .

text: And there abode three months . And when the Jews laid wait for him , as he was about to sail into Syria , he purposed to return through Macedonia .
text2: Paulo nɔ Hela nyigba dzi ɣleti etɔ ̃ eye esi wo ̀ nɔ dzadzram ɖo be yeayi ɖe Siria la , ese be Yudatɔwo nɔ ɖoɖo wɔm be yewoawui . Le esia ta eɖoe be yeagatrɔ aɖo ta Makedonia si le dzigbe gome la boŋ .

text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea ; and of the Thessalonians , Aristarchus and Secundus ; and Gaius of Derbe , and Timotheus ; and of Asia , Tychicus and Trophimus .
text2: Ame geɖewo kplɔ Paulo ɖo ɖa va se ɖe keke Terki . Wo dometɔ aɖewoe nye Sopata si nye Piro ƒe vi tso Beroea , Aristaxo kple Sekundo siwo tso Tesalonika , Gayo tso Derbe , Timoteo , Tihiko kple Trofima ame siwo trɔ yina aƒe le Terki .

text: These going before tarried for us at Troas .
text2: Ame siwo kata ̃ do ŋgɔ na mi ́ eye wonɔ mi ́ a lalam le Troa .

text: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread , and came unto them to Troas in five days ; where we abode seven days .
text2: Esime mi ́ eɖu ŋutitotoŋkekenyui la vɔ ko la , mi ́ eɖo tɔdziʋu le Filipi si le Hela nyigba la ƒe dzigbe gome eye le ŋkeke atɔ ̃ megbe la mi ́ eva ɖo Troa si ha ̃ le Terki . Mi ́ enɔ afi ma kwasiɖa ɖeka .

text: And upon the first day of the week , when the disciples came together to break bread , Paul preached unto them , ready to depart on the morrow ; and continued his speech until midnight .
text2: Le Kwasiɖa ƒe ŋkeke gba ̃ tɔ la mi ́ eƒo ƒu be mi ́ axɔ Aƒetɔ ƒe Nuɖuɖu Kɔkɔe la . Pauloe gblɔ nya gbe ma gbe . Esi wo ̀ nye gbe ma gbee nye Paulo ƒe ŋkeke mamlɛtɔ le afi ma ta la , enɔ nu ƒom ʋuu va se ɖe za ̃ titina ke .

text: And there were many lights in the upper chamber , where they were gathered together .
text2: Wosi akaɖiwo ɖe afi si mi ́ enɔ le dziƒoxɔa dzi .

text: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus , being fallen into a deep sleep : and as Paul was long preaching , he sunk down with sleep , and fell down from the third loft , and was taken up dead .
text2: Esi Paulo nɔ nu ƒom alea la , ɖekakpui aɖe si woyɔna be Eutiko la nɔ akɔlɔ ̃ e dɔm le fesre ɖeka nu . Kasia , Eutiko ge tso fesrea nu le dziƒoxɔ etɔ ̃ lia dzi ke va dze anyigba kpla eye wo ̀ ku enumake .

text: And Paul went down , and fell on him , and embracing him said , Trouble not yourselves ; for his life is in him .
text2: Nu si dzɔ la metso dzika ƒo na Paulo kura o ke boŋ eɖi ɖe anyigba , kɔ ɖekakpuia ɖe eƒe abɔwo me eye wo ̀ gblɔ na ameha la be , “ Migawɔ ʋunyaʋunya o , naneke medzɔ ɖe edzi o . Egale agbe . ” "

text: When he therefore was come up again , and had broken bread , and eaten , and talked a long while , even till break of day , so he departed .
text2: Le nyateƒe me la , ɖekekpuia gagbɔ agbe , esia na be ameha la kpɔ dzidzɔ ŋutɔ .

text: And they brought the young man alive , and were not a little comforted .
text2: Wo kata ̃ gatrɔ yi dziƒoxɔa dzi eye woɖu Aƒetɔ ƒe Nuɖuɖu Kɔkɔe la . Le eya megbe la , Paulo gayi eƒe nuƒoa dzi ʋuu va se ɖe fɔŋli hafi wo ̀ dzo le wo gbɔ .

text: And we went before to ship , and sailed unto Assos , there intending to take in Paul : for so had he appointed , minding himself to go afoot .
text2: Paulo to afɔ yi Aso , ke mi ́ awo mi ́ eɖo tɔdziʋu hedze ŋgɔ nɛ .

text: And when he met with us at Assos , we took him in , and came to Mitylene .
text2: Eva tu mi ́ le afi ma eye mi ́ kata ̃ mi ́ eɖo ʋu yi Mitilene . " "

text: And we sailed thence , and came the next day over against Chios ; and the next day we arrived at Samos , and tarried at Trogyllium ; and the next day we came to Miletus .
text2: Tso afi ma mieve to Kio ŋu , va to Samo eye mlɔeba la mi ́ eva ɖo Mileto le ŋufɔke .

text: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus , because he would not spend the time in Asia : for he hasted , if it were possible for him , to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost .
text2: Paulo megadi be yeatɔ ɖe Efeso azɔ o elabena edi be ne yeate ŋui la , yeaɖo Yerusalem kaba aɖu Pentekoste ŋkeke la le afi ma .

text: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus , and called the elders of the church .
text2: Esi mi ́ eɖi go ɖe Mileto la , Paulo ɖo ame ɖe Efeso hamemega ̃ wo be woava do go ye le tɔdziʋua me .

text: And when they were come to him , he said unto them , Ye know , from the first day that I came into Asia , after what manner I have been with you at all seasons ,
text2: Esi wova ɖo la , egblɔ na wo be , " “ Mienya ale si menɔ mia dome tso ŋkeke gba ̃ tɔ si meva Asia nutowo me va se ɖe fifia .

text: Serving the Lord with all humility of mind , and with many tears , and temptations , which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews :
text2: Mesubɔ Aƒetɔ la le ɖokuibɔbɔɖeanyi kple aɖatsiwo me togbɔ be Yudatɔwo tem kpɔ to woƒe nugbeɖoɖowo ɖe ŋunye me ha ̃ . ”

text: And how I kept back nothing that was profitable unto you , but have shewed you , and have taught you publickly , and from house to house ,
text2: Gake ha ̃ la , nyemadzudzɔ nyateƒe la gbɔgblɔ na mi le dutoƒo loo alo le miaƒe aƒewo me kpɔ o .

text: Testifying both to the Jews , and also to the Greeks , repentance toward God , and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Nya ɖeka ma ke koe megblɔ na Yudatɔwo kple Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo siaa be , ehia ̃ be woadzudzɔ nu vɔ ̃ wɔwɔ eye woatrɔ ɖe Mawu ŋu to Yesu Kristo dzixɔse me .

text: And now , behold , I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem , not knowing the things that shall befall me there :
text2: Fifia la , Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la hem yina Yerusalem , togbɔ be nyemenya nu si le lalayem le afi ma o ha ̃ .

text: Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city , saying that bonds and afflictions abide me .
text2: Nu si ko Gbɔgbɔ la gblɔ nam le du sia du mee nye bena , fukpekpe kple gamenɔnɔ nye nu siwo wo ̀ le be makpɔ mɔ na .

text: But none of these things move me , neither count I my life dear unto myself , so that I might finish my course with joy , and the ministry , which I have received of the Lord Jesus , to testify the gospel of the grace of God .
text2: Ke viɖe aɖeke mele nye agbe ŋu o , negbe ɖe ko mewɔ eŋutidɔ tsɔ wɔ dɔ si Aƒetɔ Yesu de asi nam . Dɔae nye be magblɔ nyanyui la na amewo le Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ ̃ kple nublanuikpɔkpɔ ga ̃ ŋuti . ”

text: And now , behold , I know that ye all , among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God , shall see my face no more .
text2: Azɔ menyae nyuie be , mi ame siwo kata ̃ dome menɔ wɔ dɔ eye mefia nyanyui la mi la dometɔ aɖeke megale kpɔ nye ge akpɔ le agbe sia me o .

text: Wherefore I take you to record this day , that I am pure from the blood of all men .
text2: Medi be magblɔ na mi kɔtee be , womele ame aɖeke ƒe ʋu bia ge tso asinye o ,

text: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God .
text2: elabena nyemeɣla mawunya la ƒe akpa aɖeke ɖe mi o .

text: Take heed therefore unto yourselves , and to all the flock , over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers , to feed the church of God , which he hath purchased with his own blood .
text2: Azɔ la , mikpɔ mia ɖokui dzi nyuie eye mikpɔ egbɔ be mienyi Mawu ƒe ale ̃ ha si nye hame si wo ̀ tsɔ eya ŋutɔ ƒe ʋu ƒle , elabena Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la ɖo mi hadzikpɔlawoe .

text: For I know this , that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you , not sparing the flock .
text2: Menya nyuie be ne metrɔ megbe ko la , aʋatsonufiala aɖewo ava ɖo mia me abe amegaxi wɔada ̃ wo ene , eye woadze agbagba be yewoagble ̃ nu le ale ̃ ha si nye hamea ŋu .

text: Also of your own selves shall men arise , speaking perverse things , to draw away disciples after them .
text2: Mia dometɔ aɖewo ha ̃ ate kpɔ atrɔ nyateƒe la bubui be amewo nadze yewo yome .

text: Therefore watch , and remember , that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears .
text2: Eya ta minɔ ŋudzɔ ! Miɖo ŋku ƒe etɔ ̃ siwo menɔ mia dome la dzi . Miɖo ŋku ale si mekpɔa mia dzi za ̃ kple keli kple ale si mexlɔ ̃ a nu mi kple aɖatsi zi geɖe la dzi . ”

text: And now , brethren , I commend you to God , and to the word of his grace , which is able to build you up , and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified .
text2: Azɔ metsɔ mi de asi na Mawu , eya ame si ƒe nya ana be miaƒe xɔse nali ke be wo ̀ akpɔ mia ta eye wo ̀ akpɔ gome le ame tiatiawo kata ̃ ƒe domenyinu la me .

text: I have coveted no man ' s silver , or gold , or apparel .
text2: Nyemebia ̃ ŋu ɖe ame aɖeke ƒe klosalo alo sika alo awu ŋu o .

text: Yea , ye yourselves know , that these hands have ministered unto my necessities , and to them that were with me .
text2: Miawo ŋutɔ mienya ale si metsɔ nye asi wɔ dɔ hedi nye ŋutɔ kple nye kpeɖeŋutɔwo ƒe nuhiahia ̃ woe .
