text: I have shewed you all things , how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak , and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus , how he said , It is more blessed to give than to receive .
text2: Zi geɖe la , mefia ale si miakpe ɖe ahetɔwo ŋui la mi elabena meɖo ŋku nya si mi ́ aƒe Aƒetɔ Yesu gblɔ dzi be , ‘ Nunana hea yayra vanɛ wu nuxɔxɔ . ’ ”

text: And when he had thus spoken , he kneeled down , and prayed with them all .
text2: Esi Paulo wu eƒe nuƒoa nu la , edze klo hedo gbe ɖa kpli wo .

text: And they all wept sore , and fell on Paul ' s neck , and kissed him ,
text2: Le esia megbe la , wokpla asi kɔ nɛ hedo hedenyui nɛ kple avi ,

text: Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake , that they should see his face no more . And they accompanied him unto the ship .
text2: vevɔ le esime wo ̀ gblɔ na wo be womegale ye kpɔ ge akpɔ o la ta . Ale wokplɔe ɖo ɖa va se ɖe tɔdziʋua me ke .

text: And it came to pass , that after we were gotten from them , and had launched , we came with a straight course unto Coos , and the day following unto Rhodes , and from thence unto Patara :
text2: Esi mi ́ ekla ̃ Efeso hanunɔlawo vɔ la mi ́ edze mɔ te ̃ va ɖo Kos . Le ŋkeke evea gbe la , mi ́ eva ɖo Rode eye tso afi ma mi ́ eyi Patara .

text: And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia , we went aboard , and set forth .
text2: Le Patara la , mi ́ eɖo tɔdziʋu aɖe si nɔ Foenike si le Siria nutoa me yim .

text: Now when we had discovered Cyprus , we left it on the left hand , and sailed into Syria , and landed at Tyre : for there the ship was to unlade her burden .
text2: Mi ́ eto Kipro ƒukpo la ŋu le miame lɔƒo eye mi ́ eva ɖi go ɖe Tiro ʋudzeƒea le Siria . Ʋua ɖe agba le afi sia .

text: And finding disciples , we tarried there seven days : who said to Paul through the Spirit , that he should not go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Mi ́ awo ha ̃ mi ́ eɖi tsa yi dua me eye mi ́ edi xɔsetɔ siwo le afi ma la henɔ wo gbɔ kwasiɖa ɖeka . Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la ƒo nu to hame sia dzi ale wogbe na Paulo be megayi Yerusalem o .

text: And when we had accomplished those days , we departed and went our way ; and they all brought us on our way , with wives and children , till we were out of the city : and we kneeled down on the shore , and prayed .
text2: Ke esi mi ́ aƒe ɣeyiɣi de la mi ́ edzo eye mi ́ eyi miaƒe mɔzɔzɔ dzi . Hame blibo la , nusrɔ ̃ lawo kple wo srɔ ̃ wo kpakple wo viwo siaa va ɖo mi ɖa va se ɖe keke ƒuta , afi si mi ́ edo gbe ɖa le .

text: And when we had taken our leave one of another , we took ship ; and they returned home again .
text2: Mi ́ edo hedenyui na wo , ge ɖe tɔdziʋua me eye woawo ha ̃ trɔ yi aƒe me .

text: And when we had finished our course from Tyre , we came to Ptolemais , and saluted the brethren , and abode with them one day .
text2: Tso Tiro mi ́ eva tɔ ɖe Pitolemia eye mi ́ enɔ afi ma ha ̃ ŋkeke ɖeka hesra ̃ hame si le afi ma kpɔ .

text: And the next day we that were of Paul ' s company departed , and came unto Caesarea : and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist , which was one of the seven ; and abode with him .
text2: Tso afi ma mi ́ eyi Kaisarea eye mi ́ edze nyanyuigblɔla Filipo si nye hadzikpɔla gba ̃ tɔ adreawo dometɔ ɖeka la gbɔ .

text: And the same man had four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy .
text2: Vinyɔnuvi ene siwo dometɔ aɖeke meɖe srɔ ̃ haɖe o la nɔ esi . Mawu na nyagblɔɖi ƒe ŋuse ̃ wo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe .

text: And as we tarried there many days , there came down from Judaea a certain prophet , named Agabus .
text2: Mi ́ enɔ afi sia ŋkeke geɖewo eye le ɣeyiɣi sia me la , nyagblɔɖila aɖe si woyɔna be Agabu la tso Yudea nutome va kpɔ mi ́ ɖa le Filipo gbɔ .

text: And when he was come unto us , he took Paul ' s girdle , and bound his own hands and feet , and said , Thus saith the Holy Ghost , So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle , and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles .
text2: Agabu tsɔ Paulo ƒe alidziblaka eye wo ̀ bla eya ŋutɔ ƒe asiwo kple afɔwo hegblɔ be , “ Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe la be , ‘ Alea tututue Yudatɔwo awɔ ame si tɔe nye alidziblanu sia la le Yerusalem , eye woatsɔe ade asi na Romatɔwo . ’ ”

text: And when we heard these things , both we , and they of that place , besought him not to go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Esi mi ́ ese nya sia la , mi ́ Paulo ŋumewo kple dua me kristotɔwo kata ̃ , mi ́ eɖe kuku na Paulo be megayi Yerusalem la o .

text: Then Paul answered , What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart ? for I am ready not to be bound only , but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Ke Paulo ɖo eŋu na mi ́ be , “ Midzudzɔ avifafa elabena miele dzi gba ̃ m nam . Mele klalo be manɔ gaxɔ me le Yerusalem eye gawu la maku le nye Aƒetɔ Yesu ta . ”

text: And when he would not be persuaded , we ceased , saying , The will of the Lord be done .
text2: Esi mi ́ ekpɔe be Paulo ɖoe kplikpaa be yeayi Yerusalem la , mi ́ eɖe asi le nya la ŋu eye mi ́ etsɔe de asi na Mawu be wo ̀ awɔ eƒe lɔlɔ ̃ nu . "

text: And after those days we took up our carriages , and went up to Jerusalem .
text2: Le esia megbe la , mi ́ eƒo ƒu mi ́ aƒe agbawo eye mi ́ edze Yerusalem mɔ dzi .

text: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Caesarea , and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus , an old disciple , with whom we should lodge .
text2: Nusrɔ ̃ la aɖewo tso Kaisarea kplɔ mi ́ ɖo , eye mi ́ eva ɖo Yerusalem la , mi ́ edze xɔsetɔwo dometɔ ɖeka si ŋkɔe nye Mnason ame si nye xɔsetɔ xoxoawo dometɔ ɖeka si tso Kipro la ƒe aƒe me .

text: And when we were come to Jerusalem , the brethren received us gladly .
text2: Esi mi ́ eɖo Yerusalem la kristotɔ siwo le dua me la xɔ mi ́ nyuie ŋutɔ . "

text: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James ; and all the elders were present .
text2: Ke ŋkeke eveagbe la Paulo kplɔ mi ́ ɖe asi eye mi ́ eyi ɖado gbe na Yakobo kple hamemega ̃ bubuawo le Yerusalem ha la me .

text: And when he had saluted them , he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry .
text2: Esi mi ́ elɔ ̃ gbe vɔ la , Paulo gblɔ ale si Mawu wɔ dɔ le Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo domee to eya Paulo ƒe dɔwɔwɔ me la na wo .

text: And when they heard it , they glorified the Lord , and said unto him , Thou seest , brother , how many thousands of Jews there are which believe ; and they are all zealous of the law :
text2: Hamemega ̃ wo kata ̃ kpɔ dzidzɔ , kafu Mawu ke wogblɔ na Paulo be , “ Yudatɔ geɖewo ha ̃ zu kristotɔwo gake woƒe ɖoɖoe nye be ele be Yudatɔ xɔsetɔ ɖe sia ɖe nagawɔ ɖe Yudatɔwo ƒe kɔnuwo dzi pɛpɛpɛ .

text: And they are informed of thee , that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses , saying that they ought not to circumcise their children , neither to walk after the customs .
text2: Yudatɔ Kristotɔ siwo le Yerusalem afii la see be wo ̀ la , e ̀ tsi tre ɖe Mose ƒe sededewo kple mi ́ Yudatɔwo ƒe kɔnuwo ŋu eye gawu la e ̀ gblɔ be , mele be woatso aʋa na wo viwo o .

text: What is it therefore ? the multitude must needs come together : for they will hear that thou art come .
text2: Ke fifia ɖe , ale ke mi ́ ele nya sia le ́ gee ? Godoo la woasee be e ̀ va ɖo dua me .

text: Do therefore this that we say to thee : We have four men which have a vow on them ;
text2: ” Nu si mi ́ edi be na ̃ wɔe nye si ame ene aɖewo le mi ́ a dome siwo le dzadzram ɖo be yewoalu ̃ ta aɖe adzɔgbe le sea nu ,

text: Them take , and purify thyself with them , and be at charges with them , that they may shave their heads : and all may know that those things , whereof they were informed concerning thee , are nothing ; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly , and keepest the law .
text2: eya ta mi ́ adi be wo ̀ ha ̃ na ̃ kplɔ wo ɖo ayi gbedoxɔa me eye na ̃ lu ̃ ta . Hekpe ɖe esia ŋu la , na ̃ xe fe ɖe ame ene siawo ƒe kɔnuwɔwɔ ha ̃ ta . Ne e ̀ wɔ esia la ekema ame sia ame adze sii be nya siwo yewose le ŋuwo ̀ la mele eme nenema o .

text: As touching the Gentiles which believe , we have written and concluded that they observe no such thing , save only that they keep themselves from things offered to idols , and from blood , and from strangled , and from fornication .
text2: ” Ke le Trɔ ̃ subɔla siwo trɔ zu kristotɔwo gome la , ame aɖeke mele gbɔgblɔm be woawo ha ̃ nawɔ ɖe Yudatɔwo ƒe kɔnuwo dzi o , negbe nu siwo mi ́ eŋlɔ ɖo ɖe wo xoxo be , woadzudzɔ nu siwo wotsɔ sa vɔe na trɔ ̃ wo la kple la ̃ tsiʋumewo ɖuɖu eye womegawɔ matre o . ”

text: Then Paul took the men , and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple , to signify the accomplishment of the days of purifcation , until that an offering should be offered for every one of them .
text2: Paulo lɔ ̃ ɖe woƒe nya sia dzi eye wo ̀ dze ameawo yome woyi ɖawɔ kɔnuawo pɛpɛpɛ le gbedoxɔ la me , ale wo ̀ ɖee fia ame sia ame be yele vɔsa wɔ ge le ŋkeke adrea gbe .

text: And when the seven days were almost ended , the Jews which were of Asia , when they saw him in the temple , stirred up all the people , and laid hands on him ,
text2: Ke esi wo ̀ susɔ vie ŋkeke adrea nade la , Yudatɔ aɖewo tso Terki va Yerusalem eye wokpɔ Paulo le gbedoxɔa me . Enumake wode ʋunyanya amewo me ɖe eŋu eye wole ́ Paulo henɔ ɣli dom ɖe eŋu be ,

text: Crying out , Men of Israel , help : This is the man , that teacheth all men every where against the people , and the law , and this place : and further brought Greeks also into the temple , and hath polluted this holy place .
text2: “ Israelviwo , mixɔ na mi ́ loo ! Ame siae tsi tre ɖe Yudatɔwo ŋu eye wo ̀ nɔ gbɔgblɔm na amewo be womegawɔ ɖe Yudatɔwo ƒe sewo dzi o . Gawu la , edo vlo mi ́ aƒe gbedoxɔ la ha ̃ eye wo ̀ kplɔ Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo yi mi ́ aƒe gbedoxɔ mee be yeaɖi gbɔ ̃ gbedoxɔ la . ”

text: ( For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian , whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple . )
text2: Wogblɔ esia elabena wokpɔ Paulo wo ̀ nɔ zɔzɔm kple Trofimo si nye Trɔ ̃ subɔla aɖe tso Efeso le Terki la , le ablɔ dzi eya ta wosusu be Paulo kplɔe yi gbedoxɔa mee .

text: And all the city was moved , and the people ran together : and they took Paul , and drew him out of the temple : and forthwith the doors were shut .
text2: Zitɔtɔ ga ̃ aɖe dzɔ le dua me le nya sia ta eye wole ́ Paulo , hee do goe le gbedoxɔa me hedo ʋɔa .

text: And as they went about to kill him , tidings came unto the chief captain of the band , that all Jerusalem was in an uproar .
text2: Esi wobe yewoawui ko la , ame aɖe yi ɖagblɔ na Roma srafowo ƒe amega ̃ be ʋunyaʋunya ga ̃ aɖe le edzi yim le Yerusalem dua me .

text: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions , and ran down unto them : and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers , they left beating of Paul .
text2: Asrafomega ̃ la ɖe eƒe asrafo aɖewo ɖo ɖa be woayi aɖatsi ʋunyaʋunya la nu . Esi amehawo kpɔ asrafoawo gbɔna ko la wodzudzɔ Paulo ƒoƒo .

text: Then the chief captain came near , and took him , and commanded him to be bound with two chains ; and demanded who he was , and what he had done .
text2: Asrafoawo ƒe amega ̃ la na wole ́ Paulo eye woblae sesi ̃ e kple gakɔsɔkɔsɔ . Azɔ etrɔ ɖe ameha la gbɔ eye wo ̀ bia wo ame si Paulo nye kple nu vɔ ̃ si wo ̀ wɔ .

text: And some cried one thing , some another , among the multitude : and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult , he commanded him to be carried into the castle .
text2: Ame aɖeke mete ŋu na ŋuɖoɖo gobi aɖeke o elabena ame sia ame nɔ ɣli dom nɔ nya si dze eŋu la gblɔm . Le esia ta asrafowo ƒe amega ̃ la ɖe gbe be woakplɔ Paulo yi ɖe asrafowo ƒe nɔƒee .

text: And when he came upon the stairs , so it was , that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people .
text2: Esi wova afi ma henɔ atrakpuiawo liam la ameha la galu ̃ ɖe wo dzi kple ada ̃ . Esia na be asrafoawo kɔ Paulo ɖe abɔta be woƒe asi nagakae o .

text: For the multitude of the people followed after , crying , Away with him .
text2: Ke ha ̃ ameawo nɔ ɣli dom le wo yome sesi ̃ e be , “ Miwui ! Miwui ! ”

text: And as Paul was to be led into the castle , he said unto the chief captain , May I speak unto thee ? Who said , Canst thou speak Greek ?
text2: Esi wova ɖo gaxɔa ƒe mɔnu la , Paulo gblɔ na asrafoawo ƒe amega ̃ le Helagbe me be , “ Amega ̃ , magblɔ nya aɖe na wo ̀ . ” Ewɔ nuku na asrafoa ŋutɔ be Paulo gblɔ Helagbe ale wo ̀ biae be , “ Đe ne ̀ se Helagbea ?

text: Art not thou that Egyptian , which before these days madest an uproar , and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers ?
text2: Alo menye wo ̀ e nye Egiptetɔ ma si de zitɔtɔ amewo me abe ƒe ɖeka alo eve aɖewoe nye esi va yi ene eye ne ̀ kplɔ gbevuviwo abe akpe ene sɔŋ ene woyi ɖabe ɖe gbegbe aɖe oa ? ”

text: But Paul said , I am a man which am a Jew of Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , a citizen of no mean city : and , I beseech thee , suffer me to speak unto the people .
text2: Paulo ɖo eŋu be , “ Ao , nye la Yudatɔ menye tso Tarso le Kilikia nutome . Du sia nye du xɔŋkɔ aɖe . Meɖe kuku na wo ̀ ɖe mɔ nam maƒo nu na ameha la . ”

text: And when he had given him licence , Paul stood on the stairs , and beckoned with the hand unto the people . And when there was made a great silence , he spake unto them in the Hebrew tongue , saying ,
text2: Asrafowo ƒe amega ̃ la lɔ ̃ ɖe Paulo ƒe biabia la dzi ale Paulo tsi tre ɖe atrakpuia dzi hekɔ asi dzi na ameha la eye ɖoɖoe ga ̃ aɖe zi enumake . Azɔ eƒo nu na wo le Hebrigbe me be :

text: Men , brethren , and fathers , hear ye my defence which I make now unto you .
text2: “ Fofonyewo kple nɔvinyewo , to kukuɖeɖe me miɖo tom ne maɖe ɖokuinye nu ne miase . ”

text: ( And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them , they kept the more silence : and he saith , )
text2: Esi ameawo se be enɔ Hebrigbe gblɔm la , wogazi ɖoɖoe ɖe edzi wu tsa ̃ .

text: I am verily a man which am a Jew , born in Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel , and taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers , and was zealous toward God , as ye all are this day .
text2: Paulo yi edzi be , “ Yuda vidzidzi ŋutɔŋutɔe menye tso Tarso le Kililkia nutome . Ke Yerusalem afi siae mede suku le , eye nye nufialae nye Gamaliel , ame si hem be mawɔ ɖe Yudatɔwo ƒe sewo kple kɔnuwo dzi pɛpɛpɛ abe ale si dze ene . Enye nye didi vevi ɣemaɣi be made bubu Mawu ŋu le nu sia nu si mawɔ la me abe ale si miawo ha ̃ miele ewɔm fifia ene .

text: And I persecuted this way unto the death , binding and delivering into prisons both men and women .
text2: Meti kristotɔwo yome . Mewɔ funyafunya wo , wu wo , le ́ ŋutsuwo kple nyɔnuwo siaa de gaxɔ me .

text: As also the high priest doth bear me witness , and all the estate of the elders : from whom also I received letters unto the brethren , and went to Damascus , to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem , for to be punished .
text2: Yudatɔwo ƒe Osɔfoga ̃ alo Dumega ̃ ɖe sia ɖe ate ŋu aɖi ɖase na mi le nya siawo ŋu , elabe mexɔ agbale ̃ tɔxɛ tso wo gbɔ le Yerusalem si na ŋuse ̃ m be mayi Yudatɔwo ƒe amega ̃ wo gbɔ le Damasko eye woakpe ɖe ŋunye be male ́ kristotɔ siwo kata ̃ le dua me la , akplɔ wo va Yerusalem be woahe to na wo . ”

text: And it came to pass , that , as I made my journey , and was come nigh unto Damascus about noon , suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me .
text2: Ke esime wo ̀ susɔ vie maɖo Damasko dua me , le ŋdɔ ga wuieve me lɔƒo la , kekle ̃ ga ̃ aɖe tso dziƒo kle ̃ ƒo xla ̃ m .

text: And I fell unto the ground , and heard a voice saying unto me , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ?
text2: Ale medze anyi . Enumake mese ame aɖe ƒe gbe be , ‘ Saulo , Saulo , nu ka tae ne ̀ le yonyeme tim ale maha ̃ ? ’

text: And I answered , Who art thou , Lord ? And he said unto me , I am Jesus of Nazareth , whom thou persecutest .
text2: ” Mebia be , ‘ Meɖe kuku , wo ̀ ame kae le nu ƒom nam ? ’ Gbea ɖo eŋu be , ‘ Nyee nye Yesu , Nazaretitɔ , ame si yome tim ne ̀ le . ’

text: And they that were with me saw indeed the light , and were afraid ; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me .
text2: Ame siwo nɔ ŋunye la se nuƒoa pɛpɛpɛ gake womese nu si wo ̀ gblɔ la gɔme o .

text: And I said , What shall I do , Lord ? And the Lord said unto me , Arise , and go into Damascus ; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do .
text2: Meyi edzi gabiae be , ‘ Aƒetɔ nu ka mawɔ ? ’ “ Aƒetɔ la gblɔ nam be , ‘ Tso na ̃ yi Damasko dua me eye ame aɖe agblɔ nu siwo wɔ ge ne ̀ le le ƒe siwo gbɔna me la na wo . ’

text: And when I could not see for the glory of that light , being led by the hand of them that were with me , I came into Damascus .
text2: ” Ke esi metso le anyigba la mede dzesii be nyemegate ŋu nɔ nu kpɔm o . le kekeli ga ̃ ma ta ; eya ta ame siwo le ŋunye la , le ́ m ɖɔɖɔɖɔ hekplɔm yi Damasko .

text: And one Ananias , a devout man according to the law , having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt there ,
text2: Le afi ma la , ŋutsu aɖe si ƒe ŋkɔe nye Anania la va gbɔnye . Anania nye Yudatɔ , ame si mefena kple Yudatɔwo ƒe sewo o , ale Yudatɔ siwo kata ̃ le Damasko la tsɔ bubu tɔxɛ nɛ .

text: Came unto me , and stood , and said unto me , Brother Saul , receive thy sight . And the same hour I looked up upon him .
text2: Ame sia va tsi tre ɖe gbɔnye eye wo ̀ gblɔ nam be , ‘ Nɔvinye Saulo , ʋu ŋku na ̃ kpɔ nu ! ’ Enumake nye ŋkuwo ʋu eye megakpɔ nu .

text: And he said , The God of our fathers hath chosen thee , that thou shouldest know his will , and see that Just One , and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth .
text2: Anania yi edzi gblɔ nam be , ‘ Mi ́ a tɔgbuiwo ƒe Mawu la tia wo ̀ be na ̃ nya nu si nye eƒe lɔlɔ ̃ nu , ase eƒe gbe eye na ̃ kpɔ Dzɔdzɔetɔ la , ase eƒe nuƒo ha ̃ .

text: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard .
text2: Hekpe ɖe esia ŋu la ele be na ̃ tsɔ eƒe nyanyui la ayi xexea me ƒe afi sia afi eye na ̃ gblɔ nu siwo ne ̀ kpɔ kple nu siwo ne ̀ se la ha ̃ fia amewo .

text: And now why tarriest thou ? arise , and be baptized , and wash away thy sins , calling on the name of the Lord .
text2: Azɔ ɣeyiɣigbegble ̃ aɖeke megali o . Đe ko woade mawutsi ta na wo ̀ , aklɔ wo ̀ nu vɔ ̃ wo ɖa le Aƒetɔ la ƒe ŋkɔ me . ’

text: And it came to pass , that , when I was come again to Jerusalem , even while I prayed in the temple , I was in a trance ;
text2: Metrɔ va Yerusalem eye gbe ɖeka esi menɔ gbe dom ɖa le gbedoxɔ la me la , mekpɔ ŋutega aɖe

text: And saw him saying unto me , Make haste , and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem : for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me .
text2: eye Mawu gblɔ nam be , ‘ Wɔ kaba na ̃ dzo le Yerusalem elabena ne e ̀ gblɔ nye nya na amewo la womaxɔe se o . ’

text: And I said , Lord , they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee :
text2: Ke meɖo eŋu be , ‘ O , Aƒetɔ , ame siawo nya nyuie be ame siwo kata ̃ xɔ wo ̀ ŋkɔ dzi se la , mele ́ a wo tso ƒuƒoƒe yi ƒuƒoƒe , ƒoa wo eye medea wo gaxɔ me .

text: And when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed , I also was standing by , and consenting unto his death , and kept the raiment of them that slew him .
text2: Gawu la esime wonɔ wo ̀ dɔla Stefano wum la , nye ŋutɔ meda asi ɖe edzi . Menɔ afi ma eye mexɔ ame siwo nɔ ewum la ƒe awuwo le ́ ɖe asi na wo esime wonɔ kpe ƒumii . ’

text: And he said unto me , Depart : for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles .
text2: ” Gake Mawu gblɔ nam be madzo le dua me godoo elabena yeaɖom ɖe kekeke Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo gbɔ be magblɔ nya na wo . ”

text: And they gave him audience unto this word , and then lifted up their voices , and said , Away with such a fellow from the earth : for it is not fit that he should live .
text2: Esi wo ̀ gblɔ nya sia ko la , ameha la ganyra kple ɣli bobobo be , “ ‘ Mikplɔ ame ma ƒomevi dzoe ! Miyi ɖawui ! Medze be wo ̀ anɔ agbe o ! ’ ”

text: And as they cried out , and cast off their clothes , and threw dust into the air ,
text2: Ale woda woƒe awuwo ɖe ya me eye wolɔ ke hle ̃ ɖe yame dzikutɔe .

text: The chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle , and bade that he should be examined by scourging ; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him .
text2: Ale asrafowo ƒe amega ̃ ɖe gbe be woakplɔ Paulo yi xɔa mee , aƒoe kple atam va se ɖe esime wo ̀ ato nyateƒe be , yenya nu si tututu ta ameha la do dziku ɖe ye ŋu nenema ɖo .

text: And as they bound him with thongs , Paul said unto the centurion that stood by , Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman , and uncondemned ?
text2: Esime wonɔ Paulo blam be yewoaƒoe la , ebia asrafoawo ƒe nunɔla aɖe si nɔ tsitre ɖe egbɔ be , “ Ele se nu be miaƒo Romatɔ le esime womedrɔ ̃ ʋɔnui oa ? ”

text: When the centurion heard that , he went and told the chief captain , saying , Take heed what thou doest : for this man is a Roman .
text2: Asrafo sia yi eƒe amega ̃ gbɔ enumake ɖagblɔ nɛ be , “ Amega ̃ , nu kae nye esia ne ̀ be yeawɔ ? Me ̀ nya be ame sia la Romatɔ wo ̀ nye hafi ne ̀ be woaƒoe oa ? ”

text: Then the chief captain came , and said unto him , Tell me , art thou a Roman ? He said , Yea .
text2: Asrafowo ƒe amega ̃ la ɖe abla va Paulo gbɔ hebiae be , “ Ŋutsu , Romatɔe ne ̀ nye vava ̃ ? ” Paulo ɖo eŋu be , “ E ̃ , Romatɔe menye . ”

text: And the chief captain answered , With a great sum obtained I this freedom . And Paul said , But I was free born .
text2: Asrafowo ƒe amega ̃ la ha ̃ gagblɔ nɛ be , “ Nye ha ̃ Romatɔe menye gake ga home gbogbo aɖee mena hafi te ŋu zui . ” Ke Paulo gblɔ nɛ be , “ Nye ya Roma vidzidzie menye . ” "

text: Then straightway they departed from him which should have examined him : and the chief captain also was afraid , after he knew that he was a Roman , and because he had bound him .
text2: Nya sia na be vɔvɔ ̃ ɖo asrafowo ƒe amega ̃ la le esi wo ̀ ɖe gbe be woaƒo Paulo ta . Asrafo siwo nɔ dzadzram ɖo ɖe eƒoƒo ŋu la kata ̃ bu le afi ma enumake esi wose be Romatɔe wo ̀ nye .

text: On the morrow , because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews , he loosed him from his bands , and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear , and brought Paul down , and set him before them .
text2: Le ŋkeke evea gbe la , asrafowo ƒe amega ̃ la ɖe Paulo le gaxɔ me eye wo ̀ yɔ Osɔfoga ̃ wo kple Yudatɔwo ƒe amega ̃ wo ƒo ƒui . Azɔ ekplɔ Paulo va wo ŋkume be yease nu si tututue le tɔtɔ sia hem vɛ la gɔme . "

text: And Paul , earnestly beholding the council , said , Men and brethren , I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day .
text2: Paulo li ̃ ŋku ɖe takpekpea dzi ga ̃ a eye wo ̀ ƒo nu gblɔ be , “ Nɔviwo , nye dzitsinya ka ɖe edzi nam , be nye agbenɔnɔ dzea Mawu ŋu ɣesiaɣi . ”

text: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth .
text2: Esi wo ̀ ɖe nu le nya sia me tete ko la , Osɔfoga ̃ Anania ɖe gbe be ame siwo le Paulo gbɔ lɔƒo la naƒo nugbɔ nɛ . Ale woƒoe nɛ .

text: Then said Paul unto him , God shall smite thee , thou whited wall : for sittest thou to judge me after the law , and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law ?
text2: Paulo gblɔ nɛ be , “ Mawu aƒo wo ̀ ha ̃ , wo ̀ ame si le abe gli si wosi akalo na ene . E ̀ nɔ zi dzi be nadrɔ ̃ ʋɔnum ɖe se la nu , ke wo ̀ ŋutɔ ne ̀ da sea dzi , ɖe gbe be woaƒo alɔgbɔ nam ! ”

text: And they that stood by said , Revilest thou God ' s high priest ?
text2: Ame siwo nɔ tsitre ɖe Paulo gbɔ la do ɣli ɖe eta be , “ Mɔ kae ne ̀ kpɔ ne na ̃ nɔ Mawu ƒe Osɔfoga ̃ la dzum alea ? ”

text: Then said Paul , I wist not , brethren , that he was the high priest : for it is written , Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people .
text2: Paulo ɖo eŋu be , “ Tɔnye medzɔ o , nɔviwo , nyemenya be eyae nye Osɔfoga ̃ la o , elabena mawunya gblɔe be , ‘ Me ̀ gagblɔ nya vɔ ̃ aɖeke ɖe wo ̀ kplɔlawo ŋu o . ’ ”

text: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees , and the other Pharisees , he cried out in the council , Men and brethren , I am a Pharisee , the son of a Pharisee : of the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question .
text2: Enumake susu aɖe va tame na Paulo . Ekpɔe dze sii be takpekpea me valawo ƒe akpa aɖe nye Zadukitɔwo eye ɖe ha ̃ nye Farisitɔwo . Eya ta edo ɣli gblɔ bena , “ Nɔvinyewo , Farisitɔ menye abe tɔgbuinyewo ke ene , eye nu si ta wohem va ʋɔnui egbe lae nye be nye ha ̃ mexɔe se abe miawo ke ene be ame siwo ku la agafɔ tso ku me . ”

text: And when he had so said , there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees : and the multitude was divided .
text2: Esi wo ̀ gblɔ esia ko la ʋiʋli ge ɖe Farisitɔwo kple Zadukitɔwo dome eye takpekpea ma ɖe akpa eve ,

text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection , neither angel , nor spirit : but the Pharisees confess both .
text2: elabena Zadikitɔwo gblɔna be tsitretsitsi tso ame kukuwo dome meli o , eye mawudɔlawo kple gbɔgbɔwo meli o , ke Faristɔwo xɔ nu siawo dzi se be woli .

text: And there arose a great cry : and the scribes that were of the Pharisees ' part arose , and strove , saying , We find no evil in this man : but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him , let us not fight against God .
text2: Nu sia he tɔtɔ ga ̃ aɖe vɛ eye Yudatɔwo ƒe agbale ̃ fiala aɖewo tsi tre hedo ɣli be yewomekpɔ be naneke gble ̃ le Paulo ŋu o , ke boŋ ɖewohi ̃ mawudɔla alo gbɔgbɔ aɖee ƒo nu nɛ le Damasko mɔ dzi .

text: And when there arose a great dissension , the chief captain , fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them , commanded the soldiers to go down , and to take him by force from among them , and to bring him into the castle .
text2: Howɔwɔa va de dzi blibo eye ameawo nɔ Paulo hem tso afii yi afi . Mlɔeba la , asrafoawo ƒe amega ̃ ɖe gbe na eƒe asrafowo be woakplɔ Paulo adzoe sese ̃ tɔe le wo gbɔ ne menye nenema o la woava vuvui , ale wokplɔe gayi ɖe gaxɔa mee le asrafowo ƒe nɔƒe .

text: And the night following the Lord stood by him , and said , Be of good cheer , Paul : for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem , so must thou bear witness also at Rome .
text2: Le za ̃ me la , Aƒetɔ la va Paulo gbɔ va gblɔ nɛ be , “ Paulo , dzi megaɖe le ƒowo ̀ o , elabena abe ale si ne ̀ ɖi ɖase le ŋunye le Yerusalem ene la , nenema kee ne ̀ le ɖase ɖi ge le ŋunye le Roma ha ̃ . ”

text: And when it was day , certain of the Jews banded together , and bound themselves under a curse , saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul .
text2: Esi ŋu ke la Yudatɔ aɖewo ƒo ƒu eye woka atam na wo ɖokuiwo be ne yewomewu Paulo o kpaa , yewomaɖu nu alo ano tsi o .

text: And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy .
text2: Ŋutsu siwo ɖo vɔ ̃ sia la sɔ gbɔ wu ame blaene .

text: And they came to the chief priests and elders , and said , We have bound ourselves under a great curse , that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul .
text2: Woyi Osɔfoga ̃ wo kple dumega ̃ wo gbɔ hegblɔ woƒe ɖoɖoa na wo .

text: Now therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow , as though ye would inquire something more perfectly concerning him : and we , or ever he come near , are ready to kill him .
text2: Wogblɔ na wo be , “ Migawɔ abe ɖe miedi be yewoagabia gbe Paulo ene ale be miabia asrafowo ƒe amega ̃ ne wo ̀ akplɔe va takpekpe ga ̃ la mee abe nyitsɔ ene . Mi ́ awo la mi ́ abe ɖe mɔa dzi eye ne wokplɔ Paulo gbɔnae la , mi ́ adzo adze edzi awui . ”

text: And when Paul ' s sister ' s son heard of their lying in wait , he went and entered into the castle , and told Paul .
text2: Ke Paulo ƒe nyruiyɔvi aɖe se woƒe ɖoɖo sia ale wo ̀ ɖe abla yi ɖagblɔe na Paulo .

text: Then Paul called one of the centurions unto him , and said , Bring this young man unto the chief captain : for he hath a certain thing to tell him .
text2: Paulo yɔ asrafowo dometɔ ɖeka eye wo ̀ bia tso esi be wo ̀ akplɔ ɖekakpuia yi asrafoawo ƒe amega ̃ gbɔe elabe nya aɖe le esi wo ̀ di be yeagblɔ nɛ .

text: So he took him , and brought him to the chief captain , and said , Paul the prisoner called me unto him , and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee , who hath something to say unto thee .
text2: Asrafoa kplɔ ɖekakpuia yii abe ale si Paulo gblɔ nɛ ene .

text: Then the chief captain took him by the hand , and went with him aside privately , and asked him , What is that thou hast to tell me ?
text2: Asrafomega ̃ la kplɔ ɖekakpui la ɖe kpɔe hebia gbee be , “ Nya kae ne ̀ di be yeagblɔ nam ? ”

text: And he said , The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down Paul to morrow into the council , as though they would inquire somewhat of him more perfectly .
text2: Paulo ƒe nyruiyɔvi la gblɔ nɛ be , “ Etsɔ la , Yudatɔwo aɖo ame ɖe gbɔwo ̀ be na ̃ kplɔ Paulo va yewoƒe takpekpe ga ̃ la ŋkumee kple susu be yewoagabia gbee .

text: But do not thou yield unto them : for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men , which have bound themselves with an oath , that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him : and now are they ready , looking for a promise from thee .
text2: Gake me ̀ gawɔe o , elabena Yudatɔ blaene aɣla wo ɖokuiwo ɖe mɔa dzi be ne Paulo va yina la , yewoale ́ e awu . Woka atam na wo ɖokuiwo be ne Paulo meku o la , yewomaɖu nu alo ano tsi ha ̃ o , eya ta wobe ɖe mɔa dzi fifi laa ha ̃ xoxo . ”

text: So the chief captain then let the young man depart , and charged him , See thou tell no man that thou hast shewed these things to me .
text2: Asrafowo ƒe amega ̃ la gblɔ na ɖekakpuia be , “ Me ̀ gana ame aɖeke nanya be e ̀ va gblɔ nya sia nam o . ” Emegbe la edzo .

text: And he called unto him two centurions , saying , Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea , and horsemen threescore and ten , and spearmen two hundred , at the third hour of the night ;
text2: Enumake asrafomega ̃ la yɔ etevi eve eye wo ̀ gblɔ na wo be , “ Midzra ɖo miadze Kaesarea mɔ dzi egbe za ̃ ga asieke me .

text: And provide them beasts , that they may set Paul on , and bring him safe unto Felix the governor .
text2: Miƒo asrafo tutsɔla alafa eve , akplɔtsɔla alafa eve kple sɔdola blaadre nu ƒu , eye midi sɔ na Paulo wo ̀ ado ale be miakpiɔe ayi ɖade asi na Gɔvinaga ̃ Felike dedie . ”

text: And he wrote a letter after this manner :
text2: Eŋlɔ agbale ̃ kpe ɖe eŋu ale .

text: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix sendeth greeting .
text2: “ Klaudio Lisia Na Bubutɔ , Gɔvinaga ̃ Felike Xɔ gbedoname nyui sia .

text: This man was taken of the Jews , and should have been killed of them : then came I with an army , and rescued him , having understood that he was a Roman .
text2: Gbe ɖeka la Yudatɔwo le ́ ŋutsu sia eye wonɔ eƒom be yewoawui , ke esi mesee be Romatɔ wo ̀ nye la , meɖo asrafowo ɖa woyi ɖaxɔe le wo si .

text: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him , I brought him forth into their council :
text2: Emegbe la mekplɔe yi Yudatɔwo ƒe takpekpe ga ̃ la me be mase nu si tututu wo ̀ wɔ tae wole ́ e ɖo .

text: Whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law , but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds .
text2: Le woƒe nyamedzodzrowo me la , mekpɔe be menye nya gobi aɖekee wotsɔ ɖe eŋu o , ke boŋ nya siwo ku ɖe Yudatɔwo ƒe xɔse kple kɔnuwo ŋu la koe , eye medze be woawui alo adee gaxɔ me kura gɔ ̃ ha ̃ ɖe nya siawo ƒomevi ta o .

text: And when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man , I sent straightway to thee , and gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what they had against him . Farewell .
text2: Ke , le esime mesee be Yudatɔwo ganɔ ɖoɖo wɔm le bebeme be yewoawui ta la , meɖoe be makplɔe ɖo ɖe wo ̀ eye magblɔ na eƒe futɔwo ha ̃ be woava gbɔwo ̀ ne na ̃ drɔ ̃ nya la na wo . ”

text: Then the soldiers , as it was commanded them , took Paul , and brought him by night to Antipatris .
text2: Ale , le za ̃ ma me la asrafoawo kplɔ Paulo yi va ɖo Antipatre .

text: On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him , and returned to the castle :
text2: Esi ŋu ke la wotsɔe de asi na sɔdzisrafoawo be woakplɔe ayi Kaisarea , ke afɔzɔlawo ya gatrɔ va woƒe nɔƒe .

text: Who , when they came to Caesarea , and delivered the epistle to the governor , presented Paul also before him .
text2: Esi wova ɖo Kaisarea la , wotsɔ Paulo de asi na Gɔvinaga ̃ la eye wotsɔ agbale ̃ si Lisia ŋlɔ de wo si la ha ̃ nɛ .

text: And when the governor had read the letter , he asked of what province he was . And when he understood that he was of Cilicia ;
text2: Esi Gɔvinaga ̃ la xle ̃ agbale ̃ a vɔ la , ebia Paulo du si me tɔ wo ̀ nye , eye Paulo ɖo eŋu be , “ Metso Kilikia . ”

text: I will hear thee , said he , when thine accusers are also come . And he commanded him to be kept in Herod ' s judgment hall .
text2: Azɔ Gɔvinaga ̃ la gblɔ nɛ be , “ Maɖo to wo ̀ nyawo kata ̃ nenye be nuwo ̀ tsolawo va ɖo . ” Ale wo ̀ ɖe gbe be woaɖatui ɖe gaxɔ me le fia Herodes ƒe fiasa ̃ me . Wodrɔ ʋɔnu Paulo le Gɔvina Felike ŋkume

text: And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders , and with a certain orator named Tertullus , who informed the governor against Paul .
text2: Le ŋkeke etɔ ̃ a gbe la , Osɔfoga ̃ Anania kple eŋumewo yi Kaisarea be yewoatsɔ nya ɖe Paulo ŋu . Ame siwo nɔ Anania ŋu woe nye Yudatɔwo ƒe kplɔla aɖewo kple senyala Tertulo .

text: And when he was called forth , Tertullus began to accuse him , saying , Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness , and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence ,
text2: Esi gɔvina la bia gbe wo la , Tertulo ƒo nu ɖe wo nu gblɔ be , “ Amega ̃ bubutɔ Felike , le wo ̀ kpɔkplɔ nyui la te la , mi ́ Yudatɔwo mi ́ ekpɔ tomefafa kple bubu eye amewo megakpɔa mi ́ abe nu tsɛ aɖewo ko ene o .

text: We accept it always , and in all places , most noble Felix , with all thankfulness .
text2: Mi ́ ele akpe manyagblɔ aɖe dam na wo ̀ tso mi ́ aƒe dzime ke le esia ta .

text: Notwithstanding , that I be not further tedious unto thee , I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words .
text2: Nyemedi be magble ̃ ɣeyiɣi na wo ̀ boo o eya ta mayi nye nya dzi agblɔe kpuie ko .

text: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow , and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world , and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes :
text2: Ame si wokplɔ va gbɔwo ̀ e la , ame vɔ ̃ ɖi aɖe ŋutɔe wo ̀ nye . Eƒe dɔ koe nye be wo ̀ anɔ ʋunyaʋunya dem Yudatɔwo dome le xexeame kata ̃ godoo be woatsi tre ɖe Roma dziɖuɖua ŋu anɔ woƒe sewo kple kɔnuwo dzi dam . Eya koe nye habɔbɔ si woyɔna be Nazaretitɔwo la ƒe kplɔla ɖeka .

text: Who also hath gone about to profane the temple : whom we took , and would have judged according to our law .
text2: ” Nu si gavlo wu lae nye be , edi be yeado vlo mi ́ aƒe gbedoxɔ la hafi mi ́ eva do ɖe edzi hele ́ e .

text: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us , and with great violence took him away out of our hands ,
text2: Đe mi ́ ebe mi ́ awɔ fui abe ale si dze ene hafi asrafowo ƒe amega ̃ , Lisia , va xɔe le mi ́ a si sese ̃ tɔe ale be woadrɔ ̃ ʋɔnui le Roma se la nu .

text: Commanding his accusers to come unto thee : by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things , whereof we accuse him .
text2: Ne wo ̀ ŋutɔ e ̀ se eƒe numegbe ko la , ekema mi ́ aƒe nya me akɔ na wo ̀ . ”

text: And the Jews also assented , saying that these things were so .
text2: Yudatɔ mamlɛawo xɔ ɖe Tertulo ƒe nyawo dzi be wole eme tututu abe ale si wo ̀ gblɔe ene .

text: Then Paul , after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak , answered , Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation , I do the more cheerfully answer for myself :
text2: Azɔ eɖo Paulo ha ̃ dzi be wo ̀ aɖe eɖokui nu . Gɔvinaga ̃ la wɔ asi nɛ be wo ̀ atso aƒo nu . Paulo ɖe eɖokui nu gblɔ be , “ Amega ̃ bubutɔ , menya be menye egbee ne ̀ le Yudatɔwo ƒe nyawo drɔ ̃ m o . Le esia ta dzideƒo le asinye be maɖe ɖokuinye nu le gbɔwo ̀ .

text: Because that thou mayest understand , that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem for to worship .
text2: Anɔ abe ŋkeke wuieve koe nye esi ene , meva ɖo Yerusalem be mawɔ subɔsubɔdɔ le gbedoxɔ me .

text: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man , neither raising up the people , neither in the synagogues , nor in the city :
text2: Ame siwo le nunye tsom la mekpɔm menɔ nya hem kple ame aɖeke le gbedoxɔ me alo de zitɔtɔ ameha aɖewo dome le ƒuƒoƒe aɖeke alo le dua ƒe akpa aɖeke o .

text: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me .
text2: Le nya si wotsɔ ɖe nufiafia la ha ̃ me la , womate ŋu aɖee afia be enye nyateƒe o .

text: But this I confess unto thee , that after the way which they call heresy , so worship I the God of my fathers , believing all things which are written in the law and in the prophets :
text2: Ke ha ̃ la , melɔ ̃ ɖe edzi be mesubɔa mi ́ a fofowo ƒe Mawu la abe ame si le mɔ la dzi ene , esi amewo yɔna be kɔmama . Mexɔ nu sia nu si sɔ kple se la kple nu siwo woŋlɔ ɖe nyagblɔɖigbale ̃ awo me la dzi se .

text: And have hope toward God , which they themselves also allow , that there shall be a resurrection of the dead , both of the just and unjust .
text2: Mexɔe se ha ̃ abe ame siawo ke ene be nu vɔ ̃ wɔlawo kple ame dzɔdzɔewo siaa afɔ tso ku me .

text: And herein do I exercise myself , to have always a conscience void of offence toward God , and toward men .
text2: Eye le esia ta la , medze agbagba wɔa nye ŋuse ̃ kata ̃ ŋutidɔ be nye agbenɔnɔ nadze Mawu kple amegbetɔwo ŋu . ”

text: Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation , and offerings .
text2: Paulo yi eƒe nuƒoa dzi be , “ Menɔ gbedzi ƒe geɖe eye metrɔ va Yerusalem , hetsɔ ga ɖe asi be mava kpe ɖe Yudatɔwo ŋu eye masa vɔ na Mawu ha ̃ .

text: Whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple , neither with multitude , nor with tumult .
text2: Nye futɔ siawo va ke ɖe ŋunye le gbedoxɔa me , melu ̃ ta pɛpɛpɛ abe ale si wo ̀ le seawo nu ene , eye menɔ nye nunana ƒe vɔsa wɔm . Ʋunyaʋunya aɖeke menɔ afi ma kura o .

text: Who ought to have been here before thee , and object , if they had ought against me .
text2: Ke dzɔgbevɔ ̃ etɔe la , Yudatɔ aɖewo , ame siwo tso Terki , ame siwo wo ̀ le be woanɔ afi sia hafi ha ̃ nɔ afi ma ɣemaɣi .

text: Or else let these same here say , if they have found any evil doing in me , while I stood before the council ,
text2: Bia ame siawo le afi sia fifia ŋutɔ se be esi wokplɔm yi Yudatɔwo ƒe takpekpe ga ̃ la me ɖe vodada kae wokpɔ le ŋunye maha ̃ . Nu si megblɔ si ɖewohi ̃

text: Except it be for this one voice , that I cried standing among them , Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question by you this day .
text2: medze be magblɔ hafi o koe enye be ‘ Nu si ta wokplɔm va mia dome le takpekpe ga ̃ sia mee nye be mexɔe se be ame siwo kata ̃ ku la agafɔ ɖe tsitre tso ku me ! ”

text: And when Felix heard these things , having more perfect knowledge of that way , he deferred them , and said , When Lysias the chief captain shall come down , I will know the uttermost of your matter .
text2: Felike nyae nyuie be kristotɔwo mewɔa ʋunyaʋunya o . Le esia ta egblɔ na Yudatɔwo be woalala va se ɖe esime asrafowo ƒe amega ̃ , Lisia , nava hafi yeatso nya la me . "

text: And he commanded a centurion to keep Paul , and to let him have liberty , and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him .
text2: Ede se be woakplɔ Paulo ayi gaxɔa me gake woakpɔ edzi nyuie . Woaɖe mɔ faa be exɔlɔ ̃ wo nava kpɔe ɖa eye woate ŋu atsɔ nunanawo vɛ nɛ faa , be eƒe dzi nadze eme .

text: And after certain days , when Felix came with his wife Drusilla , which was a Jewess , he sent for Paul , and heard him concerning the faith in Christ .
text2: Le ŋkeke ʋee aɖewo megbe la , Felike kple srɔ ̃ a , Drusila , ame si nye Yudatɔ la va eye woɖo ame ɖe Paulo be wo ̀ ava . Esi Paulo va la eƒo nu na wo le Yesu Kristo dzixɔse ƒe nyawo ŋu . Nyawo de tome na Felike srɔ ̃ a nyuie .

text: And as he reasoned of righteousness , temperance , and judgment to come Felix trembled , and answered , Go thy way for this time ; when I have a convenient season , I will call for thee .
text2: Ke esi wo ̀ ɖe nya me na wo le dzɔdzɔenyenye , ɖokuidziɖuɖu kple ʋɔnudɔdrɔ ̃ si li gbɔna ŋu la vɔvɔ ̃ ɖo Felike eye wo ̀ gblɔ na Paulo be neyi gbɔ , ne yegakpɔ ɣeyiɣi nyui aɖe la yeagaɖo ame ɖee . "

text: He hoped also that money should have been given him of Paul , that he might loose him : wherefore he sent for him the oftener , and communed with him .
text2: Felike nɔ mɔ kpɔm be Paulo ana za ̃ nu ye eya ta eyɔe zi geɖe henɔ nya me dzrom kplii .

text: But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix ' room : and Felix , willing to shew the Jews a pleasure , left Paul bound .
text2: Wonɔ esia dzi alea ʋuu ƒe eve sɔŋ . Ke mlɔeba la woɖe Felike le afi ma hetsɔ Porkio Festo ɖo eteƒe . Le esi Felike di be Yudatɔwo nakpɔ ŋudzedze le ye ŋu ta la , egble ̃ Paulo ɖe gaxɔ me hafi dzo .

text: Now when Festus was come into the province , after three days he ascended from Caesarea to Jerusalem .
text2: Esi Festo dze eƒe dɔ gɔme le Kaesarea ƒe ŋkeke etɔ ̃ agbe tututu la , eɖi tsa yi Yerusalem .

text: Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against Paul , and besought him ,
text2: Osɔfoga ̃ wo kple Yudatɔwo ƒe dumega ̃ wo wɔ mɔnukpɔkpɔ sia ŋutidɔ heka Paulo ƒe nya la ta nɛ .

text: And desired favour against him , that he would send for him to Jerusalem , laying wait in the way to kill him .
text2: Wodze agbagba ble enu be wo ̀ aɖo Paulo ɖe Yerusalem enumake kple susu be yewoabe ɖe mɔa dzi awui .

text: But Festus answered , that Paul should be kept at Caesarea , and that he himself would depart shortly thither .
text2: Festo ɖo eŋu be , “ Esi Paulo le gaxɔme le Kaesarea eye nye ha ̃ mele afi ma yi ge kpuie la ,

text: Let them therefore , said he , which among you are able , go down with me , and accuse this man , if there be any wickedness in him .
text2: mina miaƒe kplɔla aɖewo nadze yonyeme aɖatsɔ nya ɖe ŋutsua ŋu le afi ma nenye eda vo aɖe . ”

text: And when he had tarried among them more than ten days , he went down unto Caesarea ; and the next day sitting on the judgment seat commanded Paul to be brought .
text2: Le ŋkeke enyi alo ewo megbe la , Festo trɔ yi Kaesarea eye le ŋkeke evea gbe tututu la , eyɔ Paulo ƒe nya la le ʋɔnu .

text: And when he was come , the Jews which came down from Jerusalem stood round about , and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul , which they could not prove .
text2: Esi Paulo va ɖo ʋɔnua ko la , Yudatɔ siwo tso Yerusalem va la , do ɣli gblɔ aʋatsonya geɖewo ɖe eŋu togbɔ be ɖasefo aɖeke menɔ wo si o ha ̃ .

text: While he answered for himself , Neither against the law of the Jews , neither against the temple , nor yet against Caesar , have I offended any thing at all .
text2: Ke Paulo ɖo eŋu na wo be , “ Nyemedze agɔ le ame aɖeke dzi o . Nyemeda Yudatɔwo ƒe se aɖeke dzi o eye nyemedo vlo gbedoxɔ la ha ̃ o . Gawu la nyemetsi tsitre ɖe Roma dziɖuɖua ŋu ɣeaɖekeɣi o . ”

text: But Festus , willing to do the Jews a pleasure , answered Paul , and said , Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem , and there be judged of these things before me ?
text2: Ke Festo di vevie be yeadze Yudatɔwo ŋu eya ta ebia Paulo be , “ E ̀ lɔ ̃ be yeayi Yerusalem be madrɔ ̃ ʋɔnu ye le afi maa ? ”

text: Then said Paul , I stand at Caesar ' s judgment seat , where I ought to be judged : to the Jews have I done no wrong , as thou very well knowest .
text2: Paulo ɖo eŋu nɛ be , “ Gbeɖe ! Nyemele Yerusalem yi ge o . Ke boŋ medi be mayi Roma Fiaga ̃ la boŋ gbɔ be wo ̀ adrɔ ̃ ʋɔnum le sea nu . Wo ̀ ŋutɔ e ̀ nya nyuie be nyemedze agɔ o .

text: For if I be an offender , or have committed any thing worthy of death , I refuse not to die : but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me , no man may deliver me unto them . I appeal unto Caesar .
text2: Ne mewɔ nane si dze na ku la nyemele ku vɔ ̃ m o . Ke ne vodada aɖeke mele ŋunye o la , medze be wo ̀ alo ame bubu aɖeke natsɔm de asi na ame siawo be woawum o . Metsɔ nye nya de asi na fia Kaisaro ŋutɔ ! ”

text: Then Festus , when he had conferred with the council , answered , Hast thou appealed unto Caesar ? unto Caesar shalt thou go .
text2: Nya sia na be Festo trɔ ɖe eŋumewo ŋu eye wodo da ̃ li vie . Emegbe la , etrɔ ɖe Paulo gbɔ , gblɔ nɛ bena , “ Enyo ; Paulo , esi ne ̀ tsɔ wo ̀ nya de asi na Kaisaro ta la , mi ́ aɖo wo ɖe Kaisaro gbɔ . ”

text: And after certain days king Agrippa and Bernice came unto Caesarea to salute Festus .
text2: Le ŋkeke ʋe aɖewo megbe la fia Agripa kple nɔvianyɔnu , Benis , ɖi tsa va Festo gbɔ be yewoava kpɔe ɖa .

text: And when they had been there many days , Festus declared Paul ' s cause unto the king , saying , There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix :
text2: Le woƒe afi ma nɔnɔ me la , Festo gblɔ Paulo ƒe nya na Agripa be , “ Felike gble ̃ ame aɖe ɖe gaxɔ me le afii hafi meva xɔ eteƒe .

text: About whom , when I was at Jerusalem , the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me , desiring to have judgment against him .
text2: Eye esi meɖi tsa de Yerusalem la , Osɔfoga ̃ wo kple Yudatɔwo ƒe tatɔwo va gbɔnye hewɔ nutsotso geɖe ɖe ame sia ŋu eye wobia tso asinye be matso kufia nɛ .

text: To whom I answered , It is not the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die , before that he which is accused have the accusers face to face , and have licence to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him .
text2: Ke , abe ale si wo ̀ ŋutɔ ne ̀ nyae ene la , megblɔ na wo be , mi ́ aƒe Roma se la meɖe mɔ be woabu fɔ ame ʋɔnumadrɔmadrɔ ̃ e o . Ke boŋ ele be woana mɔe be wo ̀ aɖe eɖokui nu le ame siwo tsɔ nya ɖe eŋu la ŋkume . ”

text: Therefore , when they were come hither , without any delay on the morrow I sat on the judgment seat , and commanded the man to be brought forth .
text2: Esi Yudatɔwo tso Yerusalem va afii la , meyɔ ʋɔnua eye mena wokplɔ Paulo va ʋɔnuae .

text: Against whom when the accusers stood up , they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed :
text2: Esi enutsolawo tsi tre be woaƒo nu la wometsɔ nya sese ̃ aɖeke ɖe eŋu , abe ale si mebui ene o .

text: But had certain questions against him of their own superstition , and of one Jesus , which was dead , whom Paul affirmed to be alive .
text2: Ke boŋ nyaʋiʋli aɖewo tso woƒe subɔsubɔ kple ame aɖe si woyɔna be Yesu , ame si ku gake Paulo ya gale gbɔgblɔm be ele agbe kokoko la ŋu .

text: And because I doubted of such manner of questions , I asked him whether he would go to Jerusalem , and there be judged of these matters .
text2: Esi mese woƒe nyawo la , metɔtɔ ŋutɔ , elabena nyemenya ale si madrɔ ̃ nya sia ƒomevi o . Mebia Paulo be alɔ ̃ be woadrɔ ̃ nya sia le Yerusalem ha ̃ ?

text: But when Paul had appealed to be reserved unto the hearing of Augustus , I commanded him to be kept till I might send him to Caesar .
text2: Gake Paulo gbe gblɔ be yedi be Kaisaro ga ̃ la ŋutɔ nadrɔ ̃ ʋɔnu ye . Le esia ta megana be woagbugbɔe ayi gaxɔ me va se ɖe esime mate ŋu aɖoe ɖe Kaisaro gbɔ . ”

text: Then Agrippa said unto Festus , I would also hear the man myself . To morrow , said he , thou shalt hear him .
text2: Agripa gblɔ na Festo be , “ Nye ŋutɔ medi be mabia gbe Paulo ase eƒe numegbe . ” Festo do ŋugbe nɛ be , “ Etsɔ a ̃ se eƒe numegbe . ”

text: And on the morrow , when Agrippa was come , and Bernice , with great pomp , and was entered into the place of hearing , with the chief captains , and principal men of the city , at Festus ' commandment Paul was brought forth .
text2: Le ŋkeke evea gbe tututu la , Agripa kple Benis va do ɖe ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ ƒea le bubu kple atsyɔ ̃ ɖoɖo ga ̃ me . Asrafowo kple dumega ̃ wo ha ̃ nɔ wo ŋu . Esi woɖi anyi vɔ la , Festo na wokplɔ Paulo va wo ŋkumee .

text: And Festus said , King Agrippa , and all men which are here present with us , ye see this man , about whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me , both at Jerusalem , and also here , crying that he ought not to live any longer .
text2: Festo ƒo nu na ƒuƒoƒea be , “ Fiaga ̃ Agripa kple ame siwo kata ̃ ƒo ƒu ɖe afii , ame si le mia dome lae nye ame si Yudatɔ siwo le du sia me kple Yerusalem siaa , di be woatso kufia na .

text: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death , and that he himself hath appealed to Augustus , I have determined to send him .
text2: Ke le nye nukpɔkpɔ nu la , mewɔ naneke si dze na ku o . Ke esi eya ŋutɔ bia be Kaisaro ŋutɔ nadrɔ ̃ ʋɔnu ye ta la , wɔna aɖeke megale ŋunye wu be maɖoe ɖe Kaisaro gbɔ le Roma o .

text: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord . Wherefore I have brought him forth before you , and specially before thee , O king Agrippa , that , after examination had , I might have somewhat to write .
text2: Gake ha ̃ la , nyemenya nya ka tututu maŋlɔ ɖo ɖe Fiaga ̃ la abe nutsotso le eŋu ene o , elabena wometsɔ nya gobi aɖeke ɖe eŋu o . Eya ta mekplɔe vɛ na mi kata ̃ , vevitɔ wo ̀ fia Agripa be na ̃ bia gbee eye to esia me makpɔ nane aŋlɔ tso eŋu .

text: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner , and not withal to signify the crimes laid against him .
text2: Elabena susu mele eme be woaɖo gamenɔla aɖe ɖe Kaisaro be wo ̀ adrɔ ̃ ʋɔnui le esime wometɔ asi nutsotso aɖeke dzi tso eŋu o . ”

text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul , Thou art permitted to speak for thyself . Then Paul stretched forth the hand , and answered for himself :
text2: Fia Agripa gblɔ na Paulo be , “ Meɖe mɔ na wo ̀ be na ̃ ɖe ɖokuiwo ̀ nu mase . ” Ale Paulo gaɖe eɖokui nu gblɔ be ,

text: I think myself happy , king Agrippa , because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews :
text2: “ Fiaga ̃ Agripa , enye dzidzɔ kple bubu ga ̃ aɖe nam be mekpɔ mɔnu sia be maƒo nu le nye agbenɔnɔ ŋu na wo ̀ ,

text: Especially because I know thee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews : wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently .
text2: elabena e ̀ nya nu tso Yudatɔwo ƒe sewo kple kɔnuwo ŋu tsitotsito . Azɔ meɖe kuku na wo ̀ be , na ̃ gbɔ dzi ɖi aɖo tom .

text: My manner of life from my youth , which was at the first among mine own nation at Jerusalem , know all the Jews ;
text2: Ele nyanya me na Yudatɔwo kata ̃ be , wohem tso ɖevime abe Yudatɔ akuakua ene , le nye dedu Tarso kple Yerusalem , eye menɔ agbe ɖe sewo kple kɔnuwo nu pɛpɛpɛ ƒe geɖewo .

text: Which knew me from the beginning , if they would testify , that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee .
text2: Ne woato nyateƒe la , Yudatɔwo alɔ ̃ ɖe edzi be menɔ agbe abe Farisitɔ adodoe ene eye mewɔ ɖe Yudatɔwo ƒe sewo kple kɔnuwo dzi pɛpɛpɛ ɣesiaɣi .

text: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers :
text2: Ke nu bubu sa ̃ tae wotsɔ nya ɖe ŋunye fifia , eyae nye be mele mɔ kpɔm be Mawu awɔ eƒe ŋugbe si wo ̀ do na mi ́ a tɔgbuitɔgbuiwo la dzi .

text: Unto which promise our twelve tribes , instantly serving God day and night , hope to come . For which hope ' s sake , king Agrippa , I am accused of the Jews .
text2: Nu sia ke ko Israelviwo ƒe to wuieveawo kata ̃ ha ̃ le mɔ kpɔm na , hele kutri kum le subɔsubɔ wɔm za ̃ kple keli gbe sia gbe ɖe eta . Gake fiaga ̃ , le nye ya gome la , wobe enye nu vɔ ̃ mewɔ .

text: Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you , that God should raise the dead ?
text2: Ke medi be mabia be , nu vɔ ̃ wo ̀ nye be ame naxɔe se be ame siwo ku la agatsi tre ha ̃ ? Ewɔ nuku na wo ̀ be Mawu agafɔ ame kukuwo ɖe agbea ?

text: I verily thought with myself , that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: Tsa ̃ la , mexɔe se be enye nye dɔdeasi be mawɔ funyafunya tsyowo ƒomevi ame siwo nye Yesu Nazaretitɔ la yomenɔlawo .

text: Which thing I also did in Jerusalem : and many of the saints did I shut up in prison , having received authority from the chief priests ; and when they were put to death , I gave my voice against them .
text2: Le esia ta la mexɔ ŋuse ̃ tso Osɔfoga ̃ gbɔ eye mele ́ xɔsetɔ geɖewo de gaxɔ me le Yerusalem . Gawu la , ne wotso kufia na wo dometɔ aɖe la , medaa asi ɖe nuwɔna sia dzi blibo .

text: And I punished them oft in every synagogue , and compelled them to blaspheme ; and being exceedingly mad against them , I persecuted them even unto strange cities .
text2: Mewɔ funyafunya ƒomevi geɖewo kristotɔ siawo kple susu be woaƒo fi ade Yesu ƒe ŋkɔ . Mele ́ fu ame siawo ale gbegbe be , metia wo yome yia du siwo le anyigba bubuwo dzi gɔ ̃ ha ̃ me .

text: Whereupon as I went to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests ,
text2: Be male ́ wo ta la , megaxɔ ŋuse ̃ nagbale ̃ le tatɔwo gbɔ eye medze mɔ yina Damasko .

text: At midday , O king , I saw in the way a light from heaven , above the brightness of the sun , shining round about me and them which journeyed with me .
text2: Esi mi ́ enɔ mɔa dzi yina anɔ abe ŋdɔ ga wuieve me lɔƒo ene la , kekle ̃ ga ̃ aɖe kle ̃ ɖe mi ́ kple ŋunyemewo dzi

text: And when we were all fallen to the earth , I heard a voice speaking unto me , and saying in the Hebrew tongue , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ? it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks .
text2: Mi ́ kata ̃ mi ́ edze anyi . Enumake mese ame aɖe wo ̀ nɔ nu ƒom nam le Hebrigbe me be , ‘ Saulo , Saulo , nu ka ta ne ̀ le yonyeme tim ? Wo ̀ ŋutɔ ɖokuiwo ̀ , ko ne ̀ le nuvevi wɔmii . ’

text: And I said , Who art thou , Lord ? And he said , I am Jesus whom thou persecutest .
text2: Mebia be , ‘ Meɖe kuku , wo ̀ ame kae le nu ƒom ? ’ Aƒetɔ la ɖo eŋu be , ‘ Nyee nye Yesu , ame si yome tim ne ̀ le .

text: But rise , and stand upon thy feet : for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose , to make thee a minister and a witness both of these things which thou hast seen , and of those things in the which I will appear unto thee ;
text2: Tsi tre , elabena metia wo ̀ be na ̃ nye nye subɔla kple nye ɖaseɖila . Yi na ̃ ɖe gbeƒa ̃ wo ̀ nuteƒekpɔkpɔ sia kple bubu siwo gbɔna la fia xexea me kata ̃ .

text: Delivering thee from the people , and from the Gentiles , unto whom now I send thee ,
text2: Makpɔ tawo ̀ eye maɖe wo ̀ tso wo ̀ ŋutɔ wo ̀ amewo kple Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo ha ̃ sime . Le nyateƒe me la , maɖo wo ̀ ɖe Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo dome be na ̃ gblɔ nyanyui la na wo , be woƒe ŋkuwo naʋu eye woatrɔ le Abosam ƒe viviti la gbɔ ava .

text: To open their eyes , and to turn them from darkness to light , and from the power of Satan unto God , that they may receive forgiveness of sins , and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me .
text2: Mawu ƒe Kekeli la me , bena woatsɔ woƒe nu vɔ ̃ wo ake wo eye woaxɔ Mawu ƒe domenyinu si li na ame siwo kata ̃ ŋuti kɔ eye wodza le xɔse me . ’

text: Whereupon , O king Agrippa , I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision :
text2: Eya ta , Fia Agripa , nye ha ̃ mewɔ ɖe ŋutega si tso dziƒo la ƒe ɖoɖo dzi .

text: But shewed first unto them of Damascus , and at Jerusalem , and throughout all the coasts of Judaea , and then to the Gentiles , that they should repent and turn to God , and do works meet for repentance .
text2: Gba ̃ la , megblɔ nyanyui la na ame siwo le Damasko eye tso afi ma la meva Yerusalem kple Yuda nutowo me . Emegbe la , meyi Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo dome eye megblɔ na wo be woadzudzɔ nu vɔ ̃ wɔwɔ , atrɔ ɖe Mawu ŋu eye woana woƒe nu nyui wɔwɔ nafia be wotrɔ zu ame yeyewo vava ̃ .

text: For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple , and went about to kill me .
text2: Esia tae Yudatɔwo va le ́ m le gbedoxɔ la me be yewoawum gɔ ̃ ha ̃ hafi .

text: Having therefore obtained help of God , I continue unto this day , witnessing both to small and great , saying none other things than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come :
text2: Ke Mawu ve nunye ale megale agbe egbe be magblɔ nya sia na ame sia ame ƒomevi , ame gblɔewo kple bubumewo siaa .

text: That Christ should suffer , and that he should be the first that should rise from the dead , and should shew light unto the people , and to the Gentiles .
text2: Nya si megblɔna la koe nye esi nyagblɔɖilawo kple Mose gblɔ be , ‘ Woawɔ funyafunya Mesia la , eyae anye ame gba ̃ tɔ si afɔ tso ame kukuwo dome eye wo ̀ ahe Kekeli vɛ na Yudatɔwo kple Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo siaa . ’ ”

text: And as he thus spake for himself , Festus said with a loud voice , Paul , thou art beside thyself ; much learning doth make thee mad .
text2: Esi Festo se nya sia ko la , edo ɣli ɖe Paulo ta sesi ̃ e be , “ Paulo , wo ̀ tagbɔ le gbegble ̃ m ; wo ̀ agbale ̃ sɔsrɔ ̃ fu ̃ u na wo ̀ tagbɔ flu . ”

text: But he said , I am not mad , most noble Festus ; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness .
text2: Paulo ɖo eŋu be , “ Bubume Festo , nye tagbɔ meflu o , ke boŋ nya siwo megblɔ la nye nyateƒe matrɔmatrɔ sɔŋ ko .

text: For the king knoweth of these things , before whom also I speak freely : for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him ; for this thing was not done in a corner .
text2: Fia Agripa ŋutɔ ha ̃ nya nu le nu siawo ŋu . Meka ɖe edzi be Fia Agripa se nya siawo kata ̃ kpɔ elabena wonye nu siwo dzɔ le gagla ̃ gbe eye womele ɣaɣla ɖe ame aɖeke o .

text: King Agrippa , believest thou the prophets ? I know that thou believest .
text2: Fia Agripa , me ̀ nya be e ̀ xɔ nyagblɔɖilawo ƒe nyawo dzi se ; alo mele eme nenema oa ? ”

text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul , Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian .
text2: Agripa xɔ nya la le Paulo nu gblɔ be , “ Đe ne ̀ bu be nya sue si ne ̀ gblɔ le afii lae ana be mazu kristotɔ zi ɖekaa ? ”

text: And Paul said , I would to God , that not only thou , but also all that hear me this day , were both almost , and altogether such as I am , except these bonds .
text2: Paulo ɖo eŋu be , “ Anye nye didi vevie be , togbɔ be nye nyawo meɖi naneke o ha ̃ la , wo ̀ kple ame sia ame si le afii la miatrɔ zu kristotɔwo abe ale si menyee ene ke menye to fukpekpe me abe ale si mele ekpem la ene o . ”

text: And when he had thus spoken , the king rose up , and the governor , and Bernice , and they that sat with them :
text2: Le nya siawo megbe la , Fia Agripa kple gɔvina ga ̃ Festo kpakple Benis kple wo ŋumewo kata ̃ tso hedzo .

text: And when they were gone aside , they talked between themselves , saying , This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds .
text2: Emegbe esi wonɔ nya la me dzrom kpɔ le wo ɖokuiwo me la , wokpɔe dze sii be , le nyateƒe me la , Paulo mewɔ naneke si dze na ku alo gamenɔnɔ gɔ ̃ ha ̃ o .

text: Then said Agrippa unto Festus , This man might have been set at liberty , if he had not appealed unto Caesar .
text2: Ale Agripa gblɔ na Festo be , “ Ne menye ɖe Paulo tsɔ eƒe nya la de Kaisaro si o la anye ne ele be woaɖe asi le eŋu hafi . ”

text: And when it was determined that we should sail into Italy , they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners unto one named Julius , a centurion of Augustus ' band .
text2: Mlɔeba la wowɔ dzadzraɖo vɔ be mi ́ adze mɔ ayi Roma kple meli . Wotsɔ Paulo kple gamenɔla bubu aɖewo de asi na Yulio , si nye Kaisaro ƒe asrafowo ƒe amega ̃ ɖeka be wo ̀ akplɔ wo ayii dedie .

text: And entering into a ship of Adramyttium , we launched , meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia ; one Aristarchus , a Macedonian of Thessalonica , being with us .
text2: Mi ́ eɖo meli aɖe si tso Adramitio eye wo ̀ yina tɔtɔ ge ɖe Terki du geɖewo me la hedze mɔ . Helatɔ aɖe tso Tesalonika si woyɔna be Aristarko la ha ̃ nɔ ʋua me kpli mi ́ .

text: And the next day we touched at Sidon . And Julius courteously entreated Paul , and gave him liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself .
text2: Le ŋkeke evea gbe la , mi ́ eva ɖo Sidɔn . Asrafoawo ƒe amega ̃ , Yulio , nyo dɔme na Paulo ale be wo ̀ ɖe mɔ nɛ wo ̀ ɖi tsa de dua me ɖakpɔ xɔlɔ ̃ awo ɖa eye wodi eƒe nu hiahia ̃ aɖewo nɛ .

text: And when we had launched from thence , we sailed under Cyprus , because the winds were contrary .
text2: Esi mi ́ egadze mɔ tso afi ma tete ko la , ya sese ̃ aɖe ƒo va kpe mi ́ eye esia wɔe be mi ́ ete ŋu zɔ mɔ to afi si wo ̀ le be mi ́ ato o ke boŋ mi ́ eto Kipro ƒukpo la ƒe dzigbe gome . Esia gɔmee nye be mi ́ eto ƒukpo la kple anyigba la ŋutɔ dome ale be yaa megaɖe fu na mi ́ o .

text: And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia , we came to Myra , a city of Lycia .
text2: Mi ́ eto Kilikia kple Pamfilia ŋu eye mi ́ eva ɖi go ɖe Mira le Likia nutome .

text: And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy ; and he put us therein .
text2: Le afi sia la mi ́ aƒe kplɔla la kpɔ Egipte tɔdziʋu aɖe si tso Aleksandria yina Italia eye mi ́ eɖoe .

text: And when we had sailed slowly many days , and scarce were come over against Cnidus , the wind not suffering us , we sailed under Crete , over against Salmone ;
text2: Mi ́ enɔ tsia dzi eye mi ́ ekpe fu ŋkeke geɖewo hafi va ɖo Knido gbɔ lɔƒo . Ya nɔ ƒoƒom sesi ̃ e ale gbegbe be ɖe ko mi ́ egbɔ eme tso Salmon ʋudzeƒea ŋu heyi Kreta .

text: And , hardly passing it , came unto a place which is called The fair havens ; nigh whereunto was the city of Lasea .
text2: Mi ́ enɔ ahom ga ̃ sia me wo ̀ nɔ fu ɖem na mi ́ alea heto anyigbeƒuta ɖɔɖɔɖɔ va ɖo teƒe aɖe si woyɔna be Ʋudzeƒe Nyui la . Teƒe sia te ɖe Lasea dua ŋu .

text: Now when much time was spent , and when sailing was now dangerous , because the fast was now already past , Paul admonished them ,
text2: Mi ́ enɔ afi sia ŋkeke geɖewo . Le ɣeyiɣi siawo me la , ƒudzimɔzɔzɔ yi didiƒewo menɔ bɔbɔe o elabena ƒea wu enu vɔ eye ɣeyiɣi sia mee ahom sese ̃ wo tuna le ƒu dzi . Paulo kpɔe dze sii alea ale wo ̀ yɔ tɔdziʋua kulawo hegblɔ na wo be ,

text: And said unto them , Sirs , I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage , not only of the lading and ship , but also of our lives .
text2: “ Amega ̃ wo , edze nam abe ne mi ́ eyi mi ́ aƒe mɔzɔzɔ sia dzi fifia la , nya aɖe ava dzɔ ɖe mi ́ a dzi ene . Đewohi ̃ ʋua anyrɔ eye mi ́ aƒe agbawo abu , amewo axɔ abi eye ame aɖewo aku gɔ ̃ ha ̃ . ”

text: Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship , more than those things which were spoken by Paul .
text2: Ke asrafowo , ame siwo ƒe kpɔkplɔ te gamenɔlawo nɔ la , meɖo to Paulo o ke boŋ wose tɔdziʋua kulawo ƒe amega ̃ ƒe aɖaŋu boŋ .

text: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in , the more part advised to depart thence also , if by any means they might attain to Phenice , and there to winter ; which is an haven of Crete , and lieth toward the south west and north west .
text2: Eye esi wonye be Ʋudzeƒe Nyui sia ha ̃ menyo tututu be woanɔ le vuvɔŋɔli me o ta la , tɔdziʋua me nɔla geɖewo lɔ ̃ ɖe edzi be yewoadze agbagba ayi ŋgɔ aɖo Foenike be yewoatsi afi ma le vuvɔŋɔli la me . Foenike ʋudzeƒe sia ka ɖe eme wu . Ʋudzeƒe Nyui la sa ̃ elabena etrɔ mo de dzigbeɣetodoƒe kple anyigbeɣetoɖoƒe .

text: And when the south wind blew softly , supposing that they had obtained their purpose , loosing thence , they sailed close by Crete .
text2: Le ɣemaɣi me tututu la , ya aɖe nɔ ƒoƒom tso anyigbe gome , eye wo ̀ dze abe enyo be mi ́ adze mɔ ene eya ta wodo abalawo eye mi ́ edze mɔ henɔ goŋu tom to Kreta ŋkume kekeake .

text: But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind , called Euroclydon .
text2: Se ̃ ko la yame trɔ zi ɖeka eye ahom sese ̃ aɖe si woyɔna be dzigbeɣetoɖoƒeya ƒo kpe mi ́ tso ƒukpo la dzi .

text: And when the ship was caught , and could not bear up into the wind , we let her drive .
text2: Ahom la lɔ ʋua ɖe nu ale be ʋua kulawo ɖe asi le eŋu nɛ eye wo ̀ kplɔ mi ́ dzoe .

text: And running under a certain island which is called Clauda , we had much work to come by the boat :
text2: Mlɔeba la , mieto ƒukpo sue aɖe si woyɔna be Kauda la godo eye to agbagbadzedze geɖe me la wohe tɔdziʋu sue si wotsi kae ɖe ʋu si mi ́ eɖo ŋu la

text: Which when they had taken up , they used helps , undergirding the ship ; and , fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands , strake sail , and so were driven .
text2: eye wobla tsɔdziʋu la sesi ̃ e be wo ̀ agaʋanya alo anɔ ʋuʋum o . Tɔdziʋua kulawo nɔ vɔvɔ ̃ m be mi ́ aƒe ʋua ava ɖo ba alo asi ke le Afrika ƒe ƒuta eya ta woɖiɖi abalawo ale ya kɔ mi ́ ɖe nu heyii .

text: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest , the next day they lightened the ship ;
text2: Le ŋufɔke esi ahom la nu ganɔ sese ̃ m ɖe edzi la ʋua kulawo fɔ agbawo ƒu gbe ɖe ƒua me .

text: And the third day we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship .
text2: Le ŋkeke etɔ ̃ a gbe la wofɔ dɔwɔnu siwo kata ̃ le ʋua me la ha ̃ ƒu gbe ɖe ƒua me .

text: And when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared , and no small tempest lay on us , all hope that we should be saved was then taken away .
text2: Ahom la nu gase ̃ ɖe edzi hena ŋkeke geɖewo eye mi ́ ete ŋu kpɔ ɣe alo ɣletiviwo le dziŋgɔli ̃ me gɔ ̃ ha ̃ o . Esia na be mi ́ ebu mɔkpɔkpɔ keŋkeŋ .

text: But after long abstinence Paul stood forth in the midst of them , and said , Sirs , ye should have hearkened unto me , and not have loosed from Crete , and to have gained this harm and loss .
text2: Anɔ abe ŋkeke nanewo nye esi ene ame aɖeke meɖu naneke o , ke mlɔeba la , Paulo yɔ ʋua me nɔlawo ƒo ƒu eye wo ̀ gblɔ na wo be , “ Ne wo ̀ nye ɖe miese nye gbe eye mi ́ etsi Ʋudzeƒe Nyui la , anye ne dzɔgbevɔ ̃ e sia mava mi ́ a dzi o .

text: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer : for there shall be no loss of any man ' s life among you , but of the ship .
text2: Ke mile ́ dzi ɖe ƒo elabena togbɔ be tɔdziʋua anyrɔ ha ̃ la , mi ́ a dometɔ aɖeke mele tsɔtsrɔ ̃ ge o .

text: For there stood by me this night the angel of God , whose I am , and whom I serve ,
text2: Elabena le za ̃ si va yi me la , nye Mawu si mesubɔna la ɖo eƒe dɔla ɖe gbɔnye wo ̀ va gblɔ nam be ,

text: Saying , Fear not , Paul ; thou must be brought before Caesar : and , lo , God hath given thee all them that sail with thee .
text2: ‘ Paulo , me ̀ gavɔ ̃ o , elabena a ̃ va ɖo Kaisaro gbɔ dedie be wo ̀ adrɔ ̃ ʋɔnu wo ̀ . Gawu la , Mawu se wo ̀ gbedodoɖa eya ta ame siwo kata ̃ le ʋua me kpli wo la atsi agbe . ’

text: Wherefore , sirs , be of good cheer : for I believe God , that it shall be even as it was told me .
text2: Eya ta , nɔvinyewo , mile ́ dzi ɖe ƒo , elabena mexɔ Mawu dzi se nyuie eye menyae be nu si wo ̀ gblɔ la ava eme tututu . ”

text: Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island .
text2: Ke ele na mi ́ be mi ́ adze go ɖe ƒukpo aɖe dzi .

text: But when the fourteenth night was come , as we were driven up and down in Adria , about midnight the shipmen deemed that they drew near to some country ;
text2: Tɔdziʋu la ƒe gbagba ̃ le mi ́ aƒe ƒudzinɔnɔ ƒe ŋkeke wuienelia ƒe za ̃ titina lɔƒo esi ahom la ganɔ mi ́ a nyamam le Adriaƒu me la , ʋua kulawo bu xaa be yewote ɖe anyigba aɖe ŋu .

text: And sounded , and found it twenty fathoms : and when they had gone a little further , they sounded again , and found it fifteen fathoms .
text2: Ale woda dzidzeka ɖe ƒua me , eye wokpɔ be tso ƒua dzi yi egɔme anɔ abe mita blaetɔ ̃ - vɔ - etɔ ̃ ko ene . Se ̃ la , wogadae eye azɔ la wokpɔ be anɔ afɔ blaasieke pɛ ko .

text: Then fearing lest we should have fallen upon rocks , they cast four anchors out of the stern , and wished for the day .
text2: Ʋua kulawo nyae be madidi hafi mi ́ ava ɖi go o , ke esi wonɔ vɔvɔ ̃ m be ɖewohi ̃ mi ́ ava ɖi go ɖe agakpewo dome ta la woda seke ene ɖe ʋua megbe henɔ agu ƒe dzedze lalam .

text: And as the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship , when they had let down the boat into the sea , under colour as though they would have cast anchors out of the foreship ,
text2: Ʋua kula aɖewo wɔ ɖoɖo be yewoasi le tɔdziʋua me ale woɖiɖi tɔdziʋu sue la ɖe tsia dzi abe seke da ge woyina ene .

text: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers , Except these abide in the ship , ye cannot be saved .
text2: Ke Paulo gblɔ na asrafoawo kple woƒe amega ̃ bena , “ Mi ́ a tɔwo , ne mia dometɔ aɖe dzo le tɔdziʋua me la , matsi agbe o . ”

text: Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat , and let her fall off .
text2: Ale asrafoawo la ̃ ka si wosa ɖe tɔdziʋu sue la ŋu be wo ̀ ge dze tsia dzi .

text: And while the day was coming on , Paul besought them all to take meat , saying , This day is the fourteenth day that ye have tarried and continued fasting , having taken nothing .
text2: Le fɔŋli me la , Paulo gblɔ na ameawo be , “ Mi ́ a tɔwo , kwasiɖa eve sɔŋ enye esi ame aɖeke meɖu naneke o .

text: Wherefore I pray you to take some meat : for this is for your health : for there shall not an hair fall from the head of any of you .
text2: Eya ta meɖe kuku na mi , miɖe dzi ɖi ne miaɖu nu elabena naneke mele dzɔdzɔ ge ɖe mi ́ a dometɔ aɖeke dzi o . ”

text: And when he had thus spoken , he took bread , and gave thanks to God in presence of them all : and when he had broken it , he began to eat .
text2: Azɔ Paulo ŋutɔ tsɔ abolo aɖe eye esi wo ̀ do gbe ɖa alo da akpe ɖe eta vɔ la , eka ɖe heɖu .

text: Then were they all of good cheer , and they also took some meat .
text2: Nu sia do ŋuse ̃ ʋua me nɔlawo kata ̃ ale be ame sia ame di nane de nu me azɔ .

text: And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls .
text2: Ʋua me nɔlawo kata ̃ ƒe xexle ̃ me anɔ ame alafa eve blaadre - vɔ - ade .

text: And when they had eaten enough , they lightened the ship , and cast out the wheat into the sea .
text2: Esi woɖu nu ɖi ƒo vɔ la , wolɔ bli kotoku mamlɛawo kata ̃ ƒu gbe ɖe ƒua me be ʋua nanɔ wodzoe ale be wo ̀ aganyrɔ o .

text: And when it was day , they knew not the land : but they discovered a certain creek with a shore , into the which they were minded , if it were possible , to thrust in the ship .
text2: Esi ŋu ke la , womekpɔ anyigba dze si o elabena afu do gake wokpɔ ƒuta ƒe afi aɖe ɖaa . Esia na be wonɔ tame bum be ɖe yewoate ŋu ato agakpeawo dome ava do ɖe go ŋu dedie ha ̃ .

text: And when they had taken up the anchors , they committed themselves unto the sea , and loosed the rudder bands , and hoised up the mainsail to the wind , and made toward shore .
text2: Mlɔeba la , woɖoe be yewoatee akpɔ , ale wola ̃ sekeawo hegble ̃ wo ɖe ƒua me , wotu kuɖɔkawo ha ̃ eye wodo abala heɖo ta gota .

text: And falling into a place where two seas met , they ran the ship aground ; and the forepart stuck fast , and remained unmoveable , but the hinder part was broken with the violence of the waves .
text2: Ke dzɔgbevɔ ̃ etɔe la , tɔdziʋua si ke . Eƒe ŋgɔgbe lɔƒo tsi teƒe ɖeka ale be ahom la ha ̃ nɔ eƒe megbe lɔƒo kakam .

text: And the soldiers ' counsel was to kill the prisoners , lest any of them should swim out , and escape .
text2: Esi wo ̀ dzɔ alea ko la , asrafoawo gblɔ na woƒe amega ̃ be wo ̀ aɖe mɔ na yewo yewoawu gamemɔlawo kata ̃ ale be wo dometɔ aɖeke nagadzo dze ƒua me aƒu tsi asi dzo le yewo gbɔ o .

text: But the centurion , willing to save Paul , kept them from their purpose ; and commanded that they which could swim should cast themselves first into the sea , and get to land :
text2: Ke le esi woƒe amega ̃ Yulio di be yeaɖe Paulo ƒe agbe ta la , melɔ ̃ ɖe woƒe susu si wodo ɖa la dzi o . Ke boŋ eɖe gbe be ame siwo nya tsiƒuƒu la nadze agbagba aƒu tsi ayi gota .

text: And the rest , some on boards , and some on broken pieces of the ship . And so it came to pass , that they escaped all safe to land .
text2: Ke ame mamlɛawo dometɔ aɖewo nanɔ ʋuƒowo dzi eye bubuwo ha ̃ nanɔ ʋua ƒe kakɛwo dzi ayi gota . Ale ame sia ame dze agbagba alea ɖo gota dedie .

text: And when they were escaped , then they knew that the island was called Melita .
text2: Emegbe la , mi ́ eva nya be ƒukpo si woyɔna be Mɔlta la dzie mi ́ eva do ɖo .

text: And the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness : for they kindled a fire , and received us every one , because of the present rain , and because of the cold .
text2: Ƒukpoa dzi tɔwo xɔ mi ́ nyuie ŋutɔ . Esi tsi nɔ dzadzam eye vuvɔ nɔ wɔwɔm ta la , wodo dzo ga ̃ aɖe na mi ́ be mi ́ aƒu .

text: And when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks , and laid them on the fire , there came a viper out of the heat , and fastened on his hand .
text2: Esi Paulo fɔ nake wuwului aɖewo be yeade dzoa me ko la , da vɔ ̃ ɖi aɖe do tso nake la me , le dzo xɔxɔa ta , eye wo ̀ bla ɖe Paulo ƒe alɔnu .

text: And when the barbarians saw the venomous beast hang on his hand , they said among themselves , No doubt this man is a murderer , whom , though he hath escaped the sea , yet vengeance suffereth not to live .
text2: Nu sia wɔ nuku eye wo ̀ do vɔvɔ ̃ na ame siwo nɔ afi ma ŋutɔ ale wogblɔ na wo nɔewo be , “ Ame sia la , hlɔ ̃ dola vɔ ̃ ɖi aɖee wo ̀ nye . Togbɔ be metsi ƒu me ku o ha ̃ la , Mawu ƒe hlɔ ̃ biabia melɔ ̃ be wo ̀ atsi agbe o . ”

text: And he shook off the beast into the fire , and felt no harm .
text2: Ke Paulo ʋuʋu da la le alɔnu ɖe dzobiabia me eye naneke mewɔe o .

text: Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen , or fallen down dead suddenly : but after they had looked a great while , and saw no harm come to him , they changed their minds , and said that he was a god .
text2: Ameawo nɔ mɔ kpɔm be Paulo ƒe abɔ ate eye wo ̀ adze anyi aku , ke esi wolala ʋuu nya aɖeke medzɔ ɖe edzi o la , wotrɔ woƒe susuwo hegblɔ be Paulo la Mawu aɖe koko wo ̀ anye .

text: In the same quarters were possessions of the chief man of the island , whose name was Publius ; who received us , and lodged us three days courteously .
text2: Ƒukpo sia ƒe gɔvina ŋkɔe nye Publio , ame sia ƒe anyigba kple aƒe te ɖe ƒuta , afi si mi ́ eva ɖi go ɖo . Publio xɔ mi ́ ɖe eya ŋutɔ ƒe aƒe me , hekpɔ mi ́ a dzi nyuie ŋkeke etɔ ̃ sɔŋ .

text: And it came to pass , that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and of a bloody flux : to whom Paul entered in , and prayed , and laid his hands on him , and healed him .
text2: Publio fofo ƒe la ̃ me menɔ kɔkɔm tututu o , elabena asra ̃ kple kpeta nɔ fu ɖem nɛ . Paulo yi egbɔ hedo gbe ɖa heda asi ɖe edzi ale be eƒe la ̃ me se ̃ .

text: So when this was done , others also , which had diseases in the island , came , and were healed :
text2: Enumake dɔle ́ la siwo kata ̃ nɔ teƒea la , va Paulo gbɔ eye wo ̀ da gbe le wo kata ̃ ŋu .

text: Who also honoured us with many honours ; and when we departed , they laded us with such things as were necessary .
text2: Dzi dzɔ ƒukpoa dzi tɔwo ŋutɔ ale wotsɔ nunana ƒomevi geɖewo vɛ na mi ́ , eye esi ɣeyiɣi de na mi ́ be mi ́ adzo la , wodo agba na mi ́ aƒe tɔdziʋu la nyuie ŋutɔ kple nu siwo kata ̃ ava hia ̃ mi ́ le mi ́ aƒe mɔzɔzɔa me .

text: And after three months we departed in a ship of Alexandria , which had wintered in the isle , whose sign was Castor and Pollux .
text2: Mi ́ enɔ Mɔlta ƒukpo dzi ɣleti etɔ ̃ hafi gadze mɔ . Mi ́ eɖo tɔdziʋu aɖe si woyɔna be “ Venɔviwo ” si tso Aleksandria eye wo ̀ va tsi ƒukpoa dzi le vuvɔŋɔli la .

text: And landing at Syracuse , we tarried there three days .
text2: Teƒe gba ̃ tɔ si mi ́ etɔ ɖo lae nye Sirakusa eye mi ́ enɔ afi ma ŋkeke etɔ ̃ .

text: And from thence we fetched a compass , and came to Rhegium : and after one day the south wind blew , and we came the next day to Puteoli :
text2: Tso Sirakusa la , mieƒo xla ̃ heyi Regio , eye tso afi ma la ya aɖe ƒo mi ́ tso anyigbe gome ale be le ŋkeke evea gbe la mi ́ eva ɖo Puteoli , afi si mi ́ edo go xɔsetɔ aɖewo le .

text: Where we found brethren , and were desired to tarry with them seven days : and so we went toward Rome .
text2: Xɔsetɔ siawo di tso mi ́ a si vevie be mi ́ anɔ yewo gbɔ vie ale mi ́ elɔ ̃ , nɔ wo gbɔ ŋkeke adre . Tso Puteoli la , mi ́ eɖo ta Roma .

text: And from thence , when the brethren heard of us , they came to meet us as far as Appiiforum , and The three taverns : whom when Paul saw , he thanked God , and took courage .
text2: Esi xɔsetɔ siwo le Roma la se be mi ́ egbɔna la wo dometɔ aɖewo va kpe mi ́ le keke teƒe si woyɔna be Apioforo eye wo ̀ didi tso Roma gbɔ abe kilometa blaenyi sɔŋ ene . Ame bubuwo ha ̃ va kpe mi ́ le afi si woyɔna be “ Amedzrodzeƒe etɔ ̃ awo . ” Teƒe sia ha ̃ didi tso Roma gbɔ abe kilometa bladre ene . Esi Paulo kpɔ xɔsetɔ siawo la , dzi dzɔe ŋutɔ ; dzi ɖo eƒo eye wo ̀ da akpe na Mawu . "

text: And when we came to Rome , the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard : but Paul was suffered to dwell by himself with a soldier that kept him .
text2: Esi mi ́ eva ɖo Roma la , asrafowo ƒe amega ̃ si ƒe kpɔkplɔ te Paulo nɔ la ɖe mɔ na Paulo be ate ŋu adze afi sia afi si eya ŋutɔ lɔ ̃ . Ke woɖe asrafo aɖe ɖe eŋu be wo ̀ adzɔ eŋu ɣesiaɣi .

text: And it came to pass , that after three days Paul called the chief of the Jews together : and when they were come together , he said unto them , Men and brethren , though I have committed nothing against the people , or customs of our fathers , yet was I delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans .
text2: Le ŋkeke etɔ ̃ agbe la , Paulo yɔ Yudatɔ siwo le Roma dua me la ƒo ƒu eye wo ̀ ƒo nu na wo gblɔ be , " “ Nɔvinyewo , edzɔ dzi nam be meva ɖo mia gbɔ le afii . Medi be mianya be togbɔ be nyemewɔ naneke o eye nyemeda le kɔnyinyi aɖeke dzi o ha ̃ la , Yudatɔ siwo le Yerusalem la le ́ m eye wotsɔm de asi na Roma dziɖuɖua ƒe ame dɔdɔ siwo le Yerusalem , be woadrɔ ̃ ʋɔnum .

text: Who , when they had examined me , would have let me go , because there was no cause of death in me .
text2: Esi mi ́ eyi ʋɔnua la , Roma dziɖuɖu ƒe ame dɔdɔwo mekpɔ vodada aɖeke le ŋunye o , eya ta wodi be yewoaɖe asi le ŋunye elabena wokpɔ be nyemedze na ku abe ale si Yudatɔwo ƒe amega ̃ wo dii ene o .

text: But when the Jews spake against it , I was constrained to appeal unto Caesar ; not that I had ought to accuse my nation of .
text2: Ke esi mekpɔ be Yudatɔwo mekpɔ dzidzɔ le ale si wodrɔ ̃ ʋɔnua ŋu o , eye wotsi tre ɖe nyametsotsoa ŋu vevie ta la , nye ha ̃ megblɔ na ʋɔnua be metsɔ nye nya de asi na Kaisaro le Roma be wo ̀ adrɔ ̃ ʋɔnum .

text: For this cause therefore have I called for you , to see you , and to speak with you : because that for the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain .
text2: Nu si ta meyɔ mi va afii egbeae nye be mi ́ adze si mi ́ a nɔewo eye be mana mianya nu si tututu ta wole ́ m de game ɖo . Esiae nye be mexɔ se tso nye dzi me ke be , Mesia si mi ́ a tɔgbuiwo nɔ mɔ kpɔm na la va mi ́ a dome . ”

text: And they said unto him , We neither received letters out of Judaea concerning thee , neither any of the brethren that came shewed or spake any harm of thee .
text2: Ameawo ɖo eŋu na Paulo be , “ Mi ́ awo la ame aɖeke megagblɔ wo ̀ nya aɖeke na mi ́ kpɔ loo alo ŋlɔ agbale ̃ ɖo ɖe mi ́ tso Yudea le ŋuwo ̀ kpɔ o . Nɔvi kristotɔ siwo tso Yerusalem va ha ̃ dometɔ aɖeke megblɔ nya aɖeke na mi ́ tso ŋuwo ̀ kpɔ o .

text: But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest : for as concerning this sect , we know that every where it is spoken against .
text2: Ke mi ́ adi be na ̃ ɖe wo ̀ xɔse la me na mi ́ nyuie elabena nu si mi ́ enya koe nye be , ame aɖeke media kristotɔwo ƒe nya le teƒe aɖeke o . ”

text: And when they had appointed him a day , there came many to him into his lodging ; to whom he expounded and testified the kingdom of God , persuading them concerning Jesus , both out of the law of Moses , and out of the prophets , from morning till evening .
text2: Ale woɖo ŋkeke bubu na takpekpe eye esi ŋkekea ɖo la , ame geɖewo va ƒo ƒu ɖe Paulo ƒeme . Paulo ɖe mawunya me na wo tsitotsito , le mawufiaɖuƒe la kple Yesu Kristo ŋu . Wonɔ takpekpea me tso ŋdi va se ɖe fie ̃ ke .

text: And some believed the things which were spoken , and some believed not .
text2: Paulo ƒe nyawo sɔ tome na ame aɖewo eye wotrɔ zu kristotɔwo ; ke mewɔ naneke kura le ame aɖewo ha ̃ ŋu o .

text: And when they agreed not among themselves , they departed , after that Paul had spoken one word , Well spake the Holy Ghost by Esaias the prophet unto our fathers ,
