text: For then would they not have ceased to be offered ? because that the worshippers once purged should have had no more conscience of sins .
text2: Ne ɖe vɔsa mawo te ŋu wɔ wo blibo la , ne womedzudzɔ vɔsasa oa ? Elabena , anye ne vɔsa la kɔ ame siwo sanɛ la ŋuti zi ɖeka hena ɣeyiɣiawo kata ̃ eye woƒe dzitsinyawo magabu fɔ wo le woƒe nu vɔ ̃ wo ta o .

text: But in those sacrifices there is a remembrance again made of sins every year .
text2: Ke vɔsa mawo ɖoa ŋku nu vɔ ̃ dzi na ameawo ƒe sia ƒe ,

text: For it is not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins .
text2: elabena mele bɔbɔe be nyitsuwo kple gbɔ ̃ wo ƒe ʋu naɖe nu vɔ ̃ ɖa o .

text: Wherefore when he cometh into the world , he saith , Sacrifice and offering thou wouldest not , but a body hast thou prepared me :
text2: Eya ta esi Kristo va xexeame la egblɔ bena . “ Me ̀ di vɔsa kple numemewo o , ke boŋ ŋutila ̃ si ne ̀ dzra ɖo ɖi nam ;

text: In burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou hast had no pleasure .
text2: eye numevɔsa kple nu vɔ ̃ vɔsawo ha ̃ medzea ŋuwo ̀ o .

text: Then said I , Lo , I come ( in the volume of the book it is written of me , ) to do thy will , O God .
text2: Tete megblɔ be , ‘ Nyee nye esi , woŋlɔ nu tso ŋutinye le lagbale ̃ gbale ̃ me be , O Mawu , meva be mawɔ wo ̀ lɔlɔ ̃ nu . ’ ”

text: Above when he said , Sacrifice and offering and burnt offerings and offering for sin thou wouldest not , neither hadst pleasure therein ; which are offered by the law ;
text2: Gba ̃ la egblɔ be , “ Vɔsawo , numemewo kple numevɔsawo kpakple nu vɔ ̃ vɔsawo la medi wo o eye womedzea ŋuwo ̀ ha ̃ o . ” Togbɔ be se la bia be woawɔ wo ha ̃ .

text: Then said he , Lo , I come to do thy will , O God . He taketh away the first , that he may establish the second .
text2: Tete wo ̀ gblɔ bena , “ Nyee nye esi , meva be mawɔ wo ̀ lɔlɔ ̃ nu . ” Ale wo ̀ ɖe se gba ̃ tɔ la ɖa be wo ̀ aɖo evelia anyi .

text: By the which will we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all .
text2: Eye to Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ ̃ nu wɔwɔ me wowɔ mi ́ kɔkɔe to Yesu Kristo ƒe ŋutila ̃ si wo ̀ tsɔ sa vɔe hena ɣeyiɣiwo kata ̃ la me .

text: And every priest standeth daily ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices , which can never take away sins :
text2: Osɔfo la wɔa eƒe vɔsasadɔwo gbe sia gbe eye nenema ke wo ̀ wɔ vɔsa mawo ke edziedzi , vɔsa siwo mate ŋu aɖe nu vɔ ̃ ɖa akpɔ gbeɖe o .

text: But this man , after he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever , sat down on the right hand of God ;
text2: Ke esi Osɔfo sia ya sa vɔ ɖe nu vɔ ̃ wo ta zi ɖeka hena ɣeyiɣiawo kata ̃ la eyi ɖanɔ Mawu ƒe nuɖusime .

text: From henceforth expecting till his enemies be made his footstool .
text2: Tso ɣemaɣi la ele lalam be woatsɔ eƒe futɔwo awɔ eƒe afɔɖodzinui .

text: For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified .
text2: Elabena to vɔsa ɖeka si wo ̀ wɔ me la ewɔ ame siwo ŋuti kɔm wo ̀ le la blibo tegbegbe le Mawu ƒe ŋkume .

text: Whereof the Holy Ghost also is a witness to us : for after that he had said before ,
text2: Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe ha ̃ ɖi ɖase tso esia ŋuti ; gba ̃ la egblɔ bena ,

text: This is the covenant that I will make with them after those days , saith the Lord , I will put my laws into their hearts , and in their minds will I write them ;
text2: “ Esia nye nu si mabla kpli wo le ɣeyiɣi ma megbe , Yehowae gblɔe . Matsɔ nye sewo ade woƒe dziwo me eye maŋlɔ wo ɖe woƒe susuwo me . ”

text: And their sins and iniquities will I remember no more .
text2: Egagblɔ kpe ɖe eŋu be , “ Nyemagaɖo ŋku woƒe nu vɔ ̃ wo kple nu vɔ ̃ ɖi wɔwɔwo dzi azɔ o . ”

text: Now where remission of these is , there is no more offering for sin .
text2: Eye afi si wotsɔ nu siawo ke le la vɔsasa ɖe nu vɔ ̃ ta megahi ̃ a o .

text: Having therefore , brethren , boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus ,
text2: Eya ta nɔvi lɔlɔ ̃ wo , esi me kakaɖedzi le mi ́ a si be mi ́ age ɖe Kɔkɔeƒe ƒe Kɔkɔeƒe la to Yesu ƒe ʋu me ŋuti la ,

text: By a new and living way , which he hath consecrated for us , through the veil , that is to say , his flesh ;
text2: eʋu mɔ yeye kple mɔ gbagbe na mi ́ to xɔmetsovɔ si nye eƒe ŋutila ̃ la me .

text: And having an high priest over the house of God ;
text2: Eye esi Osɔfoga ̃ le mi ́ a si le Mawu ƒe aƒe nu ta la ,

text: Let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith , having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience , and our bodies washed with pure water .
text2: mina mi ́ ate ɖe Mawu ŋu le dzi vava ̃ me kple xɔse ƒe kakaɖedzi blibo la me kple dzi siwo ŋu wohle ̃ ʋu ɖo be wo ̀ aklɔ mi ́ a ŋuti tso dzitsinya vɔ ̃ ɖiwo me , eye wo ̀ ale tsi na mi ́ aƒe ŋutila ̃ wo kple tsi zɔzrɔ ̃ e .

text: Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering ; ( for he is faithful that promised ; )
text2: Mina mi ́ ale ́ mɔkpɔkpɔ si me mi ́ eʋu la me ɖe asi maʋa ̃ maʋa ̃ e elabena ame si do ŋugbea la nye nuteƒewɔla .

text: And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works :
text2: Eye mina mi ́ abu ale si mi ́ ado ŋuse ̃ mi ́ a nɔewo la ŋuti be woayi dzi le lɔlɔ ̃ kple dɔ nyui wɔwɔ me .

text: Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together , as the manner of some is ; but exhorting one another : and so much the more , as ye see the day approaching .
text2: Migana mi ́ agbɔ dzɔ le mi ́ aƒe takpeƒewo dede me o , abe ale si ame aɖewo tsɔe ɖo dɔe nɔ kuvia wɔm ene o , ke boŋ mina mi ́ ade dzi ƒo na mi ́ a nɔewo vevietɔ esi mienyae be eƒe ŋkeke la te tu aƒe kpokploe .

text: For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth , there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins ,
text2: Ne mi ́ ebua le nu vɔ ̃ wɔwɔ dzi , esi mi ́ enya nyateƒe la vɔ megbe la , vɔsasa ɖe nu vɔ ̃ wo ta aɖeke megali o ,

text: But a certain fearful looking for of judgment and fiery indignation , which shall devour the adversaries .
text2: ke nu si ko mi ́ anɔ mɔ kpɔm na le ŋɔdzi ga ̃ aɖe me lae nye ʋɔnudɔdrɔ ̃ kple dzobibi si ava fia ̃ Mawu ƒe futɔwo .

text: He that despised Moses ' law died without mercy under two or three witnesses :
text2: Ame sia ame si ada le Mose ƒe se dzi la , woƒua kpee nublanuimakpɔmakpɔtɔe le ɖaseɖila eve alo etɔ ̃ ƒe nya nu .

text: Of how much sorer punishment , suppose ye , shall he be thought worthy , who hath trodden under foot the Son of God , and hath counted the blood of the covenant , wherewith he was sanctified , an unholy thing , and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace ?
text2: Tohehe ga ̃ kae miesusu be mehedze na ame si titi afɔ ɖe Mawu ƒe Vi la dzi oa ? Ame si do ŋunyɔ nubabla la ƒe ʋu si klɔ eŋuti la abe nu makɔmakɔ wo ̀ nye ene eye wodzu amenuveve ƒe Gbɔgbɔ la ?

text: For we know him that hath said , Vengeance belongeth unto me , I will recompense , saith the Lord . And again , The Lord shall judge his people .
text2: Elabena mi ́ enya ame si gblɔ be , “ Hlɔ ̃ biabia la tɔnyee , maɖo eteƒe nɛ , ” egagblɔ ha ̃ be , “ Aƒetɔ la adrɔ ̃ ʋɔnu eƒe dukɔ la . ”

text: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God .
text2: Enye ŋɔdzinu be ame aɖe nage ɖe Mawu gbagbe la ƒe asi me .

text: But call to remembrance the former days , in which , after ye were illuminated , ye endured a great fight of afflictions ;
text2: Miɖo ŋku ŋkeke siwo do ŋgɔ la dzi esi miexɔ kekeli la vɔ la mienɔ te sesi ̃ e to ʋiʋli geɖewo me mieto fukpekpe ha ̃ me kale ̃ tɔe .

text: Partly , whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions ; and partly , whilst ye became companions of them that were so used .
text2: Ɣeaɖewoɣi la wodzua mi le gagla ̃ gbe eye wotia mia yome , ɣebubuɣiwo la mienɔ te kpe ɖe ame siwo nɔ xaxa mawo ke me la ŋuti .

text: For ye had compassion of me in my bonds , and took joyfully the spoiling of your goods , knowing in yourselves that ye have in heaven a better and an enduring substance .
text2: Miefa konyi kple ame siwo wode gaxɔ me eye esi woxɔ miaƒe nunɔamesiwo le mia si akpasese ̃ tɔe la miexɔe kple dzidzɔ , elabena miawo ŋutɔ mienyae be nunɔamesi siwo nyo saa ̃ wu eye womenyunyɔna o la le mia si .

text: Cast not away therefore your confidence , which hath great recompence of reward .
text2: Eya ta dzi megaɖe le mia ƒo o elabena miaƒe dzideƒo ahe fetu geɖe vɛ na mi .

text: For ye have need of patience , that , after ye have done the will of God , ye might receive the promise .
text2: Ele be miado vevie ale be ne miewɔ Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ ̃ nu la miaxɔ nu si ƒe ŋugbe wo ̀ do .

text: For yet a little while , and he that shall come will come , and will not tarry .
text2: Elabena le ɣeyiɣi kpui aɖe megbe la , “ Ame si gbɔna la ava ɖo matsi megbe o .

text: Now the just shall live by faith : but if any man draw back , my soul shall have no pleasure in him .
text2: Ke nye dzɔdzɔetɔ la anɔ agbe to xɔse me . Ke ne ede megbe la nyemakpɔ dzidzɔ le eŋuti o . ”

text: But we are not of them who draw back unto perdition ; but of them that believe to the saving of the soul .
text2: Ke mi ́ awo ya mi ́ ele abe ame siwo de megbe eye wotsrɔ ̃ la ene o , ke boŋ mi ́ enye ame siwo xɔe se eye mi ́ ekpɔ ɖeɖe .

text: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for , the evidence of things not seen .
text2: Azɔ la xɔse nye kaka ɖe nu siwo mi ́ ekpɔ mɔ na la dzi kple dziɖoɖo ɖe nu siwo mi ́ ekpɔna o la ŋu .

text: For by it the elders obtained a good report .
text2: To xɔse mee ame siwo do ŋgɔ la kpɔ ɖaseɖiɖi nyui le Mawu gbɔ le .

text: Through faith we understand that the worlds were framed by the word of God , so that things which are seen were not made of things which do appear .
text2: To xɔse me mi ́ ese egɔme be Mawu ɖe gbe eye xexeame va dzɔ ale be wowɔ nu si wokpɔna la tso nu si wowekpɔna o la me .

text: By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain , by which he obtained witness that he was righteous , God testifying of his gifts : and by it he being dead yet speaketh .
text2: To xɔse me Abel tsɔ vɔsasa si nyo wu Kain tɔ la na Mawu . To xɔse me wokafui be enye ame dzɔdzɔe esi Mawu ƒo nu nyui tso eƒe vɔsa la ŋu . To xɔse me wo ̀ gale nu ƒom ko togbɔ be eku ha ̃ .

text: By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death ; and was not found , because God had translated him : for before his translation he had this testimony , that he pleased God .
text2: To xɔse me wokɔ Enɔk dzoe tso agbe sia me ale be meɖɔ ku kpɔ o , ale womegakpɔe o elabena Mawu kɔe dzoe . Elabena hafi wokɔe dzoe la wogblɔ tso eŋu be Mawu kpɔ ŋudzedze le eya amea ŋuti .

text: But without faith it is impossible to please him : for he that cometh to God must believe that he is , and that he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him .
text2: Xɔse manɔmee la ame aɖeke mate ŋu adze Mawu ŋu o , elabena ame si va Mawu gbɔ la ele be wo ̀ axɔe se be Mawu li eye wo ̀ ɖoa eteƒe na ame siwo dinɛ vevie .

text: By faith Noah , being warned of God of things not seen as yet , moved with fear , prepared an ark to the saving of his house ; by the which he condemned the world , and became heir of the righteousness which is by faith .
text2: To xɔse me esi woxlɔ ̃ nu Noa tso nu siwo mekpɔ dzɔ haɖe o ŋuti la etsɔ vɔvɔ ̃ kɔkɔe kpa aɖakaʋu be wo ̀ aɖe eya kple eƒe ƒomea . To eƒe xɔse me wo ̀ bu fɔ xexeame eye wo ̀ zu dzɔdzɔenyenye si vana to xɔse me la ƒe domenyila .

text: By faith Abraham , when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance , obeyed ; and he went out , not knowing whither he went .
text2: To xɔse me esi woyɔ Abraham be wo ̀ ayi teƒe si wo ̀ ava xɔ wo ̀ azu eƒe domenyinu la , eɖo to eye wo ̀ yi , togbɔ be menya afi si yim wo ̀ nɔ o ha ̃ .

text: By faith he sojourned in the land of promise , as in a strange country , dwelling in tabernacles with Isaac and Jacob , the heirs with him of the same promise :
text2: To xɔse me ewɔ nɔƒe ɖe ŋugbedodonyigba la dzi eye wo ̀ nɔ afi ma abe amedzro si le dzronyigba dzi la ene , elabena enɔ avɔgbadɔwo me . Nenema kee nye Isak kple Yakɔb ame siwo ha ̃ nye ŋugbedodo ma ke ƒe domenyilawo kplii .

text: For he looked for a city which hath foundations , whose builder and maker is God .
text2: Elabena Abraham nɔ mɔ kpɔm na du si Mawu ŋutɔ nye egɔmeɖola , aɖaŋuwɔla kple etula .

text: Through faith also Sara herself received strength to conceive seed , and was delivered of a child when she was past age , because she judged him faithful who had promised .
text2: To xɔse me esi Abraham tsi xɔ ƒe geɖe ha ̃ la , ete ŋu dzi vi . Nenema kee nye srɔ ̃ a , Sara , ha ̃ , ame si tsi ko tsa ̃ . To xɔse me Abraham zu fofo elabena Mawu ame si do ŋugbe nɛ la , bui nuteƒewɔlae .

text: Therefore sprang there even of one , and him as good as dead , so many as the stars of the sky in multitude , and as the sand which is by the sea shore innumerable .
text2: Ale to ame ɖeka sia dzi , ame si ŋu mi ́ ate ŋu agblɔ le be megale ŋutsu me o la , dzidzime geɖe siwo sɔ gbɔ abe ɣletiviwo le dziŋgɔli ̃ ŋu kple ƒutake ene la va dzɔ .

text: These all died in faith , not having received the promises , but having seen them afar off , and were persuaded of them , and embraced them , and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth .
text2: Ame siawo kata ̃ va ku esime wogale ́ xɔse me ɖe asi ko . Womexɔ nu siwo ƒe ŋugbe wodo na wo la o , ɖe ko wokpɔ wo , do dzaa na wo le adzɔge eye woʋu eme be amedzrowo kple mɔzɔlawo yewonye le anyigba dzi le afi .

text: For they that say such things declare plainly that they seek a country .
text2: Ame siwo gblɔ nya siawo tɔgbi la , ɖee fia be wole woawo ŋutɔ ƒe dedu dim .

text: And truly , if they had been mindful of that country from whence they came out , they might have had opportunity to have returned .
text2: Nenye be du si me wotso la ŋuti bum wonɔ la , anye ne mɔnukpɔkpɔ anɔ wo si be woatrɔ ayi .

text: But now they desire a better country , that is , an heavenly : wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God : for he hath prepared for them a city .
text2: Le esia teƒe la wole du si nyo wu esi nye dziƒotɔ la dim . Eya ta menye ŋukpe na Mawu be woayɔe be woƒe Mawu o , elabena edzra du nyui aɖe ɖo ɖi na wo .

text: By faith Abraham , when he was tried , offered up Isaac : and he that had received the promises offered up his only begotten son ,
text2: To xɔse me esi Mawu do Abraham kpɔ la , etsɔ via Isak be yeasa vɔe , eya ame si xɔ ŋugbedodoawo la , nɔ klalo be yeatsɔ viaŋutsuvi ɖeka hɔ ̃ la asa vɔe ,

text: Of whom it was said , That in Isaac shall thy seed be called :
text2: togbɔ be Mawu gblɔ nɛ be , “ To Isak dzi la dzidzimevi siwo kata ̃ ƒe ŋugbe wodo na wo ̀ la ava dzɔ ha ̃ . ”

text: Accounting that God was able to raise him up , even from the dead ; from whence also he received him in a figure .
text2: Abraham dze sii be Mawu ate ŋu afɔ ame kukuwo ɖe tsitre eye woate ŋu agblɔe ko be exɔ Isak tso ku me .

text: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come .
text2: To xɔse me Isak yra Yakɔb kple Esau , ku ɖe nu si woava nye le etsɔ me ŋuti .

text: By faith Jacob , when he was a dying , blessed both the sons of Joseph ; and worshipped , leaning upon the top of his staff .
text2: To xɔse me Yakɔb yra Yosef viŋutsuwo le esime eƒe kuɣi ɖo eye wo ̀ ziɔ ɖe eƒe atitɔɖeŋu ŋuti hesubɔ Mawu .

text: By faith Joseph , when he died , made mention of the departing of the children of Israel ; and gave commandment concerning his bones .
text2: To xɔse me esime Yosef ƒe kuɣi ɖo la , eƒo nu tso Israelviwo ƒe gododo le Egipte ŋuti eye wo ̀ gblɔ ɖoɖo tso eƒe ƒuwo ŋuti na wo .

text: By faith Moses , when he was born , was hid three months of his parents , because they saw he was a proper child ; and they were not afraid of the king ' s commandment .
text2: To xɔse me Mose dzilawo ɣlae ɣleti etɔ ̃ sɔŋ le edzidzi vɔ megbe elabena wokpɔe dze sii be menye vidzi ̃ dzodzro aɖe koe wo ̀ nye o eya ta womevɔ ̃ na fia la ƒe se dzi dada o .

text: By faith Moses , when he was come to years , refused to be called the son of Pharaoh ' s daughter ;
text2: To xɔse me esi Mose va tsi la , egbe be womayɔ ye be Farao vinyɔnu ƒe viŋutsu o

text: Choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God , than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season ;
text2: ke boŋ elɔ ̃ be yeakpe fu kple Mawu ƒe amewo wu be yease nu vɔ ̃ ƒe vivi hena ɣeyiɣi kpui aɖe ko .

text: Esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt : for he had respect unto the recompence of the reward .
text2: Ebu vlododo le “ Mesia ” la ta nu xɔasi wu kesinɔnu siwo kata ̃ nɔ Egipte elabena enɔ mɔ kpɔm na eƒe fetu ga ̃ si nɔ ŋgɔgbe .

text: By faith he forsook Egypt , not fearing the wrath of the king : for he endured , as seeing him who is invisible .
text2: To xɔse me Mose dzo le Egipte eye mevɔ ̃ na fia la ƒe dziku o , ke boŋ edo vevi nu elabena ekpɔ eya , ame si womekpɔna kple ŋku o .

text: Through faith he kept the passover , and the sprinkling of blood , lest he that destroyed the firstborn should touch them .
text2: To xɔse me Mose ɖo Ŋutitotoŋkekenyui kple ʋuhehle ̃ la anyi ale be nugble ̃ la si wu ŋgɔgbeviwo la maka asi Israelviwo ƒe ŋgɔgbeviwo ŋu o .

text: By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dry land : which the Egyptians assaying to do were drowned .
text2: To xɔse me Israelviwo tso Ƒu Dzi ̃ la abe anyigba ƒuƒui dzie wozɔ ene , gake esi Egiptetɔwo ha ̃ dze agbagba be yewoawɔ nenema la , wo kata ̃ tsi Ƒu Dzi ̃ la me .

text: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down , after they were compassed about seven days .
text2: To xɔse me Yeriko ƒe gliwo mu esi Israelviwo ƒo xla ̃ e ŋkeke adre .

text: By faith the harlot Rahab perished not with them that believed not , when she had received the spies with peace .
text2: To xɔse me gbolo Rahab , esi wo ̀ xɔ ŋkutsalawo ta la , womewui kpe ɖe tose ̃ lawo ŋuti o .

text: And what shall I more say ? for the time would fail me to tell of Gedeon , and of Barak , and of Samson , and of Jephthae ; of David also , and Samuel , and of the prophets :
text2: Đe wo ̀ gahia ̃ be mayi edzia ? Ɣeyiɣi mele asinye be maƒo nu le Gideon , Barak , Samson , Yefta , David , Samuel kple nyagblɔɖila bubuwo ŋuti o ,

text: Who through faith subdued kingdoms , wrought righteousness , obtained promises , stopped the mouths of lions ,
text2: ame siwo to xɔse me xɔ fiaɖuƒewo , ɖu dzi le dzɔdzɔenyenye me eye woƒe asi su nu si ƒe ŋugbe wodo la dzi . Ame siawo de ga nu na dzatawo ,

text: Quenched the violence of fire , escaped the edge of the sword , out of weakness were made strong , waxed valiant in fight , turned to flight the armies of the aliens .
text2: tsi dzoƒeaɖewo nu eye wosi le yi nu , ame siwo ƒe gbɔdzɔgbɔdzɔ trɔ zu ŋuse ̃ , wozu kale ̃ tɔwo le aʋa me eye woɖu dzronyigbadziʋakɔwo dzi .

text: Women received their dead raised to life again : and others were tortured , not accepting deliverance ; that they might obtain a better resurrection :
text2: Wogbɔ agbe nyɔnu siwo ƒe lɔlɔ ̃ tɔwo ku eye wotsɔ wo na wo agbagbe . Wowɔ funyafunya ame bubuwo eye wogbe be womegana ablɔɖe yewo o ale be tsitretsitsi si nyo wu la nasu yewo si .

text: And others had trial of cruel mockings and scourgings , yea , moreover of bonds and imprisonment :
text2: Woɖu fewu le ame aɖewo ŋu , woƒo ɖewo kple atam ke wode ga bubuwo eye wode wo gaxɔ me .

text: They were stoned , they were sawn asunder , were tempted , were slain with the sword : they wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins ; being destitute , afflicted , tormented ;
text2: Woƒu kpe wo , wodze wo kple laxalaxa ɖe eve eye wowu wo kple yi . Wonɔ yiyim le ale ̃ gbale ̃ wuwo kple gbɔ ̃ gbale ̃ wuwo me le ahedada ga ̃ aɖe me . Woti wo yome eye wose ̃ ŋuta le wo ŋu ,

text: ( Of whom the world was not worthy : ) they wandered in deserts , and in mountains , and in dens and caves of the earth .
text2: womeɖi naneke le xexe sia me o . Wonɔ tsagla ̃ la tsam le gbedzi , towo dzi , agadowo me kple agakpetowo me le anyigba dzi .

text: And these all , having obtained a good report through faith , received not the promise :
text2: Woɖi ɖase nyui le ame siawo kata ̃ ŋuti le woƒe xɔse ta , ke ha ̃ la wo dometɔ aɖeke mexɔ nu si ƒe ŋugbe wodo la o .

text: God having provided some better thing for us , that they without us should not be made perfect .
text2: Mawu wɔ ɖoɖo si nyo wu la ɖe mi ́ a ŋuti , ale be ne wowɔ ɖeka kpli mi ́ la hafi ko woade blibo .

text: Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses , let us lay aside every weight , and the sin which doth so easily beset us , and let us run with patience the race that is set before us ,
text2: Eya ta esi ɖaseɖilawo ƒe ha ga ̃ aɖe ƒo xla ̃ mi ́ ta la , mina mi ́ aɖe mɔxenu ɖe sia ɖe kple nu vɔ ̃ si bla mi ́ sesi ̃ e la ɖa eye mina mi ́ ake duɖime si woɖo ɖi na mi ́ la kple vevidodo .

text: Looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of our faith ; who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross , despising the shame , and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God .
text2: Mina mi ́ akpɔ Yesu dzi , ame si nye mi ́ aƒe xɔse ƒe gɔmeɖola kple nuwula , ame si le dzidzɔ si le ŋgɔ nɛ ta la , to atitsoga ƒe fu la me eye mebui ŋukpee o . Ale wo ̀ yi ɖanɔ Mawu ƒe fiazikpui la ƒe nuɖusime .

text: For consider him that endured such contradiction of sinners against himself , lest ye be wearied and faint in your minds .
text2: Mibu fukpekpe ga ̃ si me wo ̀ to le nu vɔ ̃ wɔlawo sime ŋu ale be miagagbɔdzɔ eye dzi naɖe le mia ƒo o .

text: Ye have not yet resisted unto blood , striving against sin .
text2: Le miaƒe ʋiʋli le nu vɔ ̃ sime la , mieʋli va se ɖe esime miaƒe ʋu kɔ ɖi haɖe o .

text: And ye have forgotten the exhortation which speaketh unto you as unto children , My son , despise not thou the chastening of the Lord , nor faint when thou art rebuked of him :
text2: Ke mieŋlɔ dzideƒonya si yɔ mi be viŋutsuwo la be . Nya lae nye be , “ Vinyeŋutsu , me ̀ gado vlo Aƒetɔ la ƒe amehehe eye dzi megaɖe le ƒowo ̀ ne eka mo na wo ̀ o ,

text: For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth , and scourgeth every son whom he receiveth .
text2: elabena Aƒetɔ la ɖɔa ame siwo wo ̀ lɔ ̃ la ɖo eye wo ̀ hea to na ame sia ame si wo ̀ xɔ abe viaŋutsu ene . ”

text: If ye endure chastening , God dealeth with you as with sons ; for what son is he whom the father chasteneth not ?
text2: Mito fukpekpe me abe miaƒe hehe ƒe akpa aɖe ene elabena Mawu le mia hem abe viaŋutsuwo ene elabena viŋutsu kae li ame si fofoa mehea to na o ?

text: But if ye be without chastisement , whereof all are partakers , then are ye bastards , and not sons .
text2: Ame sia ame toa hehe me eya ta ne miawo mieto hehe me o la , ekema mienye viŋutsuvi vava ̃ wo o , ke boŋ mienye ahasiviwo .

text: Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which corrected us , and we gave them reverence : shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits , and live ?
text2: Gawu la , anyigbadzifofowo le mi ́ a si , ame siwo naa hehe mi ́ eye mi ́ etsɔ bubu naa wo ɖe eta . Geɖe wu la , ele be mi ́ abɔbɔ mi ́ a ɖokui ɖe mi ́ a Fofo , gbɔgbɔmetɔ , te be mi ́ anɔ agbe !

text: For they verily for a few days chastened us after their own pleasure ; but he for our profit , that we might be partakers of his holiness .
text2: Mi ́ aƒe anyigbadzifofowo hea to na mi ́ hena ɣeyiɣi kpui aɖe abe ale si wo ̀ nyo na woe ene gake Mawu ya hea to na mi ́ hena mi ́ aƒe nyonyo be mi ́ akpɔ gome le eƒe kɔkɔenyenye me .

text: Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous , but grievous : nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby .
text2: Tohehe aɖeke meli si vivia ame nu o , ke boŋ evena , ke ha ̃ la , emegbe la , etsea dzɔdzɔenyenye kple ŋutifafa ƒe kuwo na ame siwo to tohehe la te .

text: Wherefore lift up the hands which hang down , and the feeble knees ;
text2: Eya ta mido ŋuse ̃ miaƒe abɔ siwo gbɔdzɔ kple miaƒe klo beliwo .

text: And make straight paths for your feet , lest that which is lame be turned out of the way ; but let it rather be healed .
text2: Mita mɔ dzɔdzɔewo na miaƒe afɔwo ale be atatututɔ matsi mɔ ta o , ke boŋ wo ̀ akpɔ dɔyɔyɔ .

text: Follow peace with all men , and holiness , without which no man shall see the Lord :
text2: Midze agbagba ɖe sia ɖe be mianɔ anyi kple amewo kata ̃ le ŋutifafa me eye mianɔ kɔkɔe , elabena kɔkɔenyenyemanɔmee la ame aɖeke mate ŋu akpɔ Aƒetɔ la o .

text: Looking diligently lest any man fail of the grace of God ; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you , and thereby many be defiled ;
text2: Mikpɔ egbɔ be , Mawu ƒe amenuveve metsi ame aɖeke ŋu o eye mikpɔ nyuie be gbe vɔ ̃ aɖeke meto ke ɖe mia dome esi ava zu aɖi vɔ ̃ ɖi anɔ fu ɖem na ame geɖewo ahaƒo ɖi wo o .

text: Lest there be any fornicator , or profane person , as Esau , who for one morsel of meat sold his birthright .
text2: Mikpɔ nyuie be ame aɖeke mezu ahi ̃ awɔla alo anye mawumavɔ ̃ la abe Esau ene ame si tsɔ eƒe ŋgɔgbevinyenye kple eŋu domenyinuwo dzra ɖe nuɖuɖu zi ɖeka ko ta la ene o .

text: For ye know how that afterward , when he would have inherited the blessing , he was rejected : for he found no place of repentance , though he sought it carefully with tears .
text2: Abe ale si mienya nyuie ene la , esi wo ̀ va be yeanyi yayra sia ƒe dome emegbe la , wogbe enana . Mɔ aɖeke meli si dzi wo ̀ ato be woatrɔ nu sia o , togbɔ be edi yayra sia kple aɖatsi ha ̃ .

text: For ye are not come unto the mount that might be touched , and that burned with fire , nor unto blackness , and darkness , and tempest ,
text2: Menye to si ŋuti woate ŋu aka asii , to si le bibim kple dzo la gbɔe mieva o ; mieva viviti , afudodo kple ahom gbɔ o .

text: And the sound of a trumpet , and the voice of words ; which voice they that heard intreated that the word should not be spoken to them any more :
text2: Menye kpe ̃ ɖiɖi , gbe si le nu ƒom ale be ame siwo see la ɖe kuku nɛ be megaƒo nu na yewo azɔ o la gbɔe mieva o ;

text: ( For they could not endure that which was commanded , And if so much as a beast touch the mountain , it shall be stoned , or thrust through with a dart :
text2: elabena womate ŋu awɔ ɖe gbe si woɖe na wo be , “ Ne la ̃ aɖe gɔ ̃ ha ̃ ka asi to la ŋu la , ele be woaƒu kpee woaku la dzi o . ”

text: And so terrible was the sight , that Moses said , I exceedingly fear and quake : )
text2: Nukpɔkpɔ la dzi ŋɔ ale gbegbe be Mose gblɔ be , “ Mele dzodzom nyanyanya kple vɔvɔ ̃ . ”

text: But ye are come unto mount Sion , and unto the city of the living God , the heavenly Jerusalem , and to an innumerable company of angels ,
text2: Ke mieva Zion to la gbɔ , dziƒo Yerusalem , si nye Mawu gbagbe la ƒe du la gbɔe mieva . Mieva mawudɔla akpe akpe siwo ƒo ƒu le dzidzɔ kpɔm la ƒe asaɖa me .

text: To the general assembly and church of the firstborn , which are written in heaven , and to God the Judge of all , and to the spirits of just men made perfect ,
text2: Mieva ŋgɔgbevi la ƒe hame , ame si ƒe ŋkɔwo woŋlɔ ɖe dziƒo . Mieva Mawu , ame si nye amegbetɔwo kata ̃ ƒe ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ la la gbɔ . Mieva ame dzɔdzɔe siwo wowɔ blibo la ƒe gbɔgbɔwo gbɔ ,

text: And to Jesus the mediator of the new covenant , and to the blood of sprinkling , that speaketh better things than that of Abel .
text2: mieva Yesu , nubabla yeye la ƒe avule ́ la la gbɔ kple ʋuhehle ̃ si ƒo nu nyuie wu Abel ƒe ʋu la gbɔ .

text: See that ye refuse not him that speaketh . For if they escaped not who refused him that spake on earth , much more shall not we escape , if we turn away from him that speaketh from heaven :
text2: Mikpɔ nyuie be miagagbe toɖoɖo ame si le nu ƒom la o . Nenye be womete ŋu si , esi wogbe toɖoɖo eya ame si xlɔ ̃ nu wo le anyigba dzi la nu o la , ale ke mi ́ awo ya mi ́ ate ŋu asii ne mi ́ egbe toɖoɖo ame si le nu xlɔ ̃ m mi ́ tso dziƒo ?

text: Whose voice then shook the earth : but now he hath promised , saying , Yet once more I shake not the earth only , but also heaven .
text2: Le ɣemaɣi me la , eƒe gbe ʋuʋu anyigba gake azɔ la edo ŋugbe be , “ Magaʋuʋu menye anyigba ɖeɖe ko o , ke boŋ dziƒowo ha ̃ ”

text: And this word , Yet once more , signifieth the removing of those things that are shaken , as of things that are made , that those things which cannot be shaken may remain .
text2: Nyagbe , “ ake ” ɖee fia be woaɖe nu si woate ŋu aʋuʋu la ɖa , nu siwo nye nuwɔwɔwo ale be nu siwo womate ŋu aʋuʋu o la ɖeɖe ko natsi anyi .

text: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved , let us have grace , whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear :
text2: Eya ta esi mi ́ ele mɔ kpɔm na fiaɖuƒe si womate ŋu aʋuʋu o la xɔxɔ la , mina mi ́ ada akpe ɖe eta eye mi ́ asubɔ Mawu le mɔ si adze la dzi le vɔvɔ ̃ kple dzodzo nyanyanya me ,

text: For our God is a consuming fire .
text2: elabena dzo si fiaa nu lae nye mi ́ aƒe Mawu la .

text: Let brotherly love continue .
text2: Minɔ mia nɔewo lɔlɔ ̃ dzi ɖaa abe dadaviwo ene

text: Be not forgetful to entertain strangers : for thereby some have entertained angels unawares .
text2: Migaŋlɔ amedzrowɔwɔ be o ; to esia wɔwɔ me ame aɖewo xɔ mawudɔlawo le manyamanya me

text: Remember them that are in bonds , as bound with them ; and them which suffer adversity , as being yourselves also in the body .
text2: miɖo ŋku ame siwo wode gaxɔme la dzi abe miawo ha ̃ e le gaxɔme kpli wo ene . Nenema ke miɖo ŋku ame siwo wole fu wɔmii la dzi abe miawo ha ̃ e le fua kpem ene .

text: Marriage is honourable in all , and the bed undefiled : but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge .
text2: Ame sia ame nade bubu srɔ ̃ ɖeɖe ŋu eye womaƒo ɖi srɔ ̃ ɖeba o elabena Mawu abu fɔ ahasiwɔlawo kple matrewɔlawo kata ̃ .

text: Let your conversation be without covetousness ; and be content with such things as ye have : for he hath said , I will never leave thee , nor forsake thee .
text2: Mite mia ɖokuiwo ɖa xaa tso galɔlɔ ̃ gbɔ eye nu si le mia si la nedze mia ŋu elabena Mawu gblɔ be , “ Nyemaɖe asi le mia ŋu akpɔ o eye nyemagble ̃ mi ɖi akpɔ gbeɖe o . ”

text: So that we may boldly say , The Lord is my helper , and I will not fear what man shall do unto me .
text2: Esia ta mi ́ egblɔ kple dzideƒo be , “ Yehowae nye nye xɔnametɔ , nyemavɔ ̃ o . Nu ka amegbetɔ ate ŋu awɔm ? ”

text: Remember them which have the rule over you , who have spoken unto you the word of God : whose faith follow , considering the end of their conversation .
text2: Miɖo ŋku miaƒe kplɔlawo dzi , ame siwo gblɔa Mawu ƒe nya na mi . Mibu nu siwo do go tso woƒe agbenɔnɔ me la ŋuti ne miasrɔ ̃ woƒe xɔse .

text: Jesus Christ the same yesterday , and to day , and for ever .
text2: Yesu Kristo metrɔna gbeɖe o , ale si wo ̀ nɔ etsɔ si va yi , nenema kee wo ̀ le egbe eye nenema kee wo ̀ anɔ ɖaa .

text: Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines . For it is a good thing that the heart be established with grace ; not with meats , which have not profited them that have been occupied therein .
text2: Migana nufiafia trama aɖeke nakplɔ miaƒe susuwo adzoe o . Enyo be woatsɔ amenuveve ado ŋuse ̃ miaƒe dziwo ke menye to nuɖuɖu tɔxɛ aɖewo ƒe sewo dzi wɔwɔ me o , esiwo mehea viɖe aɖeke vanɛ na ame siwo ɖunɛ la o .

text: We have an altar , whereof they have no right to eat which serve the tabernacle .
text2: Vɔsamlekpui aɖe le mia si ; Osɔfo siwo subɔna le Agbadɔ me gɔ ̃ ha ̃ mekpɔ mɔ aɖu nu si tso vɔsamlekpui sia dzi o .

text: For the bodies of those beasts , whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin , are burned without the camp .
text2: Osɔfoga ̃ la tsɔa la ̃ wo ƒe ʋu yina ɖe Kɔkɔeƒe ƒe Kɔkɔeƒe la abe nu vɔ ̃ ŋuti vɔsa ene , gake wotɔa dzo la ̃ awo ŋutɔ le asaɖa la godo .

text: Wherefore Jesus also , that he might sanctify the people with his own blood , suffered without the gate .
text2: Esia tae Yesu ha ̃ kpe fu le du la ƒe agbo godo be wo ̀ akɔ eƒe amewo ŋu , awɔ wo kɔkɔe to eya ŋutɔ ƒe ʋu la me .

text: Let us go forth therefore unto him without the camp , bearing his reproach .
text2: Eya ta mina mi ́ ayi egbɔ azɔ le asaɖa la godo be mi ́ awo ha ̃ mi ́ aɖu ŋukpe si wo ̀ tsɔ ,

text: For here have we no continuing city , but we seek one to come .
text2: elabena du si nɔa anyi ɖaa la , mele mi ́ a si le afii o , ke mi ́ ele mɔ kpɔm na du si lava va .

text: By him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually , that is , the fruit of our lips giving thanks to his name .
text2: Eya ta mina mi ́ atsɔ kafukafuvɔsa na Mawu ɣesiaɣi to Yesu dzi , kafukafu siwo nye kutsetse tso nuyi siwo ʋua Yesu ƒe ŋkɔ me la me .

text: But to do good and to communicate forget not : for with such sacrifices God is well pleased .
text2: Migaŋlɔ nyuiwɔwɔ be o eye miama nu kple mia nɔewo elabena vɔsa siawo tɔgbie dzea Mawu ŋu .

text: Obey them that have the rule over you , and submit yourselves : for they watch for your souls , as they that must give account , that they may do it with joy , and not with grief : for that is unprofitable for you .
text2: Miɖo to miaƒe kplɔlawo eye miwɔ ɖe nu siwo wogblɔ na mi la dzi elabena wole mia ta kpɔm abe ame siwo wo ̀ le be woana akɔnta Mawu tso woƒe dɔwɔna ŋu ene . Miɖo to wo ale be woƒe dɔwɔwɔ nanye dzidzɔ na wo eye mazu agba na wo o ; elabena ne ele alea la , manye kpekpeɖeŋu aɖeke na miawo ha ̃ o .

text: Pray for us : for we trust we have a good conscience , in all things willing to live honestly .
text2: Mido gbe ɖa ɖe mi ́ a ta ɣesiaɣi . Mi ́ eka ɖe edzi be dzitsinya nyui le mi ́ a si eye mi ́ edina be mi ́ anɔ agbe bubutɔe ɣesiaɣi le nu sia nu me .

text: But I beseech you the rather to do this , that I may be restored to you the sooner .
text2: Medi vevie be maƒoe ɖe mia nu tɔxɛ be miado gbe ɖa be woaɖe asi le ŋutinye na mi kpuie .

text: Now the God of peace , that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus , that great shepherd of the sheep , through the blood of the everlasting covenant ,
text2: Ŋutifafa ƒe Mawu la , ame si to nubabla mavɔ ƒe ʋu la me kplɔ mi ́ aƒe Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo Ale ̃ kplɔla ga ̃ la do goe tso ame kukuwo dome la ,

text: Make you perfect in every good work to do his will , working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight , through Jesus Christ ; to whom be glory for ever and ever . Amen .
text2: natsɔ nu nyui sia nu nyui akpe ɖe mia ŋuti le eƒe lɔlɔ ̃ nuwɔwɔ ta eye wo ̀ awɔ nu si dze eŋu la le mi ́ a me to Yesu Kristo dzi , ame si ko tɔ anye ŋutikɔkɔe tso mavɔ me yi mavɔ me . Amen .

text: And I beseech you , brethren , suffer the word of exhortation : for I have written a letter unto you in few words .
text2: Nɔvi lɔlɔ ̃ awo , mele eƒom ɖe mia nu be miale ́ to ɖe nye dzideƒonamenyawo ŋu elabena agbale ̃ kpui aɖe koe wo ̀ nye meŋlɔ na mi .

text: Know ye that our brother Timothy is set at liberty ; with whom , if he come shortly , I will see you .
text2: Medi be mana mianya be woɖe asi le mi ́ a nɔvi Timoteo ŋu . Ne eva ɖo afi sia kaba la , nye kplii mi ́ ava kpɔ mi ɖa .

text: Salute all them that have the rule over you , and all the saints . They of Italy salute you .
text2: Mido gbe na miaƒe kplɔlawo kata ̃ kple Mawu ƒe ameawo kata ̃ . Nɔvi siwo tso Italia ha ̃ do gbe na mi .

text: Grace be with you all . Amen .
text2: Amenuveve nanɔ anyi kple mi kata ̃ .

text: James , a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ , to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad , greeting .
text2: Agbale ̃ sia tso Yakobo , Mawu kple Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo ƒe dɔla , gbɔ na Yudatɔ kristotɔ siwo kaka ɖe xexeame godoo . Mele gbe dom na mi kata ̃ .

text: My brethren , count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations ;
text2: Nɔvi lɔlɔ ̃ awo , ne dodokpɔ ƒomevi geɖewo tu mi la mibui dzidzɔ sɔŋ ,

text: Knowing this , that the trying of your faith worketh patience .
text2: elabena mienyae bena miaƒe xɔse ƒe dodokpɔ hea dzidodo vanɛ .

text: But let patience have her perfect work , that ye may be perfect and entire , wanting nothing .
text2: Ele be dzidodo nawu eƒe dɔ nu ale be miatsi azu blibo eye naneke mahia ̃ mi o .

text: If any of you lack wisdom , let him ask of God , that giveth to all men liberally , and upbraideth not ; and it shall be given him .
text2: Ne ame aɖe hia ̃ nunya la nebia Mawu ame si naa ame sia ame faa kple dɔmekɔkɔ eye Mawu anae fɔbubumanɔmee .

text: But let him ask in faith , nothing wavering . For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed .
text2: Gake ne ebia la ele nɛ be wo ̀ axɔe ase ɖikekemanɔmee elabena ame si kea ɖi la le abe ƒutsotsoe si ya ƒona yina gbɔna la ene .

text: For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord .
text2: Ame ma megasusu be yeaxɔ naneke tso Aƒetɔ la gbɔ o .

text: A double minded man is unstable in all his ways .
text2: Elabena enye dzime eve susula eye meli ke le nu siwo kata ̃ wowɔna la me o .

text: Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted :
text2: Nɔvi si mele nɔƒe kɔkɔ aɖeke o la neƒo adegbe be wodo ye ɖe dzi .

text: But the rich , in that he is made low : because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away .
text2: Ke ame si si kesinɔnuwo le la neƒo adegbe be yemenye naneke o elabena enu ava yi abe seƒoƒo le gbe dzi ene .

text: For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat , but it withereth the grass , and the flower thereof falleth , and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth : so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways .
text2: Elabena ɣe dzena eye ɣe la ƒe ŋuse ̃ naa gbe yrɔna eye eƒe seƒoƒo duduna , ale wo ̀ bua eƒe anidzedze . Nenema ke kesinɔtɔ ha ̃ nu ava yi esime wo ̀ ɖo eƒe agbe ƒe viviƒe .

text: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation : for when he is tried , he shall receive the crown of life , which the Lord hath promised to them that love him .
text2: Woayra ame si doa dzi le tetekpɔ me elabena ne enɔ te va se ɖe nuwuwu la axɔ agbefiakuku esi ƒe ŋugbe Mawu do na ame siwo lɔ ̃ nɛ .

text: Let no man say when he is tempted , I am tempted of God : for God cannot be tempted with evil , neither tempteth he any man :
text2: Ne wote ame aɖe kpɔ la megagblɔ be , “ Mawu le teyem kpɔ o . ” Elabena womate ŋu atsɔ nu vɔ ̃ ɖi ate Mawu kpɔ alo eya ŋutɔ ha ̃ nate ame aɖeke akpɔ o .

text: But every man is tempted , when he is drawn away of his own lust , and enticed .
text2: Ke boŋ ame sia ame ƒe didi vɔ ̃ woe tenɛ kpɔna eye woblea enu hehenɛ dzonae .

text: Then when lust hath conceived , it bringeth forth sin : and sin , when it is finished , bringeth forth death .
text2: Emegbe la didi vɔ ̃ la fɔa fu hedzia nu vɔ ̃ eye ne nu vɔ ̃ tsi nyuie la edzia ku .

text: Do not err , my beloved brethren .
text2: Nɔvi lɔlɔ ̃ awo , migana woable mi o .

text: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above , and cometh down from the Father of lights , with whom is no variableness , neither shadow of turning .
text2: Nunana nyui kple nunana deblibo ɖe sia ɖe dziƒoe wo ̀ tsona , tso dziƒokekeli ƒe Fofo la gbɔ , ame si metrɔna abe ale si vɔvɔli ̃ trɔnae ene o .

text: Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth , that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures .
text2: Enye eƒe lɔlɔ ̃ nu be wo ̀ adzi mi ́ to nyateƒe ƒe nya la me ale be mi ́ anye eƒe nuwɔwɔwo kata ̃ ƒe kutsetse gba ̃ tɔ .

text: Wherefore , my beloved brethren , let every man be swift to hear , slow to speak , slow to wrath :
text2: Nɔvinye lɔlɔ ̃ awo , mile ́ ŋku ɖe nu sia ŋu be : ame sia ame naɖe abla le nusese me , nanɔ blewu le nuƒoƒo kple dzikudodo me ,

text: For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God .
text2: elabena ame ƒe dziku mehea dzɔdzɔenyenye ƒe agbenɔnɔ si Mawu di la vanɛ o .

text: Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness , and receive with meekness the engrafted word , which is able to save your souls .
text2: Eya ta miɖe ŋutila ̃ meɖiƒoƒowo kata ̃ ɖi kple nu vɔ ̃ ɖi wɔwɔ si bɔ ɖe mia dome la ɖi , eye miatsɔ ɖokuibɔbɔ axɔ nya si wodo ɖe mia me esi si ŋuse ̃ le be wo ̀ aɖe miaƒe luʋɔwo .

text: But be ye doers of the word , and not hearers only , deceiving your own selves .
text2: Miganye nya la selawo ko ahanɔ mia ɖokuiwo blem o , ke boŋ miwɔ ɖe nu si nya la gblɔ dzi .

text: For if any be a hearer of the word , and not a doer , he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass :
text2: Elabena ame aɖe si se nya la eye mewɔ ɖe edzi o ɖi ame aɖe si kpɔ eƒe mo le ahuhɔ ̃ e me ,

text: For he beholdeth himself , and goeth his way , and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was .
text2: ke esi wodzo le ahuhɔ ̃ ea gbɔ la megaɖo ŋku ale si eƒe dzedzeme le la dzi o .

text: But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty , and continueth therein , he being not a forgetful hearer , but a doer of the work , this man shall be blessed in his deed .
text2: Ke ame si dzroa Mawu ƒe se si de blibo , si naa ablɔɖe ame la me tsitotsito ɣesiaɣi eye meŋlɔa nu si wo ̀ srɔ ̃ la be o ke boŋ wo ̀ wɔa edzi la woayrae le nu si wo ̀ wɔna la me .

text: If any man among you seem to be religious , and bridleth not his tongue , but deceiveth his own heart , this man ' s religion is vain .
text2: Ne ame aɖe gblɔ be yenye xɔsetɔ ke mede ga eƒe aɖe o la le eɖokui blem eye eƒe xɔse la ha ̃ nye dzodzro .

text: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this , To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction , and to keep himself unspotted from the world .
text2: Xɔse si mi ́ a Mawu Fofo la xɔna abe esi le dzadzɛ eye kpɔtsɔtsɔ mele eŋu o lae nye esi be : woakpɔ tsyɔ ̃ eviwo kple ahosiwo dzi le woƒe xaxa me , eye be amea maƒo ɖi eɖokui kple xexemenuwo o .

text: My brethren , have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ , the Lord of glory , with respect of persons .
text2: Nɔvinye lɔlɔ ̃ awo , abe ame si xɔ mi ́ aƒe ŋutikɔkɔe ƒe Aƒetɔ , Yesu Kristo , dzi se ene la , migakpɔ ame ŋkume o .

text: For if there come unto your assembly a man with a gold ring , in goodly apparel , and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment ;
text2: Mi ́ tsɔe be ame aɖe va mi ́ aƒe sɔleme eye wo ̀ do sikasigɛ nyuitɔ heta avɔ xɔasi eye ame dahe si do awu vuvu ha ̃ ge ɖe sɔlemexɔa me .

text: And ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing , and say unto him , Sit thou here in a good place ; and say to the poor , Stand thou there , or sit here under my footstool :
text2: Ne mietsɔ bubu tɔxɛ na ame si do awu xɔasi la hegblɔ nɛ be , “ Va nɔ teƒe nyui sia , ” gake miegblɔ na ame dahe la be “ Wo ̀ ya nɔ tsitre ɖe afi ma ” alo “ Bɔbɔ nɔ anyigba le nye afɔnu , ” la

text: Are ye not then partial in yourselves , and are become judges of evil thoughts ?
text2: ɖe miede vovo ameawo me le mia dome eye mieva zu ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ la siwo me susu vɔ ̃ ɖiwo le o maha ̃ ?

text: Hearken , my beloved brethren , Hath not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith , and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him ?
text2: Nɔvinye lɔlɔ ̃ tɔwo , miɖo tom : Đe Mawu metia ame siwo xexemetɔwo buna be wonye ame dahewo la be woanye kesinɔtɔwo le xɔse me eye be woanyi fiaɖuƒe si ŋugbe wo ̀ do na ame siwo lɔ ̃ nɛ la ƒe dome o maha ̃ ?

text: But ye have despised the poor . Do not rich men oppress you , and draw you before the judgment seats ?
text2: Ke miawo la miedzu ame dahewo . Đe menye kesinɔtɔwoe le miabam oa ?

text: Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called ?
text2: Đe menye woawoe le ɖi ƒom ame si ŋu bubuŋkɔ le , ame si tɔ mienye la oa ?

text: If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself , ye do well :
text2: Ne miele ́ fiasedede si le mawunya me esi gblɔ be , “ Lɔ ̃ hawo ̀ vi abe wo ̀ ŋutɔ ɖokuiwo ̀ ene , ” ɖe asi la miele nu dzɔdzɔetɔ wɔm .

text: But if ye have respect to persons , ye commit sin , and are convinced of the law as transgressors .
text2: Ke ne miele ame ŋkume kpɔm la miewɔ nu vɔ ̃ eye se la bu fɔ mi be mienye sedzidalawo .

text: For whosoever shall keep the whole law , and yet offend in one point , he is guilty of all .
text2: Ame si wɔa Mawu ƒe sewo kata ̃ dzi , gake wo ̀ da le ɖeka pɛ dzi la , eda le wo kata ̃ dzi .

text: For he that said , Do not commit adultery , said also , Do not kill . Now if thou commit no adultery , yet if thou kill , thou art become a transgressor of the law .
text2: Elabena ame si de se be , “ Me ̀ gawɔ ahasi o ” la eya kee de se be , “ Me ̀ gawu ame o . ” Eya ta ne me ̀ wɔ ahasi o , gake ne ̀ wu ame la , e ̀ nye sedzidala .

text: So speak ye , and so do , as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty .
text2: Miaƒe nuƒo kple agbenɔnɔ naɖee fia be wole ʋɔnu drɔ ̃ ge mi kple se si naa ablɔɖe .

text: For he shall have judgment without mercy , that hath shewed no mercy ; and mercy rejoiceth against judgment .
text2: Elabena ʋɔnudɔdrɔ ̃ si me nublanuikpɔkpɔ mele o la woatsɔ na ame si mekpɔa nublanui o . Nublanuikpɔkpɔ ɖua ʋɔnudɔdrɔ ̃ dzi .

text: What doth it profit , my brethren , though a man say he hath faith , and have not works ? can faith save him ?
text2: Nɔvinye lɔlɔ ̃ awo , viɖe ka wo ̀ anye ne ame aɖe gblɔ bena xɔse le ye si evɔ la dɔwɔwɔ mekpe ɖe eŋu o ? Đe xɔse sia tɔgbi ate ŋu aɖea ?

text: If a brother or sister be naked , and destitute of daily food ,
text2: Mi ́ tsɔe be nɔviŋutsu alo nɔvinyɔnu aɖe li esi si avɔ kple gbe sia gbe ƒe nuɖuɖu mele o .

text: And one of you say unto them , Depart in peace , be ye warmed and filled ; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body ; what doth it profit ?
text2: Ne mia dometɔ aɖe agblɔ nɛ be , “ Heyi , medi dzɔgbenyui na wo ̀ , de dzo la ̃ me eye naɖi ƒo nyuie , ” evɔ mehewɔ naneke le eƒe ŋutila ̃ mehiahia ̃ wo ŋuti o la , viɖe kae wonye ?

text: Even so faith , if it hath not works , is dead , being alone .
text2: Nenema kee , nye xɔse ŋutɔ ha ̃ . Ne dɔwɔwɔ mekpe ɖe eŋu o la enye nu kuku .

text: Yea , a man may say , Thou hast faith , and I have works : shew me thy faith without thy works , and I will shew thee my faith by my works .
text2: Ke ame aɖe agblɔ dzideƒotɔe be , “ Wo ̀ la xɔse le asiwo ̀ ke nye la dɔwɔwɔwo le asinye . ” Fia wo ̀ xɔse si ŋu dɔwɔwɔwo mekpe ɖo o lam eye nye ha ̃ maɖe nye xɔse afia wo ̀ to dɔ siwo mewɔna la me .

text: Thou believest that there is one God ; thou doest well : the devils also believe , and tremble .
text2: E ̀ xɔe se be Mawu ɖeka koe li , enyo gake gbɔgbɔ vɔ ̃ wo ha ̃ xɔe se nenema eye wodzona nyanyanya kple vɔvɔ ̃ .

text: But wilt thou know , O vain man , that faith without works is dead ?
text2: Wo ̀ bometsila , ɖe ne ̀ le kakaɖedzi dim hafi anya be xɔse , dɔwɔwɔmanɔmee nye xɔse kuku oa ?

text: Was not Abraham our father justified by works , when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar ?
text2: Đe womebu mi ́ a tɔgbui , Abraham , be enye dzɔdzɔetɔ le nu si wo ̀ wɔ esi wo ̀ tsɔ via Isak be yeasa vɔe na Mawu oa ?

text: Seest thou how faith wrought with his works , and by works was faith made perfect ?
text2: Edze ƒaa ̃ be eƒe xɔse kple dɔwɔwɔwo sɔ ɖekae ale be eƒe xɔse de blibo to nu si wo ̀ wɔ la me .

text: And the scripture was fulfilled which saith , Abraham believed God , and it was imputed unto him for righteousness : and he was called the Friend of God .
text2: Esia wɔ ɖe mawunya si gblɔ be , “ Abraham xɔ Mawu dzi se eye wo ̀ to esia me zu ame dzɔdzɔe ” la dzi eya ta woyɔe be Mawu xɔlɔ ̃ .

text: Ye see then how that by works a man is justified , and not by faith only .
text2: Edze ƒa ̃ a be menye ame ƒe xɔse ɖeɖe koe wotsɔna tsoa afia o ke boŋ dɔ siwo wo ̀ wɔ ha ̃ kpena ɖe eŋu .

text: Likewise also was not Rahab the harlot justified by works , when she had received the messengers , and had sent them out another way ?
text2: Nenema ke ɖe womebu Rahab gbolo la gɔ ̃ ha ̃ be enye dzɔdzɔetɔ le nu si wo ̀ wɔ esi wo ̀ ɣla ŋkutsala siwo dze egbɔ eye wo ̀ na woto mɔ bubu dzo oa ?

text: For as the body without the spirit is dead , so faith without works is dead also .
text2: Ale si ŋutila ̃ , gbɔgbɔmanɔmee nye nu kuku la nenema ke xɔse , dɔwɔwɔmanɔmee ha ̃ nye nu kuku .

text: My brethren , be not many masters , knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation .
text2: Nɔvinye lɔlɔ ̃ awo , mia dometɔ geɖewo megabu wo ɖokuiwo nufialawoe o , elabena mienyae be mi ́ ame siwo nye nufialawo la woadrɔ ̃ ʋɔnu mi ́ vevie wu ame bubuwo .

text: For in many things we offend all . If any man offend not in word , the same is a perfect man , and able also to bridle the whole body .
text2: Elabena mi ́ a dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe daa vo le mɔ geɖewo nu . Ne ame aɖe medaa vo le nuƒoƒo me o la eyae nye ame si de blibo ale wo ̀ tea ŋu dea ga eƒe ŋutila ̃ blibo la .

text: Behold , we put bits in the horses ' mouths , that they may obey us ; and we turn about their whole body .
text2: Numega sue si mi ́ edea sɔwo ƒe nume la , eyae nana be woɖoa to mi ́ eye mi ́ etea ŋu trɔa la ̃ bliboa ɖe afi sia afi .

text: Behold also the ships , which though they be so great , and are driven of fierce winds , yet are they turned about with a very small helm , whithersoever the governor listeth .
text2: Mi ́ tsɔ tɔdziʋu ga ̃ wo abe kpɔɖeŋu ene . Togbɔ be wololo ga ̃ eye ya sese ̃ woe hea wo ha ̃ la , kuɖɔ sue aɖe si le ʋua gɔme lae kuɖɔɖola la za ̃ na tsɔna trɔa tɔdziʋu ga ̃ la ƒe mo ɖe afi sia afi si wo ̀ di be tɔdziʋu ga ̃ la nayi .

text: Even so the tongue is a little member , and boasteth great things . Behold , how great a matter a little fire kindleth !
text2: Nenema ke ame ƒe aɖe nye ŋutinu sue aɖe ko gake etea ŋu ƒoa adegbe ga ̃ . Mikpɔ ale si dzoxi sue aɖe tea ŋu tɔa dzo ave ga ̃ woe la ɖa .

text: And the tongue is a fire , a world of iniquity : so is the tongue among our members , that it defileth the whole body , and setteth on fire the course of nature ; and it is set on fire of hell .
text2: Aɖe ŋutɔ ha ̃ nye dzo ; enye xexeme vɔ ̃ ɖi le ŋutinuwo dome . Egble ̃ a ameti blibo la dome . Etɔa dzo amea ƒe agbemɔzɔzɔ blibo la eye mlɔeba la wotɔa dzo eya ŋutɔ ha ̃ le dzo mavɔ ʋe me .

text: For every kind of beasts , and of birds , and of serpents , and of things in the sea , is tamed , and hath been tamed of mankind :
text2: Amegbetɔ ate ŋu amla la ̃ ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi , xeviwo , nutatawo kple tɔmela ̃ wo siaa ,

text: But the tongue can no man tame ; it is an unruly evil , full of deadly poison .
text2: gake ame aɖeke mate ŋu amla ame ƒe aɖe o . Enye aɖi vɔ ̃ ɖi si dzi womate ŋu aɖu o .

text: Therewith bless we God , even the Father ; and therewith curse we men , which are made after the similitude of God .
text2: Mietsɔa mi ́ aƒe aɖe kafua mi ́ aƒe Aƒetɔ kple Mawu eye mi ́ egatsɔa aɖe ma ke ƒoa fi dea amegbetɔ si wowɔ ɖe Mawu ƒe nɔnɔme me .

text: Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing . My brethren , these things ought not so to be .
text2: Kafukafu kple fiƒode dona tsoa ame ƒe nu ɖeka ma ke me . Ke , nɔvinyewo , le nyateƒe me la , mele be wo ̀ anɔ alea o .

text: Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet water and bitter ?
text2: Đe vudo ɖeka ma ate ŋu adzi tsi vivi kple dzetsia ?

text: Can the fig tree , my brethren , bear olive berries ? either a vine , figs ? so can no fountain both yield salt water and fresh .
text2: Nɔvinyewo , ɖe gboti ate ŋu atse amikutsetsewo , alo wainka ate ŋu atse gbotitsetsewoa ? Gbeɖe , dzetsivudo ha ̃ mate ŋu adzi tsi vivi o .

text: Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you ? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom .
text2: Ame kae nye nunyala kple nugɔmesela le mia dome ? Neɖee fia to agbe nyui nɔnɔ kple dɔwɔwɔ siwo wowɔ le ɖokuibɔbɔ si tsoa nunya gbɔ la me .

text: But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts , glory not , and lie not against the truth .
text2: Ke ne miaƒe dzi yɔ fu ̃ u kple ŋuʋaʋa ̃ vɔ ̃ ɖi kple ɖokuitɔdidi la , esia meganye adegbe mianɔ ƒoƒom alo agbe nyateƒe la o .

text: This wisdom descendeth not from above , but is earthly , sensual , devilish .
text2: ” Nunya ” sia tɔgbi metso dziƒo o , ke boŋ etso anyigba dzi afi eye wo ̀ nye nu si tso Abosam gbɔ eye eŋuti mekɔ o .

text: For where envying and strife is , there is confusion and every evil work .
text2: Elabena afi si ŋuʋaʋa ̃ kple ɖokuitɔdidi vivivo le lae , masɔmasɔ kple nu vloe ɖe sia ɖe wɔwɔ nɔna .

text: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure , then peaceable , gentle , and easy to be intreated , full of mercy and good fruits , without partiality , and without hypocrisy .
text2: Ke nunya si tso dziƒo la , gba ̃ la , ele dzadzɛ eye wo ̀ lɔ ̃ a tomefafa , efana na ame bubuwo , ebɔbɔa eɖokui , eye wo ̀ yɔ fu ̃ u kple nublanuikpɔkpɔ . Kpe ɖe esiawo ŋuti la , etsea ku nyuiwo , medea ame dzi o eye wo ̀ wɔa nu si le eteƒe .

text: And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace .
text2: Ŋutifafame siwo ƒa ̃ a ŋutifafa la , xaa dzɔdzɔenyenye ƒe kutsetse .

text: From whence come wars and fightings among you ? come they not hence , even of your lusts that war in your members ?
text2: Nu kae hea avuwɔwɔ kple dzrewɔwɔ vaa mia dome ? Đe menye miaƒe dzimedidi siwo le aʋa wɔm le mia me lae oa ?

text: Ye lust , and have not : ye kill , and desire to have , and cannot obtain : ye fight and war , yet ye have not , because ye ask not .
text2: Miedia nu gake miekpɔnɛ o , miewua ame , xɔa eƒe nuwo , gake nu si dim miele la masu mia si o . Miewɔa dzre eye miewɔa avu ha ̃ gake nuawo mesua mia si o , elabena miebiaa Mawu o .

text: Ye ask , and receive not , because ye ask amiss , that ye may consume it upon your lusts .
text2: Ne miebia la , miaƒe asi mesua edzi o , elabe miebia kple susu vɔ ̃ ɖi , miebia nu siwo miawɔ yakayaka na mìa ɖokuiwo .

text: Ye adulterers and adulteresses , know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God ? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God .
text2: Mi ahasiwɔlawo ! Đe mienya be ne miedze xɔlɔ ̃ kple xexeame la ekema miele ́ fu Mawu oa ? Ame sia ame si dze xɔlɔ ̃ xexeame la nye Mawu ƒe futɔ .

text: Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain , The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy ?
text2: Alo ɖe miesusu be dzodzroe mawunya gblɔ be gbɔgbɔ si wo ̀ de mi ́ a me la ʋa ̃ a ŋu veviea ?

text: But he giveth more grace . Wherefore he saith , God resisteth the proud , but giveth grace unto the humble .
text2: Ke ena amenuveve geɖe mi ́ . Esia ta mawunya gblɔ be , “ Mawu tsia tre ɖe dadalawo ŋu ke evea ame siwo bɔbɔa wo ɖokui ɖe anyi la nu . ”

text: Submit yourselves therefore to God . Resist the devil , and he will flee from you .
text2: Eya ta mibɔbɔ mia ɖokuiwo ɖe Mawu te . Mitsi tre sesi ̃ e ɖe Abosam ŋuti ekema asi le mia nu .

text: Draw nigh to God , and he will draw nigh to you . Cleanse your hands , ye sinners ; and purify your hearts , ye double minded .
text2: Mite ɖe Mawu ŋu kpokploe eye eya ha ̃ atsɔ ɖe mia gbɔ . Mi nu vɔ ̃ wɔlawo miklɔ miaƒe asiwo , eye mi ame siwo nye dzime eve susulawo la miklɔ miaƒe dziwo me .

text: Be afflicted , and mourn , and weep : let your laughter be turned to mourning , and your joy to heaviness .
text2: Mile ́ blanui , mifa konyi eye mifa avi . Mina miaƒe nukoko nazu konyifafa , eye miaƒe dzidzɔkpɔkpɔ nazu blanuile ́ le .

text: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord , and he shall lift you up .
text2: Mibɔbɔ mia ɖokui na Aƒetɔ la ekema ado mi ɖe dzi .

text: Speak not evil one of another , brethren . He that speaketh evil of his brother , and judgeth his brother , speaketh evil of the law , and judgeth the law : but if thou judge the law , thou art not a doer of the law , but a judge .
text2: Nɔviwo , migagble ̃ mia nɔewo ŋu o , ame si gble ̃ nɔvia ŋu alo drɔ ̃ ʋɔnui la , tsi tsitre ɖe se la ŋu hedrɔ ̃ ʋɔnui . Ne e ̀ drɔ ̃ ʋɔnu se la la , me ̀ le edzi wɔm o ke boŋ e ̀ nɔ ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ zikpui dzi hele ʋɔnu drɔ ̃ mii .

text: There is one lawgiver , who is able to save and to destroy : who art thou that judgest another ?
text2: Senala kple ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ la ɖeka koe li , ame si tea ŋu ɖea ame eye wotsrɔ ̃ a ame ha ̃ . Ke wo ̀ la , ame kae ne ̀ nye be na ̃ drɔ ̃ ʋɔnu hawo ̀ vi ?

text: Go to now , ye that say , To day or to morrow we will go into such a city , and continue there a year , and buy and sell , and get gain :
text2: Azɔ la miɖo to afii , mi ame siwo le gbɔgblɔm be , “ Egbe alo etsɔ mi ́ ayi du sia alo ekemɛ me , anɔ anyi ƒe ɖeka , atsa asi eye mi ́ akpɔ ga . ”

text: Whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow . For what is your life ? It is even a vapour , that appeareth for a little time , and then vanisheth away .
text2: Nu ka ta ? Elabena mienya nu si ava dzɔ etsɔ si gbɔna gɔ ̃ ha ̃ o . Nu kae miaƒe agbe nye ? Miele abe afu si dona ɣeyiɣi kpui aɖe eye wo ̀ gabuna la ene .

text: For that ye ought to say , If the Lord will , we shall live , and do this , or that .
text2: Ke boŋ migblɔ bena , “ Nenye Aƒetɔ la ƒe lɔlɔ ̃ nu la , mi ́ anɔ agbe eye mi ́ awɔ nu sia kple ekemɛ . ”

text: But now ye rejoice in your boastings : all such rejoicing is evil .
text2: Ke nu si miewɔna la nye dada kple ɖokuidodo ɖe dzi ƒuƒlu . Adegbeƒoƒo siawo tɔgbi kata ̃ nye nu vɔ ̃ .

text: Therefore to him that knoweth to do good , and doeth it not , to him it is sin .
text2: Eya ta ne ame aɖe nya nu nyui si wo ̀ le be wo ̀ awɔ gake mewɔe o la , ewɔ nu vɔ ̃ .

text: Go to now , ye rich men , weep and howl for your miseries that shall come upon you .
text2: Azɔ la mi kesinɔtɔwo , miɖo to afii , mido ɣli eye mifa avi , le fukpekpe si gbɔna mia dzi va ge la ta .

text: Your riches are corrupted , and your garments are motheaten .
text2: Miaƒe kesinɔnuwo nyunyɔ eye agbagblaʋui ɖu miaƒe avɔ nyuiwo keŋkeŋ .

text: Your gold and silver is cankered ; and the rust of them shall be a witness against you , and shall eat your flesh as it were fire . Ye have heaped treasure together for the last days .
text2: Miaƒe sika kple klosalowo le ́ ɣebia eye woƒe ɣebiale ́ le sia nye ɖaseɖiɖi si tsi tre ɖe mia ŋu hele miaƒe ŋutila ̃ ɖum abe dzo ene . Mieha kesinɔnuwo dzra ɖo fu ̃ u le ŋkeke mamlɛawo me .

text: Behold , the hire of the labourers who have reaped down your fields , which is of you kept back by fraud , crieth : and the cries of them which have reaped are entered into the ears of the Lord of sabaoth .
text2: Mikpɔ ɖa , dɔwɔla siwo ŋlɔ miaƒe agblewo me eye miegbe fexexe na wo la , le avi fam ɖe mia ŋuti . Nenema ke ame siwo xa nu na mi le agble me la ƒe ɣlidodo va ɖo to me na Aƒetɔ Ŋuse ̃ kata ̃ tɔ la .

text: Ye have lived in pleasure on the earth , and been wanton ; ye have nourished your hearts , as in a day of slaughter .
text2: Mienɔ xexea me le agbeɖuɖu blibo me eye mietsɔ mia ɖokuiwo de vivisese geɖe me . Mienyi mia ɖokuiwo heda ami le wuwuŋkeke la lalam .

text: Ye have condemned and killed the just ; and he doth not resist you .
text2: Miebu fɔ amewo eye miewu ame maɖifɔ siwo metsi tre ɖe mia ŋu o .

text: Be patient therefore , brethren , unto the coming of the Lord . Behold , the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth , and hath long patience for it , until he receive the early and latter rain .
text2: Eya ta , nɔvinyewo , migbɔ dzi ɖi blewu va se ɖe Aƒetɔ la ƒe vava . Mienya ale si agbledela lalana na eƒe agblemenukuwo be woatse ku , eye wo ̀ gbɔa dzi ɖi na adametsi kple kelemetsi .

text: Be ye also patient ; stablish your hearts : for the coming of the Lord draweth nigh .
text2: Alea ke wo ̀ le be miawo ha ̃ miagbɔ dzi ɖii eye mianɔ tsitre sesi ̃ e elabe Aƒetɔ la ƒe vava ɖo vɔ .

text: Grudge not one against another , brethren , lest ye be condemned : behold , the judge standeth before the door .
text2: Nɔviwo , migali ̃ liʋiliʋi ̃ le mia nɔewo ŋu o , ne menye nenema o la woadrɔ ̃ ʋɔnu mi . Ʋɔnudrɔ ̃ la la ƒe afɔ le ʋɔtru la nu .

text: Take , my brethren , the prophets , who have spoken in the name of the Lord , for an example of suffering affliction , and of patience .
text2: Nɔviwo , mina Nyagblɔɖila siwo gblɔ Mawu ƒe nya na amewo le Aƒetɔ la ƒe ŋkɔ me la nanye kpɔɖeŋu na mi le fukpekpewo me .

text: Behold , we count them happy which endure . Ye have heard of the patience of Job , and have seen the end of the Lord ; that the Lord is very pitiful , and of tender mercy .
text2: Abe ale si wo ̀ le nyanya me na mi ene la , mi ́ ebua ame siwo do dzi le xaxawo me la be wonye yayramewo . Miese Hiob ƒe dzidodo le fukpekpe me ƒe nyawo , eye mienya ale si Aƒetɔ la wɔ nɛ le nuwuwu . Aƒetɔ la nye dɔmenyotɔ kple nublanuikpɔla ga ̃ aɖe .

text: But above all things , my brethren , swear not , neither by heaven , neither by the earth , neither by any other oath : but let your yea be yea ; and your nay , nay ; lest ye fall into condemnation .
text2: Gawu la , nɔvinyewo , migata nu o , eɖanye kple anyigba loo dziƒo alo nu bubu aɖeke o . Miaƒe e ̃ nanye e ̃ eye miaƒe o nanye o , nemenye nenema o la miadze na ʋɔnudɔdrɔ ̃ .

text: Is any among you afflicted ? let him pray . Is any merry ? let him sing psalms .
text2: Mia dometɔ aɖe le fu kpema ? Nedo gbe ɖa . Mia dometɔ aɖe le dzidzɔ kpɔma ? Nedzi kafukafuhawo .

text: Is any sick among you ? let him call for the elders of the church ; and let them pray over him , anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord :
text2: Ame aɖe le dɔ le ́ m le mia domea ? Neyɔ hanunɔlawo ne woado gbe ɖa ɖe eta eye woasi ami nɛ le Aƒetɔ la ƒe ŋkɔ me .

text: And the prayer of faith shall save the sick , and the Lord shall raise him up ; and if he have committed sins , they shall be forgiven him .
text2: Eye gbe si wodo ɖa le xɔse me la ana be amea ƒe la ̃ me nase ̃ , eye Aƒetɔ la afɔe ɖe tsitre . Ne ewɔ nu vɔ ̃ ha ̃ la , woatsɔe akee .

text: Confess your faults one to another , and pray one for another , that ye may be healed . The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much .
text2: Eya ta miʋu miaƒe nu vɔ ̃ wo me na mia nɔewo eye miado gbe ɖa ɖe mia nɔewo ta be miaƒe la ̃ me nase ̃ . Ame dzɔdzɔe ƒe gbedodoɖa nu se ̃ na eye wo ̀ wɔa dɔ .

text: Elias was a man subject to like passions as we are , and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain : and it rained not on the earth by the space of three years and six months .
text2: Eliya nye amegbetɔ abe mi ́ awo ke ene . Edo gbe ɖa vevie be tsi nagadza o , eye tsi medza o ƒe etɔ ̃ kple afa ̃ sɔŋ .

text: And he prayed again , and the heaven gave rain , and the earth brought forth her fruit .
text2: Emegbe la egado gbe ɖa , dziƒo nu ʋu eye tsi dza ale be anyigba gatse eƒe kutsetsewo .

text: Brethren , if any of you do err from the truth , and one convert him ;
text2: Nɔvinye lɔlɔ ̃ awo , ne mia dometɔ aɖe tra tso nyateƒe la gbɔ eye ame aɖe kplɔe gbɔe la ,

text: Let him know , that he which converteth the sinner from the error of his way shall save a soul from death , and shall hide a multitude of sins .
text2: nenya esia be : ame si na nu vɔ ̃ wɔla trɔ tso eƒe mɔ vɔ ̃ dzi la , aɖee tso ku me eye woatsɔ nu atsyɔ nu vɔ ̃ gbogbo aɖewo dzi .

text: Peter , an apostle of Jesus Christ , to the strangers scattered throughout Pontus , Galatia , Cappadocia , Asia , and Bithynia ,
text2: Yesu Kristo ƒe Apostolo , ŋlɔ ɖo ɖe : Mawu ƒe ametiatia siwo nye amedzrowo le xexea me , ame siwo kaka ɖe Ponto , Galatia , Kapadokia , Asia kple Bitinia nutomewo me ,

text: Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father , through sanctification of the Spirit , unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ : Grace unto you , and peace , be multiplied .
text2: ame siwo wotia le Mawu , Fofo la , ƒe nunyanyaɖi nu , to Gbɔgbɔ la ƒe ŋutikɔklɔ ƒe dɔwɔwɔ me , hena toɖoɖo Yesu Kristo kple eƒe ʋuhehle ̃ la me . Amenuveve kple ŋutifafa nanye mia tɔ le agbɔsɔsɔ me .

text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead ,
text2: Woakafu Mawu , ame si nye mi ́ aƒe Aƒetɔ Yesu Kristo Fofo ! Le eƒe nublanuikpɔkpɔ sɔ gbɔ la ta wo ̀ na gbugbɔgadzi mi ́ ɖe mɔkpɔkpɔ gbagbe me to Yesu Kristo ƒe tsitretsitsi tso ame kukuwo dome me .

text: To an inheritance incorruptible , and undefiled , and that fadeth not away , reserved in heaven for you ,
text2: Eye wo ̀ tsɔ domenyinu si magble ̃ o , si malu ̃ xe alo aklo o la na mi ́ , domenyinu si wodzra ɖo ɖe dziƒo na mi ,

text: Who are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation ready to be revealed in the last time .
text2: ame siwo ŋu wotɔ kpɔ ɖo kple Mawu ƒe akpoxɔnu to xɔse me , va se ɖe esime woaɖe ɖeɖe si wodzra ɖo na nuwuwuɣeyiɣiwo la afia .

text: Wherein ye greatly rejoice , though now for a season , if need be , ye are in heaviness through manifold temptations :
text2: Togbɔ be fifia ele na mi be miaxa nu le dodokpɔ ƒomevi geɖewo me hena ɣeyiɣi ʋee aɖewo ha ̃ la , miele dzidzɔ manyagblɔ kpɔm le mɔkpɔkpɔ sia ta .

text: That the trial of your faith , being much more precious than of gold that perisheth , though it be tried with fire , might be found unto praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ :
text2: Esiawo va mia dzi ale be miaƒe xɔse , si xɔ asi wu sika , si gble ̃ na evɔ wololoe le dzo me hafi , be woakpɔ miaƒe xɔse be enye nyateƒetɔ , ale wo ̀ ahe kafukafu , ŋutikɔkɔe kple bubu vɛ , ne woɖe Yesu Kristo fia .

text: Whom having not seen , ye love ; in whom , though now ye see him not , yet believing , ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory :
text2: Togbɔ be miekpɔe kpɔ o ha ̃ la , mielɔ ̃ e , eye togbɔ be miele ekpɔm fifia o ha ̃ la , miexɔ edzi se eye dzidzɔ manyagblɔ , si ŋuti ŋutikɔkɔe le la yɔ mia me fu ̃ u ,

text: Receiving the end of your faith , even the salvation of your souls .
text2: elabena miele miaƒe xɔse ƒe taɖodzinu si nye miaƒe luʋɔwo ƒe ɖeɖekpɔkpɔ la xɔm .

text: Of which salvation the prophets have inquired and searched diligently , who prophesied of the grace that should come unto you :
text2: Đeɖe sia tae nyagblɔɖila siwo ƒo nu tso amenuveve si le mia dzi va ge ŋuti la ku nugɔme vevie kple bele ́ le tɔxɛ ,

text: Searching what , or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them did signify , when it testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ , and the glory that should follow .
text2: hedze agbagba be woanya ɣeyiɣi kple nudzɔdzɔ si Kristo ƒe Gbɔgbɔ si le wo me la le asi fiamii , esi wo ̀ gblɔ nya ɖi tso Kristo ƒe fukpekpewo kple ŋutikɔkɔe si akplɔe ɖo la ŋuti .

text: Unto whom it was revealed , that not unto themselves , but unto us they did minister the things , which are now reported unto you by them that have preached the gospel unto you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven ; which things the angels desire to look into .
text2: Woɖee fia wo be menye woawo ŋutɔ ɖokuiwo subɔm wole o , ke boŋ miawoe , esi woƒo nu le nu siwo wogblɔ na mi azɔ la ŋuti to ame siwo gblɔ nyanyui la na mi to Gbɔgbɔ Kɔkɔe si wodɔ ɖa tso dziƒo la dzi . Mawudɔlawo gɔ ̃ ha ̃ di vevie be woakpɔ nu siawo me .

text: Wherefore gird up the loins of your mind , be sober , and hope to the end for the grace that is to be brought unto you at the revelation of Jesus Christ ;
text2: Eya ta , midzra miaƒe tamesusuwo ɖo hena afɔɖeɖe , miɖu mia ɖokuiwo dzi , mitsɔ miaƒe mɔkpɔkpɔ kata ̃ da ɖe amenuveve si woana mi ne woɖe Yesu Kristo fia la dzi .

text: As obedient children , not fashioning yourselves according to the former lusts in your ignorance :
text2: Abe vi ɖotowo ene la , migadze dzodzro vɔ ̃ siwo nɔ mia me esi mienɔ agbe le numanyamanya me la yome o .

text: But as he which hath called you is holy , so be ye holy in all manner of conversation ;
text2: Ke boŋ , abe ale si ame si yɔ mi la le Kɔkɔe ene la , miawo ha ̃ minɔ kɔkɔe le nu sia nu si miewɔna la me ,

text: Because it is written , Be ye holy ; for I am holy .
text2: elabena woŋlɔ ɖi be , “ Minɔ kɔkɔe , elabena nye la mele kɔkɔe . ”

text: And if ye call on the Father , who without respect of persons judgeth according to every man ' s work , pass the time of your sojourning here in fear :
text2: Esi mieyɔa Fofo si drɔ ̃ a ʋɔnu ame sia ame ƒe dɔ eye mekpɔa ame ŋkume o la , minɔ agbe abe amedzrowo ene le afii le vɔvɔ ̃ kɔkɔe me .

text: Forasmuch as ye know that ye were not redeemed with corruptible things , as silver and gold , from your vain conversation received by tradition from your fathers ;
text2: Elabena mienyae bena menye sika kple klosalo si gble ̃ na lae wotsɔ xe fe ɖe mia ta heɖe mi tso yakagbe si mia fofowo gble ̃ ɖi na mi la me o ,

text: But with the precious blood of Christ , as of a lamb without blemish and without spot :
text2: ke boŋ kple Kristo ƒe ʋu xɔasi , ame si nye ale ̃ vi si ŋuti mokaka kple kpɔtsɔtsɔ mele o .

text: Who verily was foreordained before the foundation of the world , but was manifest in these last times for you ,
text2: Wotiae hafi wova wɔ xexeame gake woɖee fia le ɣeyiɣi mamlɛatɔ siawo me le mia ta .

text: Who by him do believe in God , that raised him up from the dead , and gave him glory ; that your faith and hope might be in God .
text2: To eya amea dzi miexɔ Mawu dzi se , ame si fɔe tso ame kukuwo dome , hetsɔ ŋutikɔkɔe ɖɔnɛ , ale miaƒe xɔse kple mɔkpɔkpɔ le Mawu me .

text: Seeing ye have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit unto unfeigned love of the brethren , see that ye love one another with a pure heart fervently :
text2: Azɔ esi miekɔ mia ɖokuiwo ŋu to toɖoɖo nyateƒea me be lɔlɔ ̃ sime alakpa mele o la nanɔ mia si na mia nɔviwo ŋuti la , milɔ ̃ mia nɔewo vevie tso dzi me ke .

text: Being born again , not of corruptible seed , but of incorruptible , by the word of God , which liveth and abideth for ever .
text2: Elabena wogbugbɔ mi gadzi , menye tso ku gbegble ̃ me o , ke boŋ tso ku magble ̃ magble ̃ me , to Mawu ƒe nya si le agbe eye wo ̀ nɔa anyi tegbetegbe la me .

text: For all flesh is as grass , and all the glory of man as the flower of grass . The grass withereth , and the flower thereof falleth away :
text2: Elabena , “ Amegbetɔwo kata ̃ le abe gbe ene , eye woƒe atsyɔ le abe seƒoƒo le gbeme ene , gbe ƒuna eye seƒoƒo yrɔna , gena ,

text: But the word of the Lord endureth for ever . And this is the word which by the gospel is preached unto you .
text2: ke Aƒetɔ la ƒe nya nɔa anyi yi ɖe mavɔ me . ” Ke esiae nye nya si wogblɔ na mi .

text: Wherefore laying aside all malice , and all guile , and hypocrisies , and envies , and all evil speakings ,
text2: Eya ta miɖe vɔ ̃ ɖoɖo ɖe ame ŋu kple beble kata ̃ ɖa le mia ɖokuiwo ŋu , nenema ke nye , alakpanuwɔwɔ , ŋubiabia ̃ kple ameŋugbegble ̃ ƒomevi ɖe sia ɖe ɖa .

text: As newborn babes , desire the sincere milk of the word , that ye may grow thereby :
text2: Eye abe vidzi ̃ ewo ene la , midi gbɔgbɔ me notsi vevie ale be to esia dzi miatsi le miaƒe ɖeɖe la me ,

text: If so be ye have tasted that the Lord is gracious .
text2: esi azɔ mieɖɔe kpɔ , henya be Aƒetɔ la nyo .

text: To whom coming , as unto a living stone , disallowed indeed of men , but chosen of God , and precious ,
text2: Esi mieva eya amea sinye kpe gbagbe , kpe si amewo gbe , evɔ Mawu tiae eye wo ̀ xɔ asi nɛ ŋutɔ la ,

text: Ye also , as lively stones , are built up a spiritual house , an holy priesthood , to offer up spiritual sacrifices , acceptable to God by Jesus Christ .
text2: miawo ha ̃ , abe kpe gbagbewo ene la , wotsɔ mi le gbɔgbɔ me xɔ tumii be mianye Osɔfo Kɔkɔewo , ame siwo asa gbɔgbɔ me vɔ siwo dze Mawu ŋu la to Yesu Kristo dzi .

text: Wherefore also it is contained in the scripture , Behold , I lay in Sion a chief corner stone , elect , precious : and he that believeth on him shall not be confounded .
text2: Elabena wogblɔ le mawunya me be , “ Kpɔ ɖa mele kpe aɖe ɖom ɖe Zion , dzogoedzikpe si wotia eye asixɔxɔ le eŋu , ame si atsɔ eƒe mɔkpɔkpɔ ada ɖe edzi la , ŋu mele ekpe ge akpɔ gbeɖe o . ”

text: Unto you therefore which believe he is precious : but unto them which be disobedient , the stone which the builders disallowed , the same is made the head of the corner ,
text2: Azɔ la hena mi ame siwo xɔse la , kpe sia nye kpe xɔasi na mi . Ke na ame siwo mexɔe se o la , “ Kpe si xɔtulawo gbe la , eyae va zu dzogoeɖokpe ,

text: And a stone of stumbling , and a rock of offence , even to them which stumble at the word , being disobedient : whereunto also they were appointed .
text2: kpe si naa amewo klia nu eye wo ̀ nye agakpe si naa wodzea anyi , ” Woklia nu elabena wogbe toɖoɖo nyanyui la , esi ha ̃ nye nu si woɖo wo ɖi na .

text: But ye are a chosen generation , a royal priesthood , an holy nation , a peculiar people ; that ye should shew forth the praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light :
text2: Ke miawo la mienye ame tiatiawo , Fia kple Osɔfowo , dukɔ kɔkɔe , ame siwo nye Mawu ŋutɔ tɔ , be miaɖe gbeƒa ̃ ame si yɔ mi tso viviti me va eƒe nuku kekeli me la ƒe kafukafu .

text: Which in time past were not a people , but are now the people of God : which had not obtained mercy , but now have obtained mercy .
text2: Tsa ̃ la mienye dukɔ o , ke azɔ la , miezu Mawu ƒe dukɔ , tsa ̃ la womekpɔ nublanui na mi o , ke azɔ la wokpɔ nublanui na mi .

text: Dearly beloved , I beseech you as strangers and pilgrims , abstain from fleshly lusts , which war against the soul ;
text2: Nɔvi veviwo , mele eƒom ɖe mia nu be , abe amedzrowo kple mɔzɔlawo le xexeame ene la , be miaɖe ɖa xaa tso dzodzro vɔ ̃ siwo wɔa aʋa kple miaƒe luʋɔ la gbɔ .

text: Having your conversation honest among the Gentiles : that , whereas they speak against you as evildoers , they may by your good works , which they shall behold , glorify God in the day of visitation .
text2: Minɔ agbe dzadzɛ le Trɔ ̃ subɔlawo dome ale gbegbe be , togbɔ be wotsoa mia nu be miewɔ vɔ ̃ ha ̃ la , woakpɔ miaƒe dɔ nyuiwo eye woakafu Mawu le ŋkeke si dzi wo ̀ ava asra mi ́ akpɔ .

text: Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord ' s sake : whether it be to the king , as supreme ;
text2: Le Aƒetɔ la ta la , mibɔbɔ mia ɖokuiwo na dziɖuɖu si woɖo anyi ɖe amegbetɔwo dome , eɖanye fia la , abe ŋuse ̃ tɔ kɔkɔtɔ kekeake ene ,

text: Or unto governors , as unto them that are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers , and for the praise of them that do well .
text2: alo gɔvina siwo woɖo ɖa be woahe to na nu gbegble ̃ wɔlawo eye woakafu nu nyui wɔlawo o .

text: For so is the will of God , that with well doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men :
text2: Elabena Mawu ƒe lɔlɔ ̃ nue wo ̀ nye be , to nu nyui wɔwɔ me la miatsi bometsilawo ƒe numanyamanya ƒe nuƒoawo nu .

text: As free , and not using your liberty for a cloke of maliciousness , but as the servants of God .
text2: Minɔ agbe abe ablɔɖeviwo ene , gake migawɔ miaƒe ablɔɖe la ŋutidɔ abe mɔɖeɖe na nu vɔ ̃ wɔwɔ ene o ; minɔ agbe abe Mawu ƒe dɔlawo ene .

text: Honour all men . Love the brotherhood . Fear God . Honour the king .
text2: Mitsɔ bubu deto na ame sia ame , milɔ ̃ habɔbɔ kple xɔsetɔwo , mivɔ ̃ Mawu eye mitsɔ bubu na fia la .

text: Servants , be subject to your masters with all fear ; not only to the good and gentle , but also to the froward .
text2: Mi kluviwo la , mibɔbɔ mia ɖokuiwo na miaƒe aƒetɔwo le bubudede ame ŋu kata ̃ me , menye na esiwo nyo eye wobua mia ŋuti ɖeɖeko o , ke boŋ na esiwo nye tamesese ̃ tɔwo ha ̃ .

text: For this is thankworthy , if a man for conscience toward God endure grief , suffering wrongfully .
text2: Elabena enye nudzeame ne ame aɖe tsɔ vevesese tsɔ fukpekpe si medze na hafi o la , le esi wo ̀ nya Mawu ta .

text: For what glory is it , if , when ye be buffeted for your faults , ye shall take it patiently ? but if , when ye do well , and suffer for it , ye take it patiently , this is acceptable with God .
text2: Gake viɖe ka wo ̀ anye na mi ne woƒo mi ɖe vɔ ̃ si miewɔ la ta eye miedo dzi tsɔe ? Ke ne miekpe fu le nyuiwɔwɔ ta , eye miedo dzi tsɔe la enye nudzeame le Mawu gbɔ .

text: For even hereunto were ye called : because Christ also suffered for us , leaving us an example , that ye should follow his steps :
text2: Esia tae woyɔ mi vɛ ɖo , elabena Kristo kpe fu ɖe mia ta , eye wo ̀ gble ̃ kpɔɖeŋu ɖi na mi , be miadze eyome ato eƒe afɔtoƒe .

text: Who did no sin , neither was guile found in his mouth :
text2: ” Elabena mewɔ vɔ ̃ aɖeke o eye womekpɔ alakpa aɖeke le eƒe nu me o . ”

text: Who , when he was reviled , reviled not again ; when he suffered , he threatened not ; but committed himself to him that judgeth righteously :
text2: Esi woflɔ dzu ɖe edzi la , meɖo eŋu o , esi wokpe fu la meƒo fi de ame o . Ke boŋ etsɔ eɖokui de asi na ame si drɔ ̃ a ʋɔnu dzɔdzɔe .

text: Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree , that we , being dead to sins , should live unto righteousness : by whose stripes ye were healed .
text2: Ke eya ŋutɔ tsɔ mi ́ aƒe nu vɔ ̃ wo ɖe eƒe ŋutila ̃ me le ati ŋuti , ale be mi ́ aku na nu vɔ ̃ eye mi ́ anɔ agbe na dzɔdzɔenyenye , to eƒe abi si woxɔ me , miekpɔ dɔyɔyɔ .

text: For ye were as sheep going astray ; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls .
text2: Elabena mienɔ abe ale ̃ siwo tra mɔ la ene , ke azɔ la mietrɔ gbɔ va Ale ̃ kplɔla la kple miaƒe luʋɔwo Dzikpɔla la gbɔ .

text: Likewise , ye wives , be in subjection to your own husbands ; that , if any obey not the word , they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives ;
text2: Nenema ke mi srɔ ̃ nyɔnuwo mibɔbɔ mia ɖokuiwo na mia srɔ ̃ wo ale be ne wo dometɔ aɖewo mexɔ nya la dzi se o la , to wo srɔ ̃ nyɔnuwo ƒe agbe ɖɔʋu nɔnɔ me la , woakpɔ ɖeɖe nya aɖeke magblɔmagblɔ na woe ,

text: While they behold your chaste conversation coupled with fear .
text2: ne wokpɔ dzadzɛnyenye kple bubu si le woƒe agbe me

text: Whose adorning let it not be that outward adorning of plaiting the hair , and of wearing of gold , or of putting on of apparel ;
text2: Miaƒe tugbedzedze megatso gota lekewɔwɔ me , abe ɖa ŋɔŋɔe ƒoƒo , sikanuwo dodo kple avɔ xɔasiwo tata me ene o .

text: But let it be the hidden man of the heart , in that which is not corruptible , even the ornament of a meek and quiet spirit , which is in the sight of God of great price .
text2: Ke boŋ miaƒe tugbedzedze nanye ememetɔ tugbedzedze malu ̃ xe sinye tufafa kple bɔbɔenyenye ƒe gbɔgbɔ , si xɔasi le Mawu ŋkume ŋutɔ .

text: For after this manner in the old time the holy women also , who trusted in God , adorned themselves , being in subjection unto their own husbands :
text2: Elabena aleae nyɔnu kɔkɔe , siwo nɔ anyi le blema , esiwo tsɔ woƒe mɔkpɔkpɔ da ɖe Mawu dzi la wɔa leke na wo ɖokuiwoe . Wobɔbɔ wo ɖokuiwo na woawo ŋutɔ srɔ ̃ wo .

text: Even as Sara obeyed Abraham , calling him lord : whose daughters ye are , as long as ye do well , and are not afraid with any amazement .
text2: abe ale si Sara bɔbɔ eɖokui na Abraham eye wo ̀ yɔe be aƒetɔ la ene . Mienye vianyɔnuwo ne miewɔ nu dzɔdzɔe eye mieɖe mɔ na vɔvɔ ̃ o .

text: Likewise , ye husbands , dwell with them according to knowledge , giving honour unto the wife , as unto the weaker vessel , and as being heirs together of the grace of life ; that your prayers be not hindered .
text2: Nenema ke , mi srɔ ̃ ŋutsuwo minɔ anyi kple mia srɔ ̃ wo le nunya me , mide bubu wo ŋu , elabena wonye gbɔdzɔgbɔdzɔtɔwo eye wonye domenyilawo kpli mi le amenuveve nunana sinye agbe si wona mi , ale be naneke maxe mɔ na miaƒe gbedodoɖawo o .

text: Finally , be ye all of one mind , having compassion one of another , love as brethren , be pitiful , be courteous :
text2: Mlɔeba la , mi kata ̃ minɔ anyi kple mia nɔewo le ɖekawɔwɔ me , ame nu newɔ nublanui na mi , milɔ ̃ mia nɔewo abe dadaviwo ene , minyo dɔme na amewo eye mibɔbɔ mia ɖokui .

text: Not rendering evil for evil , or railing for railing : but contrariwise blessing ; knowing that ye are thereunto called , that ye should inherit a blessing .
text2: Migatsɔ vɔ ̃ ɖo vɔ ̃ teƒe alo dzudzu ɖo dzudzu teƒe o , ke boŋ miɖo teƒe na wo kple yayra , elabena esia tae woyɔ mi vɛ ɖo be mianyi yayra ƒe dome .

text: For he that will love life , and see good days , let him refrain his tongue from evil , and his lips that they speak no guile :
text2: Elabena , “ Ame si lɔ ̃ agbe eye wo ̀ di be yeakpɔ ŋkeke nyuiwo la , nele ́ eƒe aɖe be magblɔ nya vɔ ̃ aɖeke o , kple eƒe nu , be magblɔ beble nya aɖeke o .

text: Let him eschew evil , and do good ; let him seek peace , and ensue it .
text2: Ele nɛ be wo ̀ aɖe asi le vɔ ̃ ŋu awɔ nyui eye wo ̀ adi ŋutifafa ati eyome .
